story:
What You'll Love About Aduco

The founding members of Aduco realized that they all had one major thing in commmon, student loans. Aduco was created to offer a solution to those hoping to earn an education through a certification, but not go into massive amounts of debt.

Because many of the founding members of Aduco are former educators from top-schools, high-quality education is at the core of what we do. We use many of the same learning methods and resources as traditional universities, but costs have been dramtically reduced. In addition to reducing costs, each student learns from a professor and is paired with an industry expert mentor. These mentors work with students one-on-one to help them apply the principles learned in class into real-world application.

Aduco started with a simple mission: make education affordable, flexible, and accessible to every student, everywhere. This mission motivates us to reduce the costs of traditional business schools, while retaining top teaching and mentoring talent.

Your contributions will not only benefit your education, but provide Aduco with the needed funds to deliver this education through learning systems, applications, server space, professors, mentors, and staff.

Benefit By Becoming an Early Bird

Technically, you'll become an Aduco Fox, smart and clever just like our mascot, Quinn. But you should become an Early Bird as well. Sign up for a course now, and take advantage of our Early Bird Offer by saving up to 30%! Purchase multiple courses to save up to 30% on your entire certification!

Make An Impact

Your support, whether through taking courses or donating to our mission, will have a large impact on education. In many parts of the world, students are seeking alternatives to traditional business schools to reduce the impact of student loans.

Aduco offers high-quality education through certification programs at realistic prices with more flexibility than traditional options. Your efforts will have a large impact on education globally. 

 

How It Works

1. Discover

Explore our disciplines below and determine whether our Gold, Silver, or Bronze certification is right for you. 

2. Apply

Applying is fast, easy, and free! Upon purchasing a course or certification program, our student services team will in touch to verify your background for admission.

3. Enroll

Enrolling is easy with our quarterly rolling admissions. You can enroll in up to 4 courses per quarter to complete your certification quickly. Each self-paced course takes up to 12 weeks to complete.

4. Finalize Your Admission

Work with your Admission Representative to finalize your admission. Ask questions, get answers, and prepare for success.

5. Meet Your Mentor 

A highly experienced Aduco mentor will guide you through your coursework, monitor your progress, and provide guidance as you navigate our certification program. Your final project, which will be completed as you move through each course of the certification, is designed by experienced industry experts to mirror real-world tasks.

For example, students in the Silver Marketing Certification complete sections of a detailed marketing plan in each of the seven marketing courses and end with a full marketing plan as their final project.

The Gold certification, a case-based curriculum, has projects built into each course.

6. Stay Connected

Connect with other students in your courses via exclusive access to an interactive social platform where you can collaborate, see updates and videos from classmates and mentors, and more.

7. Earn Your Certification 

Complete all the requirements and receive your Aduco certification.

 

Professors and Mentors

We are highly selective of our professors and mentors because we want each student to learn the skills they need to advance in their careers. Aduco Professors and Mentors are selected based on years of successful industry experience and their ability to teach and mentor students.

If you have questions about Professors and Mentors, please see their profiles listed on our website.

 

Gold Certification (10 Total Courses)

The Gold Level was developed for students with a minimum of seven years of work experience who are seeking to or have recently become directors. These students will also have completed a degree or certification.

With a case-based curriculum and professors and mentors with 15+ years of experience, this certification will deepen your knowledge and grow your leadership skills to help you manage your organization's most difficult strategic problems.

The depth and difficulty of these courses would be comparable to a 600-level master's degree course at a university designed for directors and executives.

See our website for more information about courses.

 

Silver Certification (7 Total Courses)

The Silver Level was developed for students with a minimum of five years of work experience who are seeking to or have recently become managers. These students will also have completed a degree or certification.

This certification will deepen your knowledge of finance, marketing, supply chain, or operations and grow your leadership skills to help you continue to advance in your organization.

The depth and difficulty of these courses would be comparable to a 500-level master's degree course at a university.

See our website for more information about courses.

 

Bronze Certification (4 Total Courses)

The Bronze Level was developed for students with little to no secondary education or certifications who are seeking a foundational knowledge of finance, marketing, supply chain, or operations. This certification will deepen your knowledge and grow your leadership skills to help you continue to advance in your organization.

The depth and difficulty of these courses would be comparable to a 300- or 400-level undergraduate course at a university.

See our website for more information about courses.

story:
Who we are

We are high school students from FPT High School, Viet Nam, who is passionate with robotics. As for the upcoming 2017 FIRST Global Challenge, we represent Vietnam to participate and compete with over 165 countries across the world.

On the other hand, we have seen plenty of IoT communities for young children, engineers and entrepreneurs, but none for us teenagers. Together with MakerHanoi - one of the Fab Labs in Vietnam, we are planning to create the first Vietnamese robotics community that focuses on high school students.

_______________________

What is FIRST Global?

FIRST Global organizes a yearly international robotics challenge for high school students with different backgrounds, languages, religions, and customs. By doing so, FIRST Global hope to bring the importance, excitement, and applicability of STEM education to more than two billion youths across the world.

"Access to clean water" is the grand theme for FIRST Global Challenge 2017. The game is to reflect how the world should work together to solve water crisis.

(For more info, visit http://first.global/fgc/global-first-challenge/)

_______________________

Team Vietnam's Robot at FIRST Global Challenge

This is the first time we participate in an international competition, so we have to put in our best effort. With the help of our mentor, the robot is now completed.

_______________________

What We Need

We are raising an initial fund of $1000. This is to purchase all the additional tools for building and maintaining our robot, build the practice game field, and cover all expenses we have during the game, such as transportation, accommodation, etc.

The targeted money is setting to be a fixed goal, that means if we cannot reach our goal, all money donated will be sent back to backers, without any fee. In that case, we will have to cover these expenses from our pocket.

_______________________

The Impact

FIRST Global Challenge isn't just about competing: it's about collaboration, engagement, and development of STEM. By donating, you're helping us getting closer to our success in the game and contributing to STEM community in Vietnam and all around the world.

In the community level, your donations will help us spread the word about FIRST Global Challenge. This plays a crucial role as we are planning to create similar robotics competition in Vietnam for high school students.

_______________________

What You Get

  • For donating $10, you will get a personalized thank-you mail from us.
  • For donating $25, you will get all documents about FIRST Global Challenge we have throughout the event. These include FIRST Robot Kit Manual, Game Design, and more.
  • For donating $50, you will have our official Team Vietnam's T-shirt and the documents.
  • For donating $100, you will get all the documents and video, together with a 3D-printed figure made by us. (If you are Vietnamese, the documents will be translated and delivered to you in both Vietnamese and English).
  • For donating $300, you will have all the above perks, plus a training day at MakerHanoi (if you are currently in Hanoi, Vietnam)
  • For donating $500, we will invite you to join us for dinner! You can have a chance to meet and have a chit-chat with us from robotics to whatever you like! Plus you will have all the above perks (except for $300's exclusive features)
  • For donating $1000, you will become one of our sponsors! We will have your name and/or brand on all our future projects and products. Plus you will have all the above perks, (except for $300 and $500's exclusive features).

_______________________

Other Ways You Can Help

There are more ways to contribute than just donations: you can help us spread the word about this campaign by sharing on social media and / or telling those with interest in IoT, STEM and robotics.

story:
Qbi's Building block toys encourage children to interact and play with their parents and peers to develop a sense of logical thinking, Spatial orientation, creativity, Interactive communication, teamwork and overall social skills.

 

Qbi's track square toy is a constructive magnetic toy that can be expanded infinitely. Through a unique structure design, a toy platform with a high degree of ingenuity, creative change, and multiple interactions can be constructed. Qbi's track-square toy has obtained Taiwan's invention patent rights and has applied for patents in three regions of the United States, the European Union and mainland China.

The QBI Modular building block encourages parent /child peer/child interaction. Choose from a set of different scenes to build, or create your own custom scene.

 

Qbi's toy-track block platform is a very simple, easy to use, and interactive child educational toy. The track square is a six-sided track. Each track can be freely connected. The square and the block are connected by magnetic force. It is easy to assemble and transform.

Connect the magnetic blocks with two or more blocks of the same side or different sides.

Let your imagination run wild and create dozens of road options with our complete building Kit!

 

You can create different interactive experiences. The Qbi Toy also offers challenge cards to expand the depth and difficulty of the game.

 

With game modes varying, from single player, double player or multiplayer, there are many more options to choose from. Parent-Child or Child-Peer interaction.

Worried that some parts might not be safe for your little ones? Or what about the material used?No need to worry! We are happy to say that According to SGS, Qbi Toy meets the standards and requirements for children’s toys in the US and EU.  

You can learn more about SGS, their mission and expertise here

 

Children learn how to arrange the combination of tracks from the picture shown.

The grey square matt shows minor hints at a few key track block positions.The children use their imagination to complete the track.

Free-range play! Children do not look at the challenge card. They create their own tracks and find ways to let the car run completely through the tracks.

 

Playing with blocks helps children develop their vocabularies, logical thinking, developed social skills and develop spatial awareness. They learn how to describe colors, shapes, sizes, and positions as they build various structures.

 

  • Be amongst the first to experience Qbitoy’s new products and new accessories in advance.
  • Before the new product is officially launched, the VIP backers can own the newest Qbitoy by paying the cost price and shipping cost only!

 

Anyone who participates in the sponsorship event will receive exclusive new gameplay content and new accessories information via email in the future so that the track squares can be continuously expanded and create new game experiences.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Founded at the end of 2016, Qbi is a team of young Taiwanese parents. We believe that toys are the best bridge for children to cultivate interactive relationships. Through toys, not only can they stimulate imagination and creativity, but through multi-dimensional and creative interaction, they can cultivate parent-child interaction.

Therefore, we are committed to design and development-related interactive experiences. It is expected to create a world of track-square toys that parents and children play together and learn together.

 

 

 

What's Qbi?

Qbi was established at the end of 2016 and consists of a group of young Taiwanese parents. We believe that toys are the best bridge for children to develop interactive relationships, so we are committed to designing and developing relevant interactive experiences.

What is the difference between the educational toys on the market?

The Qbi block is a toy developed for parent-child interaction. After nearly 2 years of testing and modification, the Qbi block is an educational toy that is suitable for many people to play together. It is not only easy to use and interact with, but also rich in variability. Parents and children have fun playing together.

Product sources and materials?

In order to ensure the quality of products, from design to production and production are all in the team's location in Taiwan so that we can more accurately grasp all the details of the product. Qbi blocks and accessories are mainly plastics, magnets, and metals, and their component specifications are inspected and qualified in conformity with EU children's toys specifications.

Are the magnet and magnetic force of the toy dangerous?
What age group is the Qbi Toy Suitable for?

Children over the age of 3 years old can play with the Qbi Toy. 4-8 years old is the most suitable since they can use the challenge card to carry out three-dimensional space and logic training, more than 8 years old for more creative and difficult challenge tasks, even if the adults are playing together.

How do I operate the Qbi Toy? Is there a brochure or video?

Both the basic and advanced models offered here are accompanied by game instructions. The official website also provides basic instructions for operation.

What if some parts are missing or damaged?

The product is expected to be on sale in 2019, and any accessory can be purchased on the online shopping platform or physical storefront.

How to do I save and clean the Qbi Toy?

Qbi's toys are designed for indoor use, as long as they are used indoors, they can be stored for long periods of time. When cleaning, it is recommended to use clean water or alcohol to clean it. You can also use skin-friendly detergent to clean it and rinse it with clean water. Please avoid using strong detergents or chemical liquids for cleaning.

Will Qbi Toy continue to provide new games or toy cars and game accessories?

Yes, we hope that the new gameplay and accessories will bring more interactive experiences to parents and children. Qbi expects to launch a variety of different versions of toy cars each year, and these toy cars can all run on the same square. Any new gameplay and accessories will be announced on Qbitoy.com

Is there an official website?

Any information about the product can be searched on Qbitoy.com

Is there a warranty period?

The sponsorship did not provide warranty service because the warranty price was not included in the sponsorship price. The warranty will be provided when the product is officially marketed, but its price will be higher than the price purchased on indiegogo. But this time we still provide limited conditions of return service. As long as we find that there are serious defects that are not artificially damaged within 7 days after receiving our products, we will provide free replacement services. These tips include: The box is not magnetic, the gear structure of the toy vehicle is broken, and the tire of the toy vehicle falls off.

What is the shipping cost of the product?

Shipping charges will be calculated from the distances sent from Taiwan. We will use the shipping method to deliver the actual shipping charges. When you fill out the payment file, you can check the shipping cost by checking the country.

Is there a problem with customs taxation?

All customs taxation will be absorbed by Qbi.

Damaged in transit can be replaced?

In this sponsoring event, we will provide free replacement services as long as we find that there are serious non-human damages within 7 days of receiving our products.

Can I choose a box with other colors?

In our current crowdfunding campaign, we will only provide squares in four colors. In the future, with the development of new themes, Qbi will continue to introduce more styles of colors, these new colors can also be purchased in the future through the purchase of accessories.

Will the new game challenge card continue to be offered?

Qbi will continue to launch game card challenges with different difficulty levels. Anyone who participates in this sponsorship can get the exclusive challenge card electronic file from email, and can download new questions if they download and print. In addition, better quality and more durable challenge cards will also be sold in accessories.

What is the teaching plan?

Qbi has partnered with the National Taipei University of Education to develop exclusive teaching content for Qbitoy. The goal is to enable children to gain more meaningful learning experiences through growth and development through Qbitoy. The teaching plan will eventually be launched in the form of a physical course with digital content. We hope to promote these courses to all places as soon as possible, and all the sponsors who participated in the fundraising will receive the latest news of the course in the first time.

What are the audio and video content?

After the successful fundraising, Qbi plans to prepare a short film of Qbitoy's teaching games. Each video is about 1 minute long. These videos include creative gameplay, game teaching, and competition rules. We hope to convey new ideas through videos and guide parents to play Qbitoy with their children so that fun can last forever.

What are the items in the accessory system?

Qbitoy's basic platform is a track square, and the track on the square can perform various types of toy cars. The first version of the accessories is the inertia gear toy car and parking garage in this combination. In the future, we will continue to develop new models and toy vehicles with different power sources, such as electric cars, program control cars, and other accessories other than cars. Can be used on any track square.

When is Qbi Toy expected to go on sale?

If all goes well, Qbitoy will begin to officially sell in the first half of 2019 according to the schedule. We will announce the latest news about the listing on the official website.

Will the board game kit be developed?

Qbitoy's toys are versatile and suitable for children above the senior level and even adults. In the future, we will continue to develop a variety of gameplay and accessories, including board games and board games accessories. Those who have purchased a toy group can upgrade their toys into a variety of fun board games by purchasing additional board game accessories.

Is it suitable for children under 3 years old?

Qbi's toy car is designed for children over 3 years old, so it is not recommended for children under 3 years old.

Will there be relevant courses to register for learning?

We are working hard to make Qbitoy grow steadily. The teaching curriculum is also our core program. The purpose of our teaching plan is to launch a physical course to allow family members with Qbitoy to sign up. The detailed timeline has not yet been determined, but we hope that the course design will be completed by the end of 2019 and the course will be officially launched.

In what areas will the market be sold in the future?

In the first half of 2019, we plan to start selling on Amazon. Any area that can be purchased on Amazon can buy Qbotoy. In the rest of the region, we will work hard to find agents to cooperate, so that people who love Qbitoy all over the world can purchase Qbitoy in the most convenient way.

Can it arrive before Christmas at the end of 2018?

We expect production to begin in October. If everything is in control, there is a chance to send it to the sponsor's address at the end of the year or early next year, but there is no guarantee that it will arrive before Christmas. If there is any news about production and shipment, we will make any announcements on the Facebook professional to let the sponsors master and understand the latest progress.

These tips include: The box is not magnetic, the gear structure of the toy vehicle is broken, and the tire of the toy vehicle falls off. What is the shipping cost of the product?    Shipping charges will be calculated from the distances sent from Taiwan. We will use the shipping method to deliver the actual shipping charges. When you fill out the payment file, you can check the shipping cost by checking the country. Is there a problem with customs taxation?    All customs taxation will be absorbed by Qbi. Damaged in transit can be replaced?    In this sponsoring event, we will provide free replacement services as long as we find that there are serious non-human damages within 7 days of receiving our products. Can I choose a box with other colors?    In our current crowdfunding campaign, we will only provide squares in four colors. In the future, with the development of new themes, Qbi will continue to introduce more styles of colors, these new colors can also be purchased in the future through the purchase of accessories. Will the new game challenge card continue to be offered?    Qbi will continue to launch game card challenges with different difficulty levels. Anyone who participates in this sponsorship can get the exclusive challenge card electronic file from email, and can download new questions if they download and print. In addition, better quality and more durable challenge cards will also be sold in accessories. What is the teaching plan?    Qbi has partnered with the National Taipei University of Education to develop exclusive teaching content for Qbitoy. The goal is to enable children to gain more meaningful learning experiences through growth and development through Qbitoy. The teaching plan will eventually be launched in the form of a physical course with digital content. We hope to promote these courses to all places as soon as possible, and all the sponsors who participated in the fundraising will receive the latest news of the course in the first time. What are the audio and video content?    After the successful fundraising, Qbi plans to prepare a short film of Qbitoy's teaching games. Each video is about 1 minute long. These videos include creative gameplay, game teaching, and competition rules. We hope to convey new ideas through videos and guide parents to play Qbitoy with their children so that fun can last forever. What are the items in the accessory system?    Qbitoy's basic platform is a track square, and the track on the square can perform various types of toy cars. The first version of the accessories is the inertia gear toy car and parking garage in this combination. In the future, we will continue to develop new models and toy vehicles with different power sources, such as electric cars, program control cars, and other accessories other than cars. Can be used on any track square. When is Qbi Toy expected to go on sale?    If all goes well, Qbitoy will begin to officially sell in the first half of 2019 according to the schedule. We will announce the latest news about the listing on the official website. Will the board game kit be developed?    Qbitoy's toys are versatile and suitable for children above the senior level and even adults. In the future, we will continue to develop a variety of gameplay and accessories, including board games and board games accessories. Those who have purchased a toy group can upgrade their toys into a variety of fun board games by purchasing additional board game accessories. Is it suitable for children under 3 years old?    Qbi's toy car is designed for children over 3 years old, so it is not recommended for children under 3 years old. Will there be relevant courses to register for learning?    We are working hard to make Qbitoy grow steadily. The teaching curriculum is also our core program. The purpose of our teaching plan is to launch a physical course to allow family members with Qbitoy to sign up. The detailed timeline has not yet been determined, but we hope that the course design will be completed by the end of 2019 and the course will be officially launched. In what areas will the market be sold in the future?    In the first half of 2019, we plan to start selling on Amazon. Any area that can be purchased on Amazon can buy Qbotoy. In the rest of the region, we will work hard to find agents to cooperate, so that people who love Qbitoy all over the world can purchase Qbitoy in the most convenient way. Can it arrive before Christmas at the end of 2018?    We expect production to begin in October. If everything is in control, there is a chance to send it to the sponsor's address at the end of the year or early next year, but there is no guarantee that it will arrive before Christmas. If there is any news about production and shipment, we will make any announcements on the Facebook professional to let the sponsors master and understand the latest progress.

story:
Playworks for Lakeshore 

Almost every day there are stories about things happening during recess. Kids' feelings get bruised, rules aren't followed and sometimes there's even bullying. We can do better. By hiring a full-time Playworks coach, recess will be greatly improved. Students are on the recess yard, two or three times a day, depending on their grade level. We can make recess a much more constructive and inclusive time for all our kids. 

  • I'm a parent who wants Lakeshore to be the best it can be. 
  • I know Playworks will make the school a better place and want to make it a reality.
  • Your contribution will help us make it happen. Thank you for your support!

How much does it cost?

Roughly 60 percent of the students at Lakeshore qualify for free or reduced lunch. That means we can get Playworks for about half of what it would cost at a more affluent school.  

  • $32,000 pays for a full-time coach who will be there all day, every day, to help guide the students during recess and in other settings.  
  • The program also includes junior coaches -- 4th and 5th graders who assist younger kids in resolving conflicts. 
  • All funds go to the PTA, which will pay Playworks. 

Playworks Works!

In the most recent national survey of 5952 principals, teachers and staff in schools that partnered with Play works, 96% reported an increase in the level of participation in academic activities. Ninety-six percent also reported an increase in the level of cooperation with others in class. Other results include:

  • an 85% reduction in bullying incidents
  • a 95% increase in the use of conflict resolution strategies 
  • an 83% reduction in disciplinary incidents

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Make some noise about our campaign!
  • Please share our campaign far and wide with friends, colleagues and family

story:
Kort oppsummering

Bachelor How er et prosjekt der jeg skal gjennom en Bacheloroppgave, der jeg vil bruke oppgaven som et eksempel på hvordan en folkefinansieringskampanje kan oppleves. Det som kanskje er mer interresant for dere backere, er at dere også kan få et innblikk i hva nøyaktig en Bacheloroppgave går ut på, noe jeg har opplevd at svært få egentlig gjør.

Og dere vil få et innblikk i utviklingen av nervøse sammenbrudd ettersom vi går fremover.

Jeg skal ta opp alt arbeidet med Go-Pro, og mot slutten av oppgaven vil jeg  samle sammen all film jeg her tatt gjennom disse månedene, og lage en timelapse av nettopp en Bachelor.

Hva jeg trenger, og hva du får

Her er målet å samle penger til musikk som kan legges til timelapsen som er planlagt. Dersom denne kampanjen lykkes, vil du også få tilgang til timelapsen, og andre perks.

Dersom målet ikke nås, får jeg litt ekstra i lommeboken, men kun de som har backet vil få tilgang til videoen, og andre perks. Minus musikk.

Påvirkningen

Jeg syntes det er et spennende prosjekt, og er så vidt jeg vet unik. Du vil få et skikkelig innblikk i hvor hektisk ting kan bli utover våren, og er kanskje noe mer forberedt når du kommer dit selv, eller du kan se hvordan noen andre jobber med en slik oppgave.

Risiko

Den største risikoen er jo at jeg ikke får inn de midlene jeg trenger. Dette betyr jo da at færre vil få denne sniktitten på Bachelor oppgaven.


Andre måter å hjelpeSpre ordet til andre elever, studenter og venner. Selv om dette kanskje ikke er relevant for deg, betyr jo ikke det at en venn ikke vil ha nytte av det.

story:
Le projet M.A.R.S.

Mars Analog Research & Simulation est un projet scientifique mené par sept étudiants ingénieurs de l’école Supaéro de Toulouse. Leur objectif est de pouvoir mener une série d’expériences et de simuler durant deux à trois semaines le quotidien d’une équipe d’astronautes sur la planète Mars.

Après deux missions couronnées de succès et fortement médiatisées, sept étudiants se préparent à partir en février 2017, en préparant des expériences technologiques, scientifiques et humaines.

 

Qu’est-ce que la Mars Desert Research Station ?

La Mars Desert Research Station (MDRS), implantée dans le désert de l’Utah, a été installée par Mars Society pour servir de cadre à des simulations de missions martiennes. De septembre à avril, des équipages de sept personnes venant du monde entier se relaient au cours de rotations de deux à cinq semaines pour y effectuer des expériences dans des conditions géologiques et thermiques proches de celles rencontrées sur la planète rouge.

Chaque équipe teste à son tour les différents aspects de ce que les astronautes auront à vivre : ergonomie de l’habitat, vie en communauté, difficultés techniques, alimentation lyophilisée, etc. Ces expériences seront rapportées et utilisées afin d’améliorer ces aspects. Ce projet a donc une réelle portée pratique et concrète étant donné que nos résultats seront utilisés par les agences spatiales pour préparer une véritable mission sur Mars !

 

Quel est le but de ces missions ?

Ces missions permettent à des scientifiques, des étudiants et des ingénieurs de tester du matériel destiné à l’industrie aérospatiale : drones, robots, prototypes de scaphandres, etc. Lors des rotations, Mars Society tient tout particulièrement à l’aspect réaliste de ces simulations. L’intérêt est en effet de plonger les équipages dans les mêmes conditions, de les confronter aux mêmes difficultés que celles auxquelles des astronautes effectivement implantés sur Mars devront faire face.

Ainsi, les sorties pour effectuer des expériences hors de la base ne peuvent être effectuées qu’en scaphandre : les communications avec les personnes restées sur « Terre » subissent un délai de plusieurs minutes, pour simuler les effets d’un éloignement de 400 millions de kilomètres.

 

Prochain objectif : la mission MDRS 175

Fort des succès rencontrés par le binôme de la mission MDRS 151 et l'équipe de six étudiants de MDRS 164 , qui s’est déroulée dans le désert de l’Utah, l’équipage MDRS Supaéro est fier d’avoir été sélectionné pour participer l’année prochaine à la mission MDRS 175, qui se déroulera du 11 février au 5 mars 2016.

L’expérience acquise et la grande réussite des missions dans leur totalité, aussi bien en terme de simulation que de résultats expérimentaux obtenus sur place, ont poussé une nouvelle fois Mars Society à nous accorder sa confiance, en attribuant à l’intégralité de l’équipage Supaéro le privilège de participer à une rotation l’année prochaine, pour 3 semaines cette fois.

 

Les expériences que nous allons mener

Les expériences menées sont en perpétuelle évolution. Mais voici celles prévues pour l'instant par la mission MDRS 175 :

  • Le sismomètre, prototype de celui qui sera utilisé pour la future mission martienne InSight.
  • Le spectroscope qui permet d'analyser et d'étudier la composition des roches, comme le fait actuellement le rover Curiosity
  • Le ballon solaire qui jouera le rôle de relais radio, de caméra embarquée ou encore d'étude météorologique. 
  • L'Aquapad (boîte de pétri utilisée par Thomas Pesquet sur l'ISS) afin de mesurer la pollution microbienne de l'eau potable.
  • La culture de plantes en environnement confiné en partenariat avec la start-up Vegidair
  • L'amélioration de l'efficacité des astronautes avec des lunettes à réalité augmentée en partenariat avec la PME Optinvent

Et une batterie d'autres expériences qui occuperont la totalité des 3 semaines d'isolement.

Les retombées médiatiques de la précédente mission :

  • Télévision (France 3, TF1, Canal +, iTélé, ...)
  • Radio (RFM, France Bleu, France Inter, ... )
  • Presse (Le Monde, La Tribune, Dépêche du midi,  20minutes, …)
  • Sites web (L'ADN, Studyrama, Coté Toulouse, L'Esprit Sorcier …)
  • Presse étrangère (La Province en Belgique)

Et une batterie d'autres expériences qui occuperont la totalité des 3 semaines d'isolement.Les retombées médiatiques de la précédente mission :

Télévision (France 3, TF1, Canal +, iTélé, ...)

Radio (RFM, France Bleu, France Inter, ... )

Presse (Le Monde, La Tribune, Dépêche du midi,  20minutes, …)

Sites web (L'ADN, Studyrama, Coté Toulouse, L'Esprit Sorcier …)

Presse étrangère (La Province en Belgique)

story:
The Story

Since 1946, Pine Canyon Camp has changed lives, serving youth, families and special needs groups.  From May 8 through June 25, 2011, the Horseshoe 2 Fire ravaged 80% of the incomparable Chiricahua Mountains (222,954 acres), destroying some of the most unique vegetation and ecosystems in the world. 

In the middle of this fire area lies the once active Pine Canyon Camp and Retreat Center.  The 15 acre Camp area (leased National Forest land) was mostly untouched by fire; the buildings were saved from fire damage by the firefighters (thank you!!!).  However, the electrical lines serving the cabins were damaged by the fire.  This electrical service is important to keep our youth safe during the evening and night hours as they travel from the cabins to the restrooms.

We need your help.

What We Need

Priorities include: replacing the electrical service to the cabins.  We have had on the plans to put the electrical underground to make it safe from fire and weather damage.  Now that we MUST replace this service, we plan on “doing it right” and burying the lines.

We are requesting funding to pay for the rental of heavy equipment needed to dig the trenches, as well as the electrical supplies and materials.  We have received a bid of $20,000 from a reputable electrical contractor.  However, we have qualified volunteers that can do the majority of the work, reducing our costs in half.

BUDGET

Description

Amount

     Extended

Equipment rental

$600/week

$600

Equipment fuel and oil

$100/week

$100

Labor (heavy equipment)

$1000/week

$1,000

Materials (electrical wire, conduit, boxes, etc.)

 

$5,000

Electrician

$3,300

$3,300

Total

 

$10,000

All moneys received will go straight to our PayPal account to immediately begin the work.  We appreciate all the help!

Why is Pine Canyon Camp important?

  • Studies done by the American Camp Association (ACA) show that one week spent at summer camp will keep a child off the streets the rest of their lives!  What an amazing return on investment.
  • Camp is good for families as well.  Studies done by the California Parks and Recreation Society (CPRS) show that: Camping builds strong families – the foundation of a healthy community.

 

Youth Camp

     One day I spied a pretty little girl about 8 or 9 years old, named Diane*, sitting at a picnic table.  I sat down across from her and casually asked her how her day was going.  She told me how fun it was in Arts & Crafts that morning.  I asked her if she made any new friends this week. She told me about a couple of the girls in her cabin and her counselor.  Somewhere in our discussion she told me that she had been recently adopted.  She told me about how she and her brother used to be homeless, living on the streets with their mother.  Her mother’s “medication” was just too expensive to afford a house to live in.  Sometimes, she said, they would sneak into the back door of her grandma’s house and grandma would feed them. They were really hungry! 

     At Camp she didn’t have to worry about being hungry (mmm . . . it was good!), she didn’t have to worry about where she was going to sleep, AND she could make friends and have fun! She was like everyone else when she was at Camp; she didn’t have to worry about anything when she was at Camp except just being a kid!

 

Camp Hope

     I met Ed*, an autistic 50+ year old man during our camp for developmentally disabled adults, Camp Hope.  The first year I met him, he spent the entire week on the porch at the one smoking spot available, chain-smoking.  He didn’t look at anyone and he didn’t speak to anyone.  He only came off the porch to eat and to go to bed.  Ed’s group home and Camp counselors told me that he looked forward to his week at Camp all year long.  By his third year, he was off that porch, occasionally participating.  By his fifth year, he was holding full conversations, maintaining eye contact, and participating joyfully in most of the Camp activities.

     In a few short years Ed went from an uncommunicative, closed off individual to a cheerful, talkative, happy man and a joy to be around.  He was helpful to his fellow campers and when he arrived home, he was an active member of his group home and community.

 

Strength for the Journey 

     On the last evening at the closing Campfire for our Strength For the Journey retreat (for HIV+/AIDS adults and their caregivers), Jane* stood up to speak.  What she said astounded us all.  She was 38 years old, had grown up on the streets and, like her mother, prostituted herself in order to buy her next high.  She ended up in jail for prostitution; while there she learned she was HIV+.

     That evening she told us “I thank God for giving me this disease.”  We all gasped.  “Because of this disease, I got to come to this retreat – I’ve never been to a place like this.  What I learned here is that I get to actually live whatever life I have left, instead of always looking for my next high, then being too drugged up to actually live.”

     Jane has since married her long-time boyfriend and has worked to regain her health, physically and emotionally.  It hasn’t been easy, but she continues to work towards her goal, with the help her friends she made at Camp.

* Names have been changed.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please go to our website at www.pinecamp.org to learn how you can become a member of the Friends of Pine Canyon Camp and earn discounts and other great benefits.  

If you can't help financially, the next best way to help is to share this page and the links far and wide. We need your help now before damage continues to escalate. 

THANK YOU!

She was like everyone else when she was at Camp; she didn’t have to worry about anything when she was at Camp except just being a kid!
 
Camp Hope
     I met Ed*, an autistic 50+ year old man during our camp for developmentally disabled adults, Camp Hope.  The first year I met him, he spent the entire week on the porch at the one smoking spot available, chain-smoking.  He didn’t look at anyone and he didn’t speak to anyone.  He only came off the porch to eat and to go to bed.  Ed’s group home and Camp counselors told me that he looked forward to his week at Camp all year long.  By his third year, he was off that porch, occasionally participating.  By his fifth year, he was holding full conversations, maintaining eye contact, and participating joyfully in most of the Camp activities.
     In a few short years Ed went from an uncommunicative, closed off individual to a cheerful, talkative, happy man and a joy to be around.  He was helpful to his fellow campers and when he arrived home, he was an active member of his group home and community.
 
Strength for the Journey 
     On the last evening at the closing Campfire for our Strength For the Journey retreat (for HIV+/AIDS adults and their caregivers), Jane* stood up to speak.  What she said astounded us all.  She was 38 years old, had grown up on the streets and, like her mother, prostituted herself in order to buy her next high.  She ended up in jail for prostitution; while there she learned she was HIV+.
     That evening she told us “I thank God for giving me this disease.”  We all gasped.  “Because of this disease, I got to come to this retreat – I’ve never been to a place like this.  What I learned here is that I get to actually live whatever life I have left, instead of always looking for my next high, then being too drugged up to actually live.”
     Jane has since married her long-time boyfriend and has worked to regain her health, physically and emotionally.  It hasn’t been easy, but she continues to work towards her goal, with the help her friends she made at Camp.
* Names have been changed.
Other Ways You Can Help
Please go to our website at www.pinecamp.org to learn how you can become a member of the Friends of Pine Canyon Camp and earn discounts and other great benefits.  
If you can't help financially, the next best way to help is to share this page and the links far and wide. We need your help now before damage continues to escalate. 
THANK YOU!

story:
Our Story

The Texas Wellness Initiative was thought up and created by a few nursing students (with a few mass communications majors sprinkled in) in the hopes of improving rural community health education and to provide nursing students with a way to interact directly with these communities.


The Impact

Belton is surrounded by many of Central Texas's small rural towns, many of which have poor access to medical care. The Texas Wellness Initiative is in a prime location to provide these communities with free health screenings, health fairs, and educational seminars to adults and children. These screenings, fairs, and seminars would be given by medical/nursing students and professionals currently working or attending school in the Central Texas area.

In addition to bettering the health awareness of the community, The Texas Wellness Initiative would also provide nursing students with an opportunity to become more effective, more professional, and more caring nurses at the end of their collegiate career though one-on-one interactions with individuals from these communities.

We here at The Texas Wellness Initiative are starting off local with the major aspiration of one day providing community health education nationwide.


What We Need

The Texas Wellness Initiative is just getting started. We need a minimum of $600 dollars to submit our application for incorporation to the state of Texas and to apply for non-profit status. Once that has been filed, individuals who donate will be able to make tax-deductible donations to our organization, along with other perks (like discounted web hosting).

The remainder of the amount is to help us get started with necessary administrative functions like tax filings, web hosting, health screening kits, publications, venue rental, and advertisements.

Since many of us at The Texas Wellness Initiative are going on to become professional nurses, we have a strong desire to uphold the tradition our profession has established as being considered the most honest and ethical out there (for the past twelve years). In order to maintain that standard, The Texas Wellness Initiative will strive to be open and transparent with our goals and operations. We want you to know where your money is going, so once our website is up and running we will be posting regular financial updates to specifically show how your donations were used to implement our programs and mission.

For the record: not one penny of your donations will be going into any of our pockets.


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate we would be incredibly grateful if you could share our story with someone you know that might be interested in helping us out. You can do this pretty easily by using the share buttons on this page.

Do you live in the Central Texas area and want to help us out? Please let us know by visiting our Twitter or Facebook page!

story:
Youthtube Needs YOUR Help!

We're empowering children and young people across the UK to become a fearless Youthtuber and confident role model.

With Government cutbacks to youth provisions and a rise in both criminal and mental health issues within children and young people, we know more needs to be done to increase children's well-being, education, and development.

We're crowdfunding £100,000 to make this service bigger and better than ever. We need your help whether it's £1 or £100! Your contributions will allow us to:

  • Develop the service,
  • Train youth workers across the UK,
  • Have a headquarters to provide on-site workshops 
  • Ensure the service is sustainable over the next three years and beyond.


What You Get In Return

£1: We’ll add your name to our mailing list.

£5: We’ll list your name on our website and newsletter as a founding friend of Youthtube Academy! You’ll also be subscribed to our newsletter and receive monthly updates about our events and workshops!

£20: You’ll have your name or business name on our Youthtube Selfie Photo Wall Backdrop where thousands of YouTubers will take their selfies which we feature and promote in our videos and at events.

£40 You will receive a limited edition Youthtuber T-shirts designed by our YouthTubers! Shirts will be available in both men’s and women’s cut so you can wear your support on your sleeves, literally. Plus this pledge includes sponsorship for one child to participate in a Youthtube Academy day-long workshop!

£60: Pin your limited edition Youthtuber Badge on your chest (or backpack, hat or on your dog’s collar) with a set of four premium custom designed pins created by Youthtubers. Plus, with this pledge you will be featured on our Youthtube backer's advisement backdrop wall, you will be promoted on our website and across social media, and you will sponsor a child to participate in a Youthtube Academy day-long workshop!

£97: This bundle includes all our most popular pledge rewards in one easy package. Get featured on social media as a sponsor PLUS receive a limited edition Youthtuber T-Shirt and limited edition enamel pins! Wow! And as a bonus, you will have your name printed on our Youthtube T-shirt that our founder Warren Inspire will wear, and you will sponsor a child to participate in a Youthtube Academy day-long workshop!

£197: Become one of our core Youthtube sponsors. You will be featured on our website, newsletters, and across our social media. You will become a part of our amazing family! You will receive a limited T-shirt, plus you will sponsor a child to participate in a Youthtube Academy day-long workshop AND our 7-month program!

£297: We will create a marketing video for your company with our Youthtubers, we will promote it across all of our social media channels, you will be featured on our backer wall in our office, you will feature on our website as an official sponsor and also at our YouTube Summit Events of 200 plus people

 

What Children Learn at Youthtube

At Youthtube Academy we encourage the creativity of young people to help kids learn fundamental life skills in an immersive and interactive way. Inspired by his own journey through depression and his inability to speak up when he needed to most, Warren Inspire Ryan, an award-winning international speaker, has made it his life purpose to empower young people and to give them a voice so that the 1 in 9 children who have a mental health disorder in the UK do not have to suffer or feel alone.

We know that kids are more likely to learn through play-like activities which is why we use YouTube as a tool to keep kids interested while teaching them skills like:

  • Emotional intelligence and how they can be better communicators because we want kids to have the skills they need to overcome any challenges that they may face in life.
  • Leadership skills that help kids to be great role models and inspire other young people.
  • Business skills because we want kids to have a career that the love and a life they want to live!
  • It’s important that kids understand what information is safe to share online which is why we teach them about internet safety. We also show kids that how they act online should be the same as how they treat people in person and that cyberbullying is never ok.
  • The importance of giving back to those less fortunate with each YouTuber sponsoring a charity that is close to their heart.

We teach young people everything that they need to thrive in life and surround them with a supportive community of young inspiring people so they can become the next generation of leaders.

Our Impact

With your help, your contributions will help towards our three-year strategy and goals so that we can build a sustainable youth provision for young people across the UK, including in hard-to-reach areas. 

Year One

  • Train 2000+ students
  • Employ 10 staff
  • HQ office
  • Youthtube trainers in each city in the UK
  • Generate over £1,000,000
  • Host 10 “Become a YouTuber” summits

Year Two

  • Train more than 20,000 YouTubers
  • Employ 50 staff members
  • 2 offices in the South & North of the UK
  • Franchise Youthtube Academy in multiple cities
  • Create a social enterprise for 16-25 years olds
  • Youthtube charity supporting underprivileged kids
  • Partner with big brand sponsors

Year Three

  • 100,000 students participating in the program
  • Employ 100+ staff members
  • Youthtube International workshops in Africa, Asia & USA
  • Youthtube Academy Filming Centre

 

 

Testimonials

"Amazing for growing confidence and belief in kids. Warren is a master at believing in each individual so that they can believe in themselves. He brings out their ideas and helps them to get it out on to the Youthtube platform. My kids loved it."

Julie Hutchison - Parent

 

"My boys had the most empowering and confidence boosting day at the Bristol workshop! They both came home bursting to get working on their YouTube channels, 10 x more confident and with loads of new friends. It really felt like a Youthtube family!"

Jenna Warren - Parent

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute with money, you can still help us. 

  • Help us to get the word out and make some noise about the campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to share with your family and friends!

HQ office
Youthtube trainers in each city in the UK
Generate over £1,000,000
Host 10 “Become a YouTuber” summits

Train more than 20,000 YouTubers
Employ 50 staff members
2 offices in the South & North of the UK
Franchise Youthtube Academy in multiple cities
Create a social enterprise for 16-25 years olds
Youthtube charity supporting underprivileged kids
Partner with big brand sponsors

Year Three

100,000 students participating in the program
Employ 100+ staff members
Youthtube International workshops in Africa, Asia & USA
Youthtube Academy Filming Centre


 

 
Testimonials
"Amazing for growing confidence and belief in kids. Warren is a master at believing in each individual so that they can believe in themselves. He brings out their ideas and helps them to get it out on to the Youthtube platform. My kids loved it."
Julie Hutchison - Parent
 
"My boys had the most empowering and confidence boosting day at the Bristol workshop! They both came home bursting to get working on their YouTube channels, 10 x more confident and with loads of new friends. It really felt like a Youthtube family!"
Jenna Warren - Parent

 
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute with money, you can still help us. 

Help us to get the word out and make some noise about the campaign.
Use the Indiegogo share tools to share with your family and friends!

story:
Short Summary

The Boron Kids Out Reach Program (BKOP) is a volunteer-run Summer program that has served the children and teens of the Boron/North Edwards community for the last 5 years. 

BKOP has a four fold mission. #1 Feed hungry kids. We serve a fresh nutritious lunch 3 days a week and every child and teen that shows up to our lunch program. #2 Give them something to do. We host activities and special events for the kids and teens in the community during the summer. #3 Help the kids get ready to go back to school. We provide gently used clothing, backpack, school supplies and hair cuts so the kids can back to school looking and feeling their best. #4 Build relationships. Our volunteers not only feed these children they connect with them and invest in their lives so that every child knows that they are valuable and important to this community. 

What We Need & What You Get

BKOP currently needs money for the summer lunch program as we serve over 1200 meals during the summer. We also need money for our events such as our "Field Day" held at the park. Our total budget for the summer is $3000. 

The local community generously donates clothing every year for the clothing give away.

The Impact

Boron is an impoverished community with a substantial number of children who live well below the poverty level. BKOP ensures that these children get enough to eat during the summer, these children have fun activities to do, these children have nice cloths for school and these children know that there are lots of adult in our community that care about them.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can not help financially help spread the world about BKOP by sharing our web address www.bkop.org or by sharing our funding page. 

Thank you for your support!

story:
This fundraiser is on the behalf of a wonderful non-profit called Rwanda Together We Can (RTWC).  It is an extension of the same non-profit organization that I volunteered in Haiti with both times a few years back.  RTWC is a youth led organization and accounts for over 40 young volunteers.  Their aim is to promote and improve the living conditions of poor or marginalized communities/groups living in Rwanda. The work that these amazing volunteers do is remarkable and its amazing to know people who spend every moment of their days thinking of ways to help their neighbors and make their communities better.

This campaign will help kick start a new training program for RTWC.  They have been preparing to teach traffic laws to Rwanda youth who are doing the work of transporting people on bicycles (bicycle taxi workers).  The leader of this organization, Norbert, studied at the University of Rwanda in the College of Medicine and Health Sciences where he did medical imaging services.  He now works as a Radiology Technician at a hospital in the eastern province of Rwanda called ADPER/NYAMATA Hospital.  Norbert planned this project after he did some research and realized that 60% of the accidents they receive at his hospital are due to the bicycle taxi workers.  He realized that most of these cyclists are young and have never received training on the traffic laws in Rwanda.  Your donations would help kick start their first class which is estimated to be about 100 students and to last for 1 month.
Your donation will help make a lasting impact in an area where drivers education does not exist and young people trying to make money for their families put themselves in danger everyday.  The money from this particular fundraiser will go towards:
1.  Advertisement of this project through medias and mobile technologies in the villages of the Bugesera district of Rwanda
2.  One day of Bugesera tour selection orgainized by RTWC which will involve more than 400 cyclists.
3.  1 month of teaching traffic law courses to the first 100 cyclists selected from the tour.
4.  Selecting the second group of cyclists to continue training.
In addition, the graduates of this course will be able to pass the national exam required to obtain a provisional driving license.  Most of the bicycle taxi workers are not able to take this exam because they do not have the knowledge required and have no way of obtaining it.  
RTWC has already found 3 rooms to use as class rooms and they are still bringing teachers on board.  The logistics of the program have been worked out, but now they need the money to make everything happen.  They need to start this class as soon as possible in order to utilize the resources they have already been promised. Therefore, the goal is to raise $1000 in the next 2 weeks.  It might be ambitious, but in this season of giving, lets all do what we can!
How You Can Contribute:
1. Donate! :) This is a great place to start.
2. If you are unable to donate, tell everyone you know and share this on facebook or any other social media outlet.
3. Check out the RTWC page here: http://rtwco.weebly.com/ and learn about all the other projects they are involved in.

Thanks so much for reading and Happy Holidays!!!

story:
I've signed up to run on my company's team in the Star Wars Half Marathon in January 2016 and to secure my place I need to raise $1500 for St Jude Children's Research Hospital. Help me reach my target! 

I'm running a nerdy half marathon... 

for a good cause! And to tackle the challenge of the half marathon again. But also, and possibly mostly, because I'm a bit of a Star Wars nerd. 

And yes, I do plan to run in costume. :)  

What I Need & What You Get

To keep my place in the half marathon, I need to raise $1500 by 1 December! Eeep!

Help me reach my goal by browsing some of the fun perks I've come up with that utilize my varied talents and skills, in exchange for funds I can donate. 

Disclaimer: I can't hook this campaign up to the St Jude fundraising site so funds raised through this campaign will go to me and then I will transfer them over to the St Jude fundraising site once the campaign ends. 

Want to pass on a perk and still donate? Or prefer to donate direct so you can get the tax write-off? 
No prob, use this link so I get the credit: http://heroes.stjude.org/amystarwars

(and if you were after a perk, drop me an email and I'll hook you up)

Some of the perks: 

  • Jump to LightSpeed: get a copy of a 2016 Calendar of my wildlife photography images. You can see some of my work here. 
  • Toes Toastier Than Hoth: a pair of handknit (by me) socks made just to you. If you've never had the joy of handmade wool socks, you're missing out!  
  • Shawls Fit For a Princess: a handknit (by me) shawl in either Carnival Nights or Myriad. I only have one of each so first to donate for one gets first choice of the two options! 
A few perks are for London friends only: 
  • Rebel Nail Art: I'll do your nails up in some fancy designs and they'll look fab!
  • Come to the Dark Side: a batch of my homemade cookies made just for you!
  • Crave not these things: one of my homemade cakes made just for you!

The Impact

St. Jude Children's Research Hospital is a leader in combatting childhood cancer and diseases. In 50 years they've helped the childhood cancer survival rate go from 20% to 80%. https://www.stjude.org/about-st-jude/why-support-st-jude.html

Shawls Fit For a Princess: a handknit (by me) shawl in either Carnival Nights or Myriad. I only have one of each so first to donate for one gets first choice of the two options! 


A few perks are for London friends only: 

Rebel Nail Art: I'll do your nails up in some fancy designs and they'll look fab!
Come to the Dark Side: a batch of my homemade cookies made just for you!
Crave not these things: one of my homemade cakes made just for you!

    The Impact St. Jude Children's Research Hospital is a leader in combatting childhood cancer and diseases. In 50 years they've helped the childhood cancer survival rate go from 20% to 80%. https://www.stjude.org/about-st-jude/why-support-st-jude.html

story:
Everybody has a story to tell but not everybody gets a chance to share it.


We are a collection of artists, teachers, creative thinkers, and social justice advocates looking to provide spaces for the youth of St. Paul and Minneapolis to tell their stories.


We want to create a space where youth can realize their talent, potential, and influence through the act of digital storytelling. This is why we are hosting two ten day long and one five day long digital storytelling camps where local artists mentor local youth and develop the skills necessary to showcase their voice in creative ways. These camps are completely FREE for participants.


We are creating this program as an alternative to mainstream media, where we can work together to showcase media that increases the power of youth voices.


We welcome and strive to be accessible to all youth; especially low income youth, youth of color, new immigrant youth, differently-abled youth, GLBTQI youth and youth from other marginalized communities.


Apply Today!

Youth: http://goo.gl/forms/K4cKdRVcyz 

Mentor: tinyurl.com/DSIartists


What We Need & What You Get

The donations will be used for two things:

1. We want to ensure that this program remains accessible to all youth. This means providing food, transportation, and access to the best equipment.  In order for this to remain a FREE program for students, all funds raised will be used for:

  • Providing daily lunches for youth and volunteers

  • Miscellaneous costs, such as administrative fees, postage, printing costs

*We have lowered the initial budget from $1200, and are currently looking at under $500 as our goal. Any bit you can donate helps!*

We are sponsored by SPNN (Saint Paul Neighborhood Network), a 501c3 nonprofit.

We have a lot of spectacular perks that will go along with each of our donation amounts. but we appreciate any amount you are able to donate! Please remember, we are sponsored by SPNN (St. Paul Neighborhood Network), a 501c3 nonprofit organizations so all donations will be tax deductible and you will be able to obtain a receipt from FirstGiving.

We cannot reach all of these goals without your contributions!


Other Ways You Can Help

We welcome all community members to join our collective by:

  • Donating food, technology, or other supplies (also tax deductible)

  • Join us in the planning process (contact.dsi.group@gmail.com)

  • Applying to be an instructor during one of the three camps 

  • Becoming a mentor

story:
The 45th President of the United States of America will become the most powerful person in the world. He or she will have the ability to write trade legislation the world must follow, lead the world on major scientific issues and become Commander in Chief of the world’s biggest military force. 

He or she will influence the entire world for the next four years. Which is why the world is watching, transfixed from the sidelines.  We can't vote. Or tell people who to vote for. The only thing we can do is make Americans realise how important their vote is. 

We're raising money to run a TV ad in America - paid for by the world - to do just that. We're going to do it in a simple way, completely free from any political bias. If successful, we’re hoping that along with the eyeballs we get from our media buy we’ll also generate positive PR stories about the importance of voting. 

In the last U.S. election, 41.8% of eligible adult voters didn’t vote. That’s nearly 93 million people. 

Their future – and ours - is in their hands.

We want to make sure that this election, Americans get out and vote. 

The entire world is watching from the sidelines. We may as well make some noise. 





We’re starting small but dreaming big. Our goal of £8,000 will pay for 30 ads running in off-peak time in a single state. We’ve picked Nevada where 42.8% of voters didn’t vote in the 2012 election. Not only that, but it’s an important swing state. 

A swing state is a state where no single party has overwhelming support. That means either party could edge the other out and collect all the electoral votes for the state. The way American politics works, each state is allocated a certain amount of electoral votes based on population and winner takes all. Across the 50 American states there are 538 electoral votes. The candidate who receives an absolute majority of those - 270 - becomes the next President. Nevada counts for six of those. 

All money raised will go towards our media buy; the TV ad will be produced by us and cost nothing. The more money we raise, the more noise we make. 

What do we mean when we say we’re dreaming big? We’d love to get our collective message playing primetime in every single state. 





All financial contributions no matter how small help. But you can also share the project with your friends. It comes back to making as much noise as we can, together, to better our chances of success.  



We’re Scott Kelly, Ben Polkinghorne and Pete Browse. A trio of advertising professionals working and living in London.

We had help from Ben H, Danni S and Rhonda G – along with our friends from all over the world who appeared in the video. Thank you all. 

If you’d like to get in touch, please email us at info@dearamerica2016.com 



We're watching from the sidelines. We may as well make some noise.

story:
What is EDU Gaming?

EDU Gaming CIC is an e-learning community interest company. It is our mission to explore the educational value of video games and technology to improve the accessibility and development of e-learning resources. We are creating the first platform that provides a space for gamers, students and educators to meet on equal footing and share their ideas and experiences.

It's free to join with many free features available. Sign up today at

www.edu-gaming.com.

Why Video Games?

Video games have come on a long way since the days of Pong and Mario, and it’s not all about Call of Duty or Battlefield. Today video games cover a wide array of subjects and with indie developers constantly joining the market there seems to be no end to the diversity. As more topics are covered we consistently see overlapping trends between the subjects taught in schools and the themes of video games and with this overlap comes an opportunity for application. In addition, we are seeing a paradigm shift in education that moves away from simple information delivery and conditioning, and towards guided experience. In this regard videos games may certainly play a key role.

Do You Really Think Gamers Have a Role in the Future of Education?

The short answer is yes! We understand educators are specialists in teaching but there are many educators who are not digital natives or, at least, are less familiar with available technology and software compared with their students. Obviously this can pose a problem with e-learning.

Gamers, on the other hand, are experts at video games. With many putting in hours that might cause a blush. These individuals are some of the best contenders for determining the pros and cons of a video game and its worth remembering that gamers are people too, including some students and educators.

Many gamers have also gone on to develop sophisticated skills out of a passion for gaming including programming, website development and video production… All sought-after skills in today’s job market.

Developing a space where interested gamers, students and educators can meet to share their experiences seems to be the best way in developing the application of e-learning. 

Our Platform

EDU Gaming is creating a versatile platform that incorporates social media and an online magazine to share ideas about game-based learning, both ours and yours. We are also developing various educational resources and software that has application in gaming and learning. Right now we are focusing on our virtual learning environment and e-sports package since both have crossover potential between education and entertainment by bringing versatile communications to gaming and tournaments to the classroom.

For more information about some of our features check out the video below.

It’s All for You!

Being a community interest company (CIC) means that EDU Gaming is all about you. A CIC is a form of social enterprise and effectively puts us half way between being a charity and commercial entity. We can make a profit but we are independently regulated to ensure that the majority of that profit is reinvested in a manner that is seen to be serving our community. In addition, all community interest companies are also subject to an asset lock which means they are required to hand over any remaining assets to another asset locked body such as a charity or other CIC if the company dissolves. This gives you the peace of mind of knowing that if you support EDU Gaming the money you invest in us will be reinvested in you and should we ever fail in our mission, your investment will go on to support another worthy cause. 

Why Choose Us?

Since the formation of EDU Gaming we have been working tirelessly to network with various companies throughout the gaming industry such as Multiplay, Paradox Interactive, Creative Assembly, TeacherGaming LLC, Squad, and many more, as well as numerous educators across the UK and around the world. This puts us in a unique position to bring individuals together to look at new and exciting projects in the development of e-learning. What’s more, we give you the opportunity to get involved as well!

We Need Your Support

EDU Gaming CIC has come on a long way in the past 12 months but we are still a young company. A lot of development has taken place behind the scenes with the production of our resources and software as well as the huge amount of research exploring game-based learning. However, constructive feedback has suggested that the project is suffering because our website is not as visually appealing as it could be. For this reason we have started the first EDU Gaming crowd funding campaign to improve the website and build a platform you can be proud of. We have come this far on very limited finances and a lot of dedication… Imagine what we could achieve together with your support.

Where Will The Money Go?

The money raised from this crowd funding campaign will be used to redesign the EDU Gaming website and improve its look and functionality. It will also be used to complete the development and integration of our newest software including our virtual learning environment and e-sports package into the EDU Gaming platform for a seamless user experience. If we are fortunate enough to exceed our target then we will be looking to expand the EDU Gaming team with more community developers and researchers.

Other Ways To Help

It's not just about raising funds, we want you as well! EDU Gaming is a community project and we would like to welcome you into our community and encourage you to join in with the discussions. Join us today and share your skills and knowledge. Tell us about the games you have been playing, the topics you find interesting, and how you think the future of education can benefit from emerging technology.

You can also help by spreading the word about our campaign by using the share buttons.

Don't forget to visit our current site at www.edu-gaming.com

story:
Help support Eric and Ruby's Healthy Juice Stand Project based on the new children's book "Eric and Ruby's Healthy Juice Stand". The project will provide education, activities and healthy food choices for children in New York and New Jersey.

Funding will be managed by Queendom and Kingdom Transformation Foundation Inc. a 501(c)3 focused on healthy mind, body image and spirit of children, women and men.

story:
Overview

Sixty-two percent of Trenton students qualify for free and reduced lunch.  This is the highest percentage of any school district in Mercer County.  In an effort to support students' success upon return to school this coming fall, TCNJ School of Education faculty and staff will organize and pack 200 backpacks with school supplies to be distributed to students via Fathers and Men United, a trusted community partner of the TCNJ Bonner Institute.

What We Need 

  • We are raising funds to purchase backpacks and supplies for 200 children.
  • We are also accepting donations of backpacks and supplies on campus.
  • $5 buys 20 pencils
  • $10 buys a backpack
  • $30 buys a FILLED  backpack!

The Impact

By donating, you will make a difference in the lives of students who need supplies and support to be successful!

story:
Why This Cause

I chose Dixie Canyon Elementary School to do my activism project.  An activism project is a project I am assigned as part of my Civics Academy curriculum at Millikan Middle School.  My little brother currently goes to Dixie and I went there in elementary school to.  For these reasons Dixie is very close to my heart.
What I Will Get & What We Need 

These are the things I need to achieve my goal:

  • One table with benches with a built in umbrella.
  • At least $500 to present to the PTA at Dixie.
  • If I get this or more, the PTA will match the amount to help buy the table.
The Impact

One I reach my goal, these are some of the things that kindergarteners will get.

  • Benches with tables to sit and eat lunch.
  • A built in umbrella on the table for improved shade while eating.
  • Overall happy kids during the day.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute to my project, there are other ways you can help.

  • Spread the word about my project to others you know.
  • Share it to your social media for the world to see.
I have been working with the PTA and they agreed to use the money for the tables once the money is rasied
And that's all there is to it.
