story:
Short Summary

I am Shahara Godfrey, a Dissertation Coach, Mixed Media Figurative Artist and Mindfulness Teacher. I coach people who need help with completing their dissertation using a Mindful approach found in Buddhist philosophy.  

Whether you are beginning, in the middle or completing a dissertation, the Mindful Dissertation Coaching approach supports a person throughout their entire process.  It is a method that teaches being present in each moment as a path to completing the dissertation. People learn and integrate mindfulness skills in a way that can be used for many situations.

Self-taught Mixed Media Figurative Artist

 As a self-taught mixed media figurative artist working with found objects, I began creating art in 1995.  I love what I do and do what I love.  I create wire sculpted figures that can stand alone and in shadow boxes. The materials vary using cloth, wire, and jewelry.  I am offering my art as perks for your contribution. Please review examples of my work in the  Image Gallery.

Mindful Teacher

In addition to being a self-taught mixed media figurative artist, I am committed to helping people complete their dissertation using a Mindful approach found in Buddhist philosophy.

Through Spirit Rock’s Meditation Center, I completed both the Community Dharma Leadership and the Dedicated Practitioner’s programs. In addition, I finished the UCLA Mindful and Awareness Research Center training in which I received a certificate and decided to create the Mindful Dissertation Coaching service. With a long history of practice, I am glad to integrate my skills in such a way that is a benefit to others. 

I am asking your help to launch my business, Mindful Dissertation Coaching.   

What We Need & What You Get

Mindful Dissertation Coaching Campaign

I am hoping to raise $15,000 and I will use all of the money raised to support my business.  This money will cover the cost of new equipment and marketing strategies that include advertising with counseling programs at different universities, online programs, newsletters, and websites.  It will also provide transportation costs to attend conferences and offer workshops in different educational settings.  I plan to attend a minimum of four conferences a year.  The first one is the Association for the Contemplative Mind in Higher Education which is being held in Seattle, WA in October, 2014.

Your Help Matters

Your contribution matters and no amount are too small.

With your donation, I am so happy to offer you various perks noted of my art work. I will keep you updated with the progress of the Mindful Dissertation Coaching Campaign.  

I am reaching out to community, which includes you to help me fund the Mindful Dissertation Coaching Campaign. Please go to www.mindfuldissertation.com to learn more about me and my services. 

With much gratitude and appreciation, Shahara 

The Impact

Mindful Dissertation Coaching is a method which teaches being present in each moment as a path to completing the dissertation. It is learned and integrated in a way that mindful skills can be applied to many situations. With your help stressful yet inspired doctoral students will receive the support needed to be successful. I am deeply grateful for your generosity. Thank you.

Risks & Challenges

Offering a Mindful Dissertation Coaching Service is a long held dream.  After three efforts at finishing a doctoral program, in 2009, I know what it takes to complete the process. It can be arduous, fraught with self-doubt, and full of frustration. Yet when completed, a sense of relief and accomplishment, with the life-long knowledge of personal victory and pride takes place. The dissertation can be completed.  It is not your entire life just part of it!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please pass this campaign information onto others. Use the INDIEGOGO tools and help us let people know! Thank you!

story:
Building a School in Ethiopia

132 million people live on less than $1 a day. Education provides the strongest opportunity to overcome this level of poverty, however, 72% of school-aged children in Ethiopia do not have access to formal education and we can change that!

How I Got Here

Six years ago myself and a group of friends launched Tapestry Church with a goal to change our world locally and globally.  We've made an impact locally in Savannah, Georgia by being a welcoming church that is open to people from all walks of life. Now the people of Tapestry are reaching across the globe to build a school for those in need.  This December I'll be leading a team from Savannah to the Harar region of Ethiopia to take part in the construction of the school.

Why I need $2500

In short I need your help with travel expenses for:

  • Air-fare
  • Ground Travel
  • Accommodations

Risks & Challenges

This is going to be a stretch for me personally as my first trip to Africa.  We will not be in a highly populated area and basic necessities will be few and far between.  I'll also be in charge of leading a group of roughly 15 people of varying ages and travel experience.

    More Information 

    Tapestry Church is partnering with a group called On The Ground for the actual construction of the school. 
    If you would like to learn more about On The Ground you can check out their website here:
    On The Ground
    If you'd like more information about Tapestry Church you can check out our website here:
    Tapestry Church

story:
Summary

Our project has two components. Ultimately we want to raise awareness about gender diversity.

We want to help the Sex and Gender Diverse (SGD) community directly, and we want to do something fun in the wider community. Mr Green Teal/Arachne Phobia and Melina Fahrenheit are local performers in the Canberra Community. They will use their creative skills to assist people in the community to learn and grow.

Mr Green Teal and Melina Fahrenheit, photograph by Chris Manchester (Captavitae Photography).


What we need and what you get

We want to run a workshop for people exploring their gender. In this workshop people will learn makeup skills, clothing and presentation. The second part of our project is to run a performance night. This performance night will focus on gender diversity as a theme. It will feature burlesque, slam poets, drag queens, drag kings and any number of other performers. https://www.facebook.com/events/902565723091674...

We have already started assembling a group of people who will help out in the workshops, providing free hair cuts, assistance with makeup and clothing construction. We have performers who are keen to perform for the community and we will be encouraging participation by the SGD Community. This Indigogo project will allow us to pay for materials needed and performance venue and equipment.

We can do this project on a shoe string budget, the difference being we won’t be able to offer workshop participants as many ‘take home’ gifts or other tangible resources, as these are limited. If we raise enough money in this campaign, we will make the performance night a free event for the whole community. If we don’t raise enough money, we will need to charge for tickets.

We will use whatever money raised as part of the project to help cover costs, if we raise more than our target, or are able to save we will be donating the money to a local SGD organisation, A Gender Agenda.

Our perks

We are fortunate because we have many creative friends and links into the community. These friends are able to support the project by offering a number of goods, services and art pieces as our perks.  We will do our best to ensure everyone gets their perks in a timely manner, however due to the nature of our perks – being donated by others – we cannot fully guarantee the quality or delivery. The perks are built on a system of trust and respect for others and their ability to deliver.

We have a range of perks. They can be used individually or arranged to occur at the same time.

We are offering photography sessions where you can have a photographer come and take photos of you and your friends, families or colleagues. We also offer makeup sessions, where you can have your makeup done, this could be used with the photography sessions. There are services to have your hair done/cut. Piercings,  maybe you can document getting your first piercing done!  There are Green Teal T-shirts on offer, these are limited edition t-shirts of performer Green Teal. For the burlesque enthusiast there are special edition, handmade and designed pasties. Original artworks will be part of the perks.  Post card sets of Mr Green Teal and Melina Fahrenheit will be another perk, these original and limited edition post cards were photographed by Chris Manchester.

Pastie, made by Megan Munro (aka Mr Green Teal)

Green Teal t-shirts. Image by Ella Wilkes Photography

The Impact

The workshop will directly benefit people in the community. It will build self esteem, resilience and capacity in the SGD community.

The performance night, will be a fun night, the wider community as a whole can enjoy. It will present gender in such ways that will help break down many myths and stereotypes about gender and gender diversity.

Mr Green Teal has been an active member of the LGBTI community for a number of years. Assisting to raise money and awareness for the community in other forums. He/she, is a strong community advocate and has organised many events in the past, and has won awards for this work as nominated by the community.

Melina Fahrenheit is a well known burlesque performer in Canberra. She has won Miss Kitka’s House of the Burlesque Audience Choice Award for her burlesque performances. She has a strong interest in the arts and community development.

Melina Fahrenheit


Arachne Phobia/Green Teal

Risks and challenges

The main challenges to this project will be making sure the workshop is appealing and a safe space for members of the SGD Community. Green and Melina are known to some. It is these connections which are being utilised to help 'spread the word' about the workshops.

Another challenge is human resources. There is always issues around producing a show. However, both Green and Melina are experienced in show production and have a good understanding of how to manage various issues which might arise here.


Other ways you can help

We understand that many people do not have much money and can’t assist our project financially. We would say the best thing you can do it so spread the word, help out by telling people about our campaign. Find out a bit more about what you can do in your life to support SGD people.

Summary
Our project has two components. Ultimately we want to
raise awareness about gender diversity. 
We want to help the Sex and Gender Diverse (SGD) community directly,
and we want to do something fun in the wider community. Mr Green Teal/Arachne
Phobia and Melina Fahrenheit are local performers in the Canberra Community.
They will use their creative skills to assist people in the community to learn
and grow.Mr Green Teal and Melina Fahrenheit, photograph by Chris Manchester (Captavitae Photography).What we need and what
you get
We want to run a workshop for people exploring their gender.
In this workshop people will learn makeup skills, clothing and presentation. The
second part of our project is to run a performance night. This performance
night will focus on gender diversity as a theme. It will feature burlesque,
slam poets, drag queens, drag kings and any number of other performers. https://www.facebook.com/events/902565723091674...
We have already started assembling a group of people who
will help out in the workshops, providing free hair cuts, assistance with
makeup and clothing construction. We have performers who are keen to perform
for the community and we will be encouraging participation by the SGD Community. This Indigogo project will
allow us to pay for materials needed and performance venue and equipment.
We can do this project on a shoe string budget, the
difference being we won’t be able to offer workshop participants as many ‘take
home’ gifts or other tangible resources, as these are limited. If we raise enough
money in this campaign, we will make the performance night a free event for the
whole community. If we don’t raise enough money, we will need to charge for
tickets. We will use whatever money raised as part of the project to help cover
costs, if we raise more than our target, or are able to save we will be
donating the money to a local SGD organisation, A Gender
Agenda.
Our perks
We are fortunate because we have many creative friends and
links into the community. These friends are able to support the project by
offering a number of goods, services and art pieces as our perks.  We will do our best to ensure everyone gets

by others – we cannot fully guarantee the quality or delivery. The perks are
built on a system of trust and respect for others and their ability to deliver.

people.

story:
The HIP-HOP academy was established in 2006.

Our goal is to properly educate and expose the youth to the elements of HIP-HOP culture that exist as positive forms of self expression.

Emceeing(Rap), Breakdanceing ,Turntableism/ DJ'ing & Graffiti/Mural art each provide a solid artistic foundation for children and young adults.

Pop culture has often painted a negative image of HIP-HOP with its focus on violence and degradation of women, we are here to change that.

Ignorance of HIP-HOP culture stems from lack of exposure and misrepresentation in the media.

All instructors are active artists in HIP-HOP and the Kansas City fine art community with 15+ years of experience.

Jeremy McConnell H.H.A. cofounder, creative visual artist, Community Activist and founder of FLAVORPAK. (B.A.S.C! - Beware All Stylebiters Crew)

Teri (T BLAZE) Green, Poetry & Rhyme Instructor, accomplished Spoken word poet, published author and singer.

Leo (LEONIGHTUS) Gayden, dance instructor, dancer, cultural event coordinator & prolific club dj.

Aaron Sutton H.H.A. cofounder, Visual Arts instructor, artist, community activist, creative collaborater and Emcee (Deep Thinkers, Innate Sounds Crew, Symbol Heavy, Visual Goodies, Soul Mec...)

Michael Brass, Rhyme Instructor, Emcee, Community Activist, Creative Collaborator. ( Heetmob, The Hymnlayas...)

 Roscoe Johnson (Negro Scoe) *On Sabbatical * H.H.A. Cofounder, Rhyme Instructor, Emcee. ( Hip Hop Addicts, Symbol Heavy )

We have a large number of other talented artists from our community that have worked with us over the past few years and that are on call to assist with programming, events and presentations.

Over the past 7 years the Hip Hop Academy has received periodic donations and also been fortunate enough to partner with some area Non for Profit organizations to acquire funding, for the most part however we've run the program on a very small budget that has provided seasonal workshops and occasional block party events.  

The HIP-HOP ACADEMY would benefit from any financial donation and if we are able to reach the desired goal of $8k will be able to provide classes free for the youth around the metropolitan KCMO area.

We continue to believe in EACH ONE TEACH ONE and to be resourceful and creative in our methods and in sharing our Hip Hop art forms with the youth.

Here in Kansas City we have seen many of our neighborhood schools closed, budgets slashed and even accredidation lost. All of these negatively impact our children's future.

Due to a lack of art programs for inner city youth the HIP-HOP ACADEMY has established itself as an independent artist run organization. We have a good track record and have had the opportunity to work with hundreds of youth since 2006 from Pre K to Highschool Graduates.

We truly hope that you can help fund the Hip Hop Academy.

We believe that everyone wants to see children expressing themselves in positive ways.

We will benefit from whatever we raise from this campaign and even if you cannot donate, then please help us get the word out, remember ~ EACH ONE TEACH ONE and that what you do today has a big effect on the future generations.

Thank you for your time and support.

See YOU at the next event and or H.H.A. class.

story:
Southwest Organizing Project, a 30yr old grassroots organization with a mission to empower the disenfranchised of the southwest to realize racial and gender equality and social and economic justice, needs your help to raise money for our Youth Empowerment Summer Institute. (YES!)

YES! Youth Empowerment Summer Institute is a four day, three night summer institute designed to educate, train, and empower 50 youth in the state of New Mexico to be the change they want to see in their communities. It will be held at the Hotel Blue in Albuquerque, New Mexico July 16-19th 2012.

 Participants of the Youth Empowerment Summer Institute will learn about:

  • Social justice, the current political environment, and how it impacts all youth.
  • How to mobilize communities to speak out on issues that impact them.
  • Community organizing principles and strategies for creating victories

Help us make YES! a free event for all of our participants. All donations of any amount will be greatly appreciated or you can become a Silver, Gold, or Platinum donor!

  • Platinum Donor $250- Your $250 donation will help pay for lodging for one youth participant to attend YES!
  • Gold Donor $150- Your $150 donation will help pay for food for one youth participant during YES!
  • Silver Donor $50- Your $50 donation will help pay for all program materials for 1 participant including a free T-shirt and water bottle for attending YES!

Your donations will help develop youth leadership in the state to be at the forefront of create social change in our state. If interested in apply or for more info please visit our website http://www.swop.net/youth-organizing or Call Emma Sandoval at (505)353-2941

story:
INTRODUCTION

Once more, you could become a patron of one the four main factions and hire a band of duelists (represented by our 35mm miniatures) for doing some... “work” for you and your faction in order to accumulate enough power to choose the new king of Iberia and start the defense of El Purgatorio or the conquest of the north against the Gauls. 

Having printed the rulebook of 1650,  A Capa y Espada with your help (thanks ;]), we want this game to become a whole new universe of adventures and very detailed conflicts, spanning the most essential aspects of guerrilla warfare of 1650, A Capa y Espada with more bands and detailed information about conflict zones with their sociopolitical and military situation...All these things will increase your gaming experience. For this, we want to print the first expansion books of 1650: Dies Irae. Also, we want to start releasing the new Gaul Vanguard of the Usurper faction, and the new material presented in those expansion books.

But what is Dies Irae? Here is a summary for your perusal:

WHY DO WE NEED YOUR HELP?

Tercio Creativo is a little company. We're only 2 partners/sculptors. For the last few years, we have been releasing single miniatures to build a consistent operations theatre within a solid background concept. Step by step, the game system, its background and the game community is growing and, slowly but surely, we keep hard at work to show you everything we create. We can´t stop it, guys.

There are lots of ideas and amazing new concepts, but money is a big problem. We make every component of our products in Spain. We don´t want to manufacture anything in countries that offer us a cheap cost and in the meantime pay  their workers poverty wages, only for offering you  products with “standard” prices. We want to continue using a traditional production system, from our own “damaged” country, and coherent with the economic situation, help other Spanish companies while we explore exciting new worlds.

CAMPAIGN TARGETS

This campaign is divided into targets, and these are grouped in stages. Each stage will allow us to discover a new and darker aspect of the universe of 1650,  A Capa y Espada. Each stage comprises several targets and rewards. When we reach a target, all of you will get a reward (see below) and the possibility to buy the newly unlocked products with high discounts.

Confidente ("Informer") unlocked.

Hideputa ("Sonofabitch") unlocked.

REWARDS

Whenever a new goal is reached, all funders will get the reward stated therein. And if it is free, it will be automatically included in their perks.

If the reward is a new product, it can be added by paying the required amount (see below).

ADDING MORE PRODUCTS TO YOUR PERK

Whenever you want to add more products to your perk, just pay the price of your new acquisition (clicking the CONTRIBUTE NOW button and adding the amount). After that, send an email to let us know what you have added.

CATALOGUE

If you want to add more products (pawns, Antagonists, Enclaves or game items) from our catalogue, you will be able to get it with an exclusive discount. See below for knowing how much you can save when adding new products.

For more information about our products, please find our catalogue at the link below:

http://tienda.terciocreativo.com/?PHPSESSID=afabb35b3ddb859044facfa8fe071bc9

GREENS AND WORKS IN PROGRESS

Adrian de Rivero:

Luana:

Fredrick Willem:

Mercenary Picador, almost finished: Gift for perks C, D, E, F, F-Conquered or G till September the 10th.

Toro Desbocado: Gift for perks D, E, F, F-Conquered or G till last day of crowdfunding.

Confidente ( "Informer" ), Gift for perks C, D, E, F, F-Conquered or G, if we get 6000€:

Hideputa ("Sonofabitch"), Gift for perks C, D, E, F, F-Conquered or G, if we get 10000€:

Wraith of Dunas Rojas, in progress, available with BIG discount if we get to 15000€:

Armed Wagon chassis:

Armadillo Armed Wagon:

More Armadillo Armed Wagon pieces:

Padre Norberto, Leader of Domini Canis band, and one of the pawns for Dies Irae, The Boardgame.

Hermano Martin, another pawn for Domini Canis band, and Dies Irae, The Boardgame.

Hermano Bernardo, another pawn for Domini Canis band, and Dies Irae, The Boardgame.

Sacerdote Absorto, Leader of Ordo Calamitas band, and another of the pawns for Dies Irae, The Boardgame.

Absorto A, another pawn for Ordo Calamitas band, and Dies Irae, The Boardgame.

Absorto B, another pawn for Ordo Calamitas band, and Dies Irae, The Boardgame.

Absorto C, another pawn for Ordo Calamitas band, and Dies Irae, The Boardgame.

story:
Dos Ruedas Por Mi Gente proyecta construir modelo de Eco-Escuelas en la Zona Maya

  • Ciclista mexicano recorre sobre ruedas 18 países del continente en busca de recursos

Con la meta de construir un modelo de Eco-Escuelas para los niños de la Zona Maya en el Sureste de México, donde se imparta a los menores una educación enfocada a la ecología y la información alternativa, el mexicano Osvaldo Ferrari emprendió el proyecto Eco-Educativo a través de la fundación DOS RUEDAS POR MI GENTE.

Basado en el deporte y el respeto por la humanidad, el proyecto ciclista autosustentable y de desarrollo social, busca ofrecer una alternativa de educación con calidad para los niños que habitan en zonas rurales y marginadas del Sureste Mexicano.

Ofrecer a los niños de escasos recursos la oportunidad de tener estudios universitarios, hermanar diferentes culturas y promover el uso de la bicicleta como medio de transporte ecológico, son los objetivos de DOS RUEDAS POR MI GENTE.

 “Nuestra meta es generar a los primeros Biólogos, Ingenieros, Agrónomos, profesionales indígenas que trabajen directamente en la elaboración y producción de proyectos sustentables basados en el criterio orgánico”, señaló Osvaldo Ferrari.

Para conseguirlo, hace año y medio Osvaldo partió de México e inició el recorrido en bicicleta por 18 países de Latinoamérica, en busca de recursos económicos para concretar el proyecto.

El objetivo es reunir un millón de dólares para el apoyo directo de siete microproyectos que serán la base para construir la Eco-Escuela: Artesanías Indígenas, Granjas Orgánicas, Reciclado de Materiales, Composta y Desechos Orgánicos, Energías Alternativas, Reordenamiento Forestal y Protección del Agua.

“Quizás para nosotros un millón de dólares sea una cifra inalcanzable, y la verdad lo es, pero si un millón de personas pone un dólar, seguro los juntamos, ya que la unión hace la fuerza”.

Sobre las DOS RUEDAS de su bicicleta, en su recorrido por la ruta México-Ushuaia-México que consta de casi 40,000 kilómetros, Osvaldo ha visitado el parque nacional El Aconcagua en Argentina, la Isla Incahuasi  en el Salar de Uyuni –el campo de sal más grande del mundo- ubicado en Bolivia, donde también pedaleó sobre la llamada “carretera de la muerte”.

Panamá, los Andes peruanos y Cayambe en Ecuador, también forman parte del trayecto.    

Durante su recorrido, DOS RUEDAS POR MI GENTE ha contado con la colaboración de empresas privadas como Factor Humano Consultoría Integral, Río Secreto, Grupo Centinelas del Agua, Selk´n y ha recibido el apoyo directo de  organizaciones internacionales en Panamá, Colombia, Honduras y Costa Rica.

En este proyecto colaboran también instituciones como la Earth University con sede en Honduras y Costa Rica, y el Peace Corp., organización norteamericana que a través de voluntarios, dará clases de inglés a los niños de la zona maya.

“3,000 familias indígenas en el área maya de nuestro país son un claro ejemplo de mi inspiración, de la fuerza de mis piernas, con tu ayuda podemos lograrlo”, puntualizó Ferrari.

 “Nuestra meta es generar a los primeros Biólogos, Ingenieros, Agrónomos, profesionales indígenas que trabajen directamente en la elaboración y producción de proyectos sustentables basados en el criterio orgánico”, señaló Osvaldo Ferrari.
Para conseguirlo, hace año y medio Osvaldo partió de México e inició el recorrido en bicicleta por 18 países de Latinoamérica, en busca de recursos económicos para concretar el proyecto.
El objetivo es reunir un millón de dólares para el apoyo directo de siete microproyectos que serán la base para construir la Eco-Escuela: Artesanías Indígenas, Granjas Orgánicas, Reciclado de Materiales, Composta y Desechos Orgánicos, Energías Alternativas, Reordenamiento Forestal y Protección del Agua.
“Quizás para nosotros un millón de dólares sea una cifra inalcanzable, y la verdad lo es, pero si un millón de personas pone un dólar, seguro los juntamos, ya que la unión hace la fuerza”.
Sobre las DOS RUEDAS de su bicicleta, en su recorrido por la ruta México-Ushuaia-México que consta de casi 40,000 kilómetros, Osvaldo ha visitado el parque nacional El Aconcagua en Argentina, la Isla Incahuasi  en el Salar de Uyuni –el campo de sal más grande del mundo- ubicado en Bolivia, donde también pedaleó sobre la llamada “carretera de la muerte”.
Panamá, los Andes peruanos y Cayambe en Ecuador, también forman parte del trayecto.    
Durante su recorrido, DOS RUEDAS POR MI GENTE ha contado con la colaboración de empresas privadas como Factor Humano Consultoría Integral, Río Secreto, Grupo Centinelas del Agua, Selk´n y ha recibido el apoyo directo de  organizaciones internacionales en Panamá, Colombia, Honduras y Costa Rica.
En este proyecto colaboran también instituciones como la Earth University con sede en Honduras y Costa Rica, y el Peace Corp., organización norteamericana que a través de voluntarios, dará clases de inglés a los niños de la zona maya.
“3,000 familias indígenas en el área maya de nuestro país son un claro ejemplo de mi inspiración, de la fuerza de mis piernas, con tu ayuda podemos lograrlo”, puntualizó Ferrari.

story:
Corporate Sponsor(s)



Who are you?                             


               

 Hello world!

First and foremost I'd just like to say this is pretty amazing that platforms that empower you and I to contribute and help others pursue their dreams all around the world in this light are truly game changing. Don't just support but get up and give your best most passionate idea or hobby a go!

                                             

My name is Vitchel Toussaint. I am currently a senior Psychology major and an active member of Alpha Kappa Psi professional business fraternity at the University Of Buffalo and I would like to introduce you to my passion.

My Inspiration:

As I embarked on my journey in college from a freshman to now a senior I've learned and grown into a well-rounded young adult. Much like many other students in the collegiate environment I began college with the idea that it's going to be one big fun party which for the most part it is, however at some point between being a freshman and a senior it usually clicks that studying and doing school work is still an important part of the party; that is if you want to stay past 12 am of course. Hearing about the next party on Facebook was never a problem, reading someone’s random thoughts on Twitter always seemed to be the perfect waste of time or even re-living a buddies drunken night through the lens of instagram usually gave me a nice kick.

             I was seemingly constantly connected with "college" until it clicked. Where do I go for the immediate peer to peer educational connectivity that will help me keep this "party" going? .......

                                                   

                                         Nothing, there was no such thing!

 

The Problem:
           

        Being connected is a very important aspect of the college experience. Students love to know what's going on around them whether it be Friday nights party, the "pre-game" in room 461 or even that rare moment we are being studious and need academic help. We have social media outlets that provide continuous connectivity for the pre-games and parties but nothing tailored to educational connectivity. 

 

             WeStudy will fill that void!

 

OUR Solution:   

                                                 

   

 WeStudy is a mobile IOS and Andriod application that will allow students to be continuously connected for academic purpose. Users will not only be able to see who, where and what their specific (university based) peers are studying as well as tutors to possibly get help or form study groups but they could also shout (create) their own session, make schedules and even be reminded! With the foundation laid this unique service will be topped with many defining features such as the Strength/Weakness feature and many many more. This feature will allow students to get a better feel for their peer's ability to help strengthen their own weakness.

*Early development mock screens*

Designed Screens:







Vision:

    "We envision a time where students will become as much of everyday teachers as they are every day students!"

WeStudy will strive to be the bridge between the interchangeable roles of student & teacher by helping students reach out, connect, study and grow with one another through peer-peer academic interaction.

 

Value Proposition:


 

•Design/Usability: Our product will be simple and easy to use, allowing our users the ability to quickly form study groups and find that help they need . < Save Time >

 

 

•Price: With a younger target market such as ours pricing is key. For the service we bring to our users for free it’s unparalleled. < Cheap >

 

 

 

•Accessibility & Convenience: Users would be able to find tutors, study groups, or create there own on the go < Convenient >


What makes WeStudy Special:
        

"If you wanted to buy a car would you go to a room where people are selling boats, toys,cars & clothing or a room where people are just selling cars? Good choice we're that room"!

By focusing on our core mission of connecting college students for academic purpose we cut out the excess distractions found on other services and give you the most efficient route to peer-peer academic connectivity.

WeStudy will also use other social media outlets in innovative game changing ways to create a well rounded community of users whom have a great hand in development and the overall future of WeStudy. The world around us is constantly changing so why not the face of business? We recognize that our target market is composed of very active, hands on and creative individuals. We want this to be as much of our passion as it is theirs, after all without users and a great experience for them who are we. We will achieve this by opening a Facebook page where our community will be in the "board room" putting in there own input,creating polls and stirring the pot for future updates/features, a twitter page to keep everyone updated about news/ new features and an Instagram for our community to send pictures and reflect on the academic achievement of the people! 

We will strive to embody a business environment as well as a social presence where our community is not only benefiting  from the use of the service but they are also inspired and encouraged to bring there ideas and concepts to the "board room" and with community support have them implemented!


Help Get the ball rolling:

                                           

 We are looking to raise a $7,000. This initial contribution will go towards research & development of the mobile application, securing server space & deployment to our well deserving community. Our development team is hard at work to create the future hub for academic peer to peer connectivity. We are hoping to raise this capital and keep our passion for making a better tomorrow; today! Will you be a part history?

 

The Impact

With your support the problem that many college students today face with finding study partners or just academic help can potentially meet its demise. Every contribution will be a valued part of educational history in the United States and one day even the world. I along with future users greatly appreciate any and every contribution you are willing to give out of the kindness of your heart, for "As one we survive, as a group we thrive" - WeStudy

 

Money is not everything!

                                                


If your unable to contribute monetarily don't be upset or down; its life. Get out into the world spread the word, raise awareness but most importantly be a valued part of something bigger than you or I.

story:
Short Summary

My wife and I found out we were pregnant in Nov 2009. Of course, we were extremely excited and started planning as all new parents do. My wife had a pretty rough regnancy but things seemed to be OK as per ultrasounds and other tests.

When Tyler was born, he was just the cutest little dude in the world. We both worked at home and spent many hours with him. It was all going well, until he started to show some developmental delays at around 10 months old. He didn't sit up on his own and seemed to 'zone out' somewhat. He also didn't really keep too much eye contact.

He was originally diagnosed as Hyper-Defensive Sensory Processing Disorder. In a  nutshell, that means he was ultra sensitive to touch, all over his body. This explained his not crawling and sitting up, and delays in walking also, as the feelings he experienced when trying these things overrode his whole sensory system and he couldn't concentrate.

He started therapy, but it wasn't long before he fell further and further behind and started to 'forget' things he'd learned before. Just before age 3, he was diagnosed with mild/moderate Autistic.

Now one of the GREAT things that happens, is that here in NC, and I believe most other states, There are special classes offered to children in Tyler's situation. They are held full day in small classes of usually 6 to 9 children with one teacher and to teaching assistants. Tyler was lucky enough to be placed full day and the classes offer amazing structure and help in so many ways, especially with social assistance and exposure.

Here's the kicker and the whole reason for this campaign.

Everyone knows most schools are underfunded in the first place. When it comes to allocation of funds, they trickle down and the Pre-K AU (Special Education for Younger children Classes) are almost ALWAYS last to receive funds, if they receive any at all. Special Needs classes are often looked at as the unwanted and things to be ignored.

Now normal fundraising is done through groups like the PTA. However, once again, any funds raised by the PTA very rarely filter down to the special Ed Classrooms.

Special Education teachers are known to typically pay over $1500 a year of their OWN money to buy things for their classes and children. These are not toys and gifts. These are items are that essentially needed to provide a basic education.

My Campaign is to fund Tyler's Classroom (In Wilburn Elementary School) with JUST 5 items. 3 Bookcases... YES something as SIMPLE as a Bookcase is in dire need We need three of them so we can get the books out of plastic tubs. The fourth item would be an Apple iPad and the fifth is a special case to protect it. Autistic children often do very well with technology such as iPads for learning as it helps their focus and simple solving skills, along with learning taking turns and slowing themselves down.

What We Need & What You Get

The entire funding would go towards buying these five (or hopefully more!) items and would be provided immediately to the classroom so they could benefit from them ASAP. The impact of helping children with Autism when they are at such a young age has been scientifically proven to help produce more and more people with Autism function in a more fully functional way in the world. The more help and therapy received by an Autistic child, the better their chances are for progressing to a full-functioning 'normal' or 'typical' classroom with everyday children.

Your generous donation would be a small, but extremely important step in assisting those less fortunate than ourselves and help to fill a great void in our education system for these exceptionally special Children.

If the full goal is not reached, then any money donated will be used to purchase whatever we can for the classroom. Perhaps just one Bookcase. 

If more than the goal is reached, then the remainder of the money would used to purchase more books, and Autistic children are notoriously tough on books and they often need replacing. But again, they're an essential teaching project.

The Impact

Autism is unfortunately an extremely fast growing diagnosis for children in this day and age. Nowadays, 1 in 88 children are diagnosed Autistic. The more progress we can make now, the better we can be prepared for the future and hopefully find a cure for Autism for the the millions of people who are currently and are diagnosed each and every day.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't or don't wish to donate to this campaign, but it still touches you, please think about asking your local elementary school is there is anything their PRE-K AU classrooms may need. It could be as small as a pack of Crayola's, or some Lamination paper. There are always plenty of ways to help and the school teachers would GREATLY appreciate it.

story:
Ponoka Neighborhood Place is located in a rural Central Alberta community of 6800 people with another 10,000 in the surrounding County. All grant funding from Federal, Provincial and Municipal governments has been cut which has left Neighborhood Place with no way of keeping the doors open after serving the community for the past 12 years. We assist an average of 100 residence per month with photo copies, faxing, computer use and referrals to several Central Alberta Service Agencies. We have a direct link to the closest Women's Shelter, Women's Outreach and the Immigration Society (all 50 km. away). Our funded programs to address unhealthy weight prevention among children 2 to 13 years old has had two years of success and is now cancelled due to lack of funding. Indications are that in late 2014 funding from our governments may again be available but we have to get through until then. This is where you come in. With your help NP will continue to thrive and enrich the lives in our community. Please help us stay open. Check out the great perks and make a donation. Any little bit helps. Thanks for watching.

Our video is presented by Kelsey Leigh Johnson from the Tom Todoroff Conservatory in New York. Watch for her to appear on Broadway soon! She is the daughter of our Board Chairperson and lived in Ponoka for all her school years. Thank You for your donation Kelsey!

We have set up an account with PayPal or you can use MasterCard, Visa, American Express or Discovery to make a donation through Indiegogo to Neighborhood Place. You can also help us reach our goal by passing on the "link" to all your Facebook, Twitter and Email contacts.

PLEASE HELP NEIGHBORHOOD PLACE KEEP OUR PROGRAMS RUNNING

story:
Update 6/22: 

We just founded a registered corporation in Japan. It’s called “World Fun Learning Association” (We obviously believe learning should be fun).

Through our activities (including conversation with locals) so far, we realized that we should make us more credible, especially if we want to collaborate with other organizations.

So now we are responsible for corporate tax, financial results and stuff, but it’s worth it!

*Since this corporation might keep working on other non-profit/profit projects after this one, we are not using the money from this campaign for the corporation filing fee. Masaki, the founder, paid from his personal account (it costed about $1400).

 

 

In case you don't know, this is what happened in Tohoku in 2011. 

 

Overview


    In Ishinomaki City, a strong, independent people are taking the first steps back toward rebuilding the community they lost in the tsunami of 2011.  Children whose schools were destroyed are learning again in other schools.  Jobs that were lost in the torrent that washed away businesses and factories are being replaced with rebuilding work.  Emergency funds are providing food and temporary housing for families who lost their homes and their income.  
 

    But these things are not enough.  All of these steps are important, and the people of the city are raising their heads, but so far, these things are just not enough.  The people of this community need ways to interact with each other and with the outside world.  They need access to training in skills available from outside the community.  They need better and faster communications and access to data banks that will allow them to reach out to resources and information in their own community and in the outside world.  They need assistance in becoming a united, independent community again.


Quotes

"Possibly the weakest work skills among local residents is in the IT field and computer literacy. After the disaster, many people didn’t know how to use the computer for communicating with family and friends about their safety or how to find each other." - Japan Daily Press

"In the aftermath, services like Facebook and Twitter surged in users and have become part of Japanese society". - PC World

"...we are focusing on two main areas of online retailing and information sharing, based on building local communities, branding of local products, improving IT literacy and so on." - Takuya HASEGAWA, Yahoo Japan

"Two years later, there is less and less of a focus on the survivors. Both media attention and financial support have decreased." - Sophia Slater,  Huffington Post

 


Temporary housing in Ishinomaki (one of many). Quite a few people there don't have good mental condition.
We plan to visit them to organize fun events such as playing with instrument apps, origami apps, or Karaoke apps on tablets and so on.

 

The Project

  • Provide IT summer classes (July though September) for children, the unemployed, and the eldery who don’t have computer literacy in Ishinomaki city, where 3400 people died because of the tsunami in 2011.

  • For children, introduce a blended learning approach using fun mobile apps and actual tutoring. Teaching English using IT would also be an option.

  • For the elderly, introduce the concept of websites, emails and SNS, and how computers and mobile devices work. Hold recreational events  for the people who live in the temporary housing.

  • In the higher level classes, introduce many affordable/free e-learning services.

  • Take the “Teach a man how to fish instead of giving him a fish” approach. Introduce our learners to opportunities to start sustainable learning.

  • Our project will be called “e-gnite” (igniting e-learning/e-literacy). 

      


Me showing what you can do with a computer to my aunt.

 

Impact

  • Using internet opportunities for increased communication and interaction within the group should allow this community of survivors to be more effective in responding to each other’s needs. (Sadly, there are many people who still live in temporary housing.)
  • We wil try to solve the "digital divide" issue which was huge especially right after the earthquake. The people who didn't know how to use PC/smartphones couldn't get the information about safe areas, open shops, etc. This shouldn't happen IF a similar situation occurs.

  • We will help these learners find e-learning services suitable for each individual. This sustainable learning would make a long term impact for their life.

  • We believe that a demonstrated success in this method works will allow us to implement it in other areas such as Africa or South East Asia.


 
Yahoo Japan Ishinomaki Office. One of our fun classes will be held here. 

 

Who I am 

  • I am an e-learning consultant in Tokyo. My focus is providing right services and tools suitable for my clients, after hearing what they want to learn, for what porpose, until when, etc. Actually, I even ask what their hobbies are to introduce customized solutions. 

  • Although I don't call myself an "engineer", I have basic knowlege of network (Cisco Certified Network Associate), hardware (Linux Professional Institute Certificate), and programming (Oracle Certified Java Programmer Bronze).

  • I myself am a passionate e-learner. After I became 20 years old, I started studying really hard to learn English. I also studied the fundamentals of many languages, including Spanish, French, Chinese, German, and Korean. 
    Although I don’t currently speak these languages well except for English, those study experiences helped me to gain an insight into effective e-learning processes.

  • I have worked as a video game translater and also as an translation coordinator for SquareEnix games. I also translated Tim Ferris’ TED talk.

  • I have also worked as a quality assurance lead tester for global IT companies.

  • I traveled to over 20 countries with a backpack. :)

  • If you are interested in other personal insights into me, please check out my blog.

  

Me teaching computer skills and giving e-learning tips. I believe learning should be fun. I even founded World Fun Learning Association!



How we will use your money

  • We will use it mainly for expenses such as devices, rent for the class room, transportation, Internet connection fee, etc.
    (10 tablets and 2 PCs alone would cost $5000...)

  • If adequate funds are accumulated, we expect to scale up activities by adding more teachers and buying more devices for learner use.

  • All unexpended funds will be donated to NPOs or will be used for possible extension of this project.

  • This is expected to be a non-profit project. No one will receive payment exceeding expenses (such as rent, computers, food, transportation, insurance, and tax).
    *If the funding exceeds our goal, the e-gnite project may form a registered NPO to allow some staff to receive a salary.

 
This is another space we can use for our classes/events. It's owned by NPO "Ishinomaki 2.0".

 

Your Rewards 

  • We will send gifts to you after we finish this project.
    Please see the Perks section.


So far we have these gifts:

 
Thank-you e-mail


 e-book


 original postcards

 
 origami made by students or staff


Charms made from slates of the tsunami-hit area.
(For details please see CharmWorks)

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you could donate us your devices, softwares, or expertise,
    please contact us by e-mail.
story_txt:
Update 6/22: 
We just founded a registered corporation in Japan. It’s called “World Fun Learning Association” (We obviously believe learning should be fun).
Through our activities (including conversation with locals) so far, we realized that we should make us more credible, especially if we want to collaborate with other organizations.
So now we are responsible for corporate tax, financial results and stuff, but it’s worth it!
*Since this corporation might keep working on other non-profit/profit projects after this one, we are not using the money from this campaign for the corporation filing fee. Masaki, the founder, paid from his personal account (it costed about $1400).
 
 
In case you don't know, this is what happened in Tohoku in 2011. 

 
Overview
     In Ishinomaki City, a strong, independent people are taking the first steps back toward rebuilding the community they lost in the tsunami of 2011.  Children whose schools were destroyed are learning again in other schools.  Jobs that were lost in the torrent that washed away businesses and factories are being replaced with rebuilding work.  Emergency funds are providing food and temporary housing for families who lost their homes and their income.   
     But these things are not enough.  All of these steps are important, and the people of the city are raising their heads, but so far, these things are just not enough.  The people of this community need ways to interact with each other and with the outside world.  They need access to training in skills available from outside the community.  They need better and faster communications and access to data banks that will allow them to reach out to resources and information in their own community and in the outside world.  They need assistance in becoming a united, independent community again.
Quotes
"Possibly the weakest work skills among local residents is in the IT field and computer literacy. After the disaster, many people didn’t know how to use the computer for communicating with family and friends about their safety or how to find each other." - Japan Daily Press
"In the aftermath, services like Facebook and Twitter surged in users and have become part of Japanese society". - PC World
"...we are focusing on two main areas of online retailing and information sharing, based on building local communities, branding of local products, improving IT literacy and so on." - Takuya HASEGAWA, Yahoo Japan
"Two years later, there is less and less of a focus on the survivors. Both media attention and financial support have decreased." - Sophia Slater,  Huffington Post
 
Temporary housing in Ishinomaki (one of many). Quite a few people there don't have good mental condition.We plan to visit them to organize fun events such as playing with instrument apps, origami apps, or Karaoke apps on tablets and so on.
 
The Project


Provide IT summer classes (July though September) for children, the unemployed, and the eldery who don’t have computer literacy in Ishinomaki city, where 3400 people died because of the tsunami in 2011.


For children, introduce a blended learning approach using fun mobile apps and actual tutoring. Teaching English using IT would also be an option.


For the elderly, introduce the concept of websites, emails and SNS, and how computers and mobile devices work. Hold recreational events  for the people who live in the temporary housing.


In the higher level classes, introduce many affordable/free e-learning services.

Take the “Teach a man how to fish instead of giving him a fish” approach. Introduce our learners to opportunities to start sustainable learning.


Our project will be called “e-gnite” (igniting e-learning/e-literacy). 
  

Me showing what you can do with a computer to my aunt.
 
Impact

Using internet opportunities for increased communication and interaction within the group should allow this community of survivors to be more effective in responding to each other’s needs. (Sadly, there are many people who still live in temporary housing.)

We wil try to solve the "digital divide" issue which was huge especially right after the earthquake. The people who didn't know how to use PC/smartphones couldn't get the information about safe areas, open shops, etc. This shouldn't happen IF a similar situation occurs.

We will help these learners find e-learning services suitable for each individual. This sustainable learning would make a long term impact for their life.


We believe that a demonstrated success in this method works will allow us to implement it in other areas such as Africa or South East Asia.

 Yahoo Japan Ishinomaki Office. One of our fun classes will be held here. 
 

Who I am 



I am an e-learning consultant in Tokyo. My focus is providing right services and tools suitable for my clients, after hearing what they want to learn, for what porpose, until when, etc. Actually, I even ask what their hobbies are to introduce customized solutions. 


Although I don't call myself an "engineer", I have basic knowlege of network (Cisco Certified Network Associate), hardware (Linux Professional Institute Certificate), and programming (Oracle Certified Java Programmer Bronze).


I myself am a passionate e-learner. After I became 20 years old, I started studying really hard to learn English. I also studied the fundamentals of many languages, including Spanish, French, Chinese, German, and Korean. Although I don’t currently speak these languages well except for English, those study experiences helped me to gain an insight into effective e-learning processes.


I have worked as a video game translater and also as an translation coordinator for SquareEnix games. I also translated Tim Ferris’ TED talk.


I have also worked as a quality assurance lead tester for global IT companies.


I traveled to over 20 countries with a backpack. :)

If you are interested in other personal insights into me, please check out my blog.
  

Me teaching computer skills and giving e-learning tips. I believe learning should be fun. I even founded World Fun Learning Association!

How we will use your money



We will use it mainly for expenses such as devices, rent for the class room, transportation, Internet connection fee, etc.(10 tablets and 2 PCs alone would cost $5000...)


If adequate funds are accumulated, we expect to scale up activities by adding more teachers and buying more devices for learner use.


All unexpended funds will be donated to NPOs or will be used for possible extension of this project.


This is expected to be a non-profit project. No one will receive payment exceeding expenses (such as rent, computers, food, transportation, insurance, and tax).*If the funding exceeds our goal, the e-gnite project may form a registered NPO to allow some staff to receive a salary.

 This is another space we can use for our classes/events. It's owned by NPO "Ishinomaki 2.0".
 

Your Rewards 


We will send gifts to you after we finish this project. Please see the Perks section.
So far we have these gifts:
 Thank-you e-mail
 e-book
 original postcards
  origami made by students or staff

Charms made from slates of the tsunami-hit area.(For details please see CharmWorks)
 
 
Other Ways You Can Help

If you could donate us your devices, softwares, or expertise, please contact us by e-mail.

story:
WHO AM I

I am Aunampai Passackchai, Buddhist nun and Director of Dhammajarinee Witthaya School, the first and only free boarding school for girls in poverty in Thailand.  In Thailand boys who are poor or orphaned can go to a temple as a novice monk and receive an education. This has not been the case for girls. Seeing this inequality and the devastating consequences, this school was founded.  Please watch our video and kindly help us build a new building to protect hundreds of more girls who wish to come because they lack educational opportunity.  All donations go directly to the school.

THE PROBLEM

Many poor families in Thailand are not able to send their daughters to school, or past grade school, and instead young girls are often employed in degrading occupations putting them at risk of exploitation, abuse, AIDs, depression and addiction.  Due to socio-economic problems and recent natural disasters, girls in poverty are more vulnerable than ever before. There are 430 girls attending Dhammajarinee Witthaya School. Many come from broken homes and are often abused, abandoned, or orphans, or have failed in other schools. More girls want to come, but we lack space and need your help.

OUR CAMPAIGN / SOLUTION

A plan to construct a large new classroom building for about 500 more girls is underway. Some money has come from the government and private donors but we still need to quickly raise $135,000. Your contribution will enable all current students to finish high school, hundreds of more students to come next year, and it will help thousands of girls who will graduate from this school in the future.

OUR SCHOOL

Our charity school is highly rated and respected for its quality education and focus on development of character and integrity to help young women become successful leaders, educators and mothers. The school incorporates meditation to reduce the trauma most these girls have experienced early in their lives. Worldwide it is well documented that when you educate a girl in poverty, you give her and her family a higher standard of living and her village is cleaner. You give her better health, and her children are healthier and more educated and grow up to respect and protect women. This is the real foundation of a peaceful, progressive world. These girls depend on the generous support of people like you.

We need your donation to help more girls to create a better world !!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute, you can still hugely help these girls:

Do you want to join my promotion team?

Ask all of your friends to get the word out. This is easy to do if you use  the Indiegogo share tools at the bottom of the video screen above to email to friends,  and post on Facebook, Tweeter etc! IF you donate, please make a comment.


AGAIN THANK YOU for your appreciation of this valuable cause!

story:
Funding the homeless-shelter / low-income / labor contingent at NYC Pride on June 30th!

The first Pride March took place in 1969 in response to police violence and the raiding of the Stonewall Inn, a gay bar catering to marginalized members of the queer community. Since then Pride has evolved in such a way that the most marginalized queer and trans* folks are excluded. Queers for Economic Justice is looking to make NYC Pride accessible to poor and working class LGBTQ+ folks, and we need your help!

"I never really felt invited to the Gay Pride March, you know. I mean, I'm queer and I live in a homeless shelter.  So every June, it felt like it was a Pride March for somebody else.  Until I joined Queers for Economic Justice (QEJ) and marched in their LGBTQ homeless, low-income, and labor contingent.  Then I had a place that was mine.  I finally got my invitation."                  

- Juliet, Third Street Women's Shelter

Pride should be inclusive of our entire community, and this means supporting folks so that they can even make it to the march. Your donations will help us offer 120 NYC shelter residents the opportunity to claim their place in this movement. The contributions of poor queers have always been integral in advancing LGBTQ+ rights, and it's time to stop excluding them.

About Queers for Economic Justice

QEJ is a progressive non-profit organization committed to promoting economic justice in a context of sexual and gender liberation.  Founded in 2002, we have grown to be a trusted resource and advocate for poor queers in New York City. Our goal is to challenge and change the systems that create poverty and economic injustice in our communities, and to promote an economic system that embraces sexual and gender diversity.

We are committed to the principle that access to social and economic resources is a fundamental right, and we work to create social and economic equity through grassroots organizing, public education, advocacy and research.

We do this work because although poor queers have always been a part of both the gay rights and economic justice movements, they have been, and continue to be, largely invisible in the economic justice and LGBTQ+ movements.  This work will always be informed by the lived experiences and expressed needs of queer people in poverty.

What We Need & What You Get

We are hoping to raise enough money to facilitate 120 LGBTQ+ shelter residents' participation in the upcoming NYC Pride march. In order to do this, we need:

 

  • round trip Metrocards ($5 x 120 = $600)
  • bottled water to keep hydrated in the heat ($2 x 120 = $240)
  • brown bag lunches ($3 x 120 = $360)
  • breakfast - bagels, coffee, fruit - for our volunteers ($300)
  • gas & parking money for the vans we will use to transport supplies & folks with health/mobility concerns who cannot travel on the subway ($100)
  • supplies to make a banner & signs ($200)
  • blank t-shirts, stencils, & spray paint for participants to make their own Pride wear ($700)
  • dinner for volunteers & shelter residents who will miss their meals for the evening ($400)
  • the entry fee for our organization (their suggested amount is $1500, but we'll take - and give - what we can get)

 

When you donate, (depending on how much) you'll receive a sticker, poster, keychain, or t-shirt branded with the Queers for Economic Justice name and logo as a token of our gratitude.

The above costs are listed in descending order of priority. If we do not raise the full amount, the money we do have will fund necessities such as transportation/food/water, and we will adjust our budget accordingly.

Other Ways You Can Help

We recognize that not everyone is able to donate money. If you want to help out but can't chip in dollars, you can:

- Pass on this link! Seriously, share it far & wide on every site you can.

- Like us on Facebook to stay up to date with all of our campaigns & events.

- Volunteer! This is something you can do any time of year! We especially need help with prep the days leading up to NYC Pride (the last few days of June) as well as the big day itself! Email april@q4ej.org or call us at 212.564.3608 for more information.

- We also take donations at all times on our website, if you want to contribute money in the future.

- Tell people about us! Get our name out there, especially to folks who might want to be a part of our contingent or partner with our organization.

- Come to Pride and cheer us on!

story:
The Big Picture

Politics around the American education system is raging and much of it is focused on teachers.

  • How do we best evaluate teachers?
  • How much should test scores determine teacher worth?
  • How many ways we can evaluate the characteristics of a great teacher?
  • How can we get more teachers to produce the same results as successful teachers?

Meanwhile, many educators feel overworked and/or pressured to make curriculum choices that focus more on standardization and current evaluation systems than on the creativity and relevancy needs of their students. It's no wonder that teacher job dissatisfaction and student apathy are at all time highs.

 

So while political debates continue to work towards a better tomorrow,we work to support the individual teacher and their students in the classroom TODAY.

 

 

 

OUR UNIQUE ORGANIZATION

 

Our organization works at two levels:

  1. Direct support for the teacher 
  2. Unique programs for students 

 

Personal Assistance to Individual Teachers

We provide our teachers with: 

  • coaching and modeled lessons online and in the classroom
  • weekly email with lessons and resources
  • personalized lesson design or research
  • resources on our website or by request

                                  

Our goal is to make it as easy as possible for teachers to bring creativity and relevancy back to the classroom.     

 

Student Programs

We also provide three student programs that support the work teachers are doing in class: the Scholastic Art and Writing Awards, NAS (Not A Statistic—to combat the Achievement Gap) and Voices In Verse (a spoken word youth poetry curriculum and competition).

 

 

Please visit our website to learn more about each individual program. We also invite you to read the comments from teachers and students.

 

Membership with our organization has been steadily growing and we have expanded to meet the needs of more teachers and students, but we have been struck with a problem.

The Problem

In order to meet growing demands, we turned The English Teacher's Friend into a nonprofit in January of 2012 and we filed for 501c3 status. This would enable us to apply for grants and larger sponsorships in an effort to reach more teachers and students.

 

The normal processing time for a nonprofit organization to receive their 501c3 status is 3-6 months. But due to an IRS backlog, we waited an unprecedented 16 months.Without this 501c3 status, we were unable to apply for grants or secure sponsorships. Although we were prepared for the standard wait period, we were simply unable to compensate for a 16 month delay AND the unpredicted (albeit pleasing) growth we have seen.

How Your Donation Will Help

The start of school is upon us and the next 3-6 months are the busiest and most important in the school year for our organization and for the teachers and students we serve.

 

In order to best assist the teachers, saving them countless hours by providing learning materials and support, we need to be able to keep our four curriculum members on staff.

 

We also have 3 student programs that all kick off in the fall (in order to utilize the most time with students). These programs will need funding primarily through August and September.

 

Because we just received our 501c3 status in June, we have only just begun the grant writing process. It will be months before we see any results. What we need now is funding to cover the minimum costs for the next 5 months.

 

               

What Your Donation Will Cover

We have various other sources of revenue, but until our grant funding starts coming in we need a minimum of $48,500

 

The complete $48,500 will provide the following:

 

  • Personalized assistance for 300+ middle and high school English teachers. These quality lessons and resources focus on engagement, creativity and relevancy potentially reaching 30,000 students throughout the US (mostly in Florida).
  • Writing and Common Core Professional Development for 200+ middle and high school English and Social Studies teachers.
  • Writing workshops and individualized instruction for 200+ middle and high school students.
  • Partial salary for 5 staff members Aug – Nov 2013. (Executive Director is not taking a salary during this time) 

 

Against the Odds

We have chosen a very quick, aggressive campaign even though some have suggested a smaller, longer campaign.

 

We do not want to bombard our friends and members with fundraising requests. And more importantly, we want to dedicate all our time to helping teachers and their students. We are hoping to get the support so we can get to work.

 

 

We know that $48,500 is a lofty goal.

 

But we believe our members, friends, and those who know our students need more creative outlets in our schools will spread the word quickly to help us reach this goal.  

 

Perks for Supporters

Most of our perks in the $5 -250 range are specific for teachers. The perks in the $500 - $2,000 range are geared towards businesses. Please review the perks offered and if you want to negotiate another option, we are more than happy to do that as well. Just contact us.

 

 

 

We thank you so much for your support

If you have any questions, please contact us.

 

If you cannot provide a financial donation, we would be most grateful if you can forward this to friends and family, share on Facebook, ask others help us through this phase. 

 

We cannot do this without you.

We cannot do this without you.

story:
Michigan State University Students Advancing International Development (SAID) is a student-driven organization focused on community development issues in the greater Coimbatore, India. SAID was formed after students traveled to India on an “International Development and Markets” study abroad. To keep the partnership strong between MSU and many of the organizations there, SAID continues to choose projects relevant to the communities visited on the trip. With the help of our international partner, the Shanti Ashram a community center in southern India, projects with the highest need are chosen.

I became a SAID member after participating in the “International Development and Markets in India” study abroad program after my freshman year at MSU (2009). During the trip we worked with a wide variety of women’s nonprofits as well as a local community center, the Shanti Ashram of Coimbatore, India. SAID was formed with aims to continue the international partnerships formed during the trip, advocate for many of the important issues studied while we there and fundraise to help advance the goals of the Shanti Ashram. Past projects MSU SAID has sponsored include child immunizations, food security centers and sanitation infastructure. Through my continued work with SAID and the Ashram I have learned a great deal about many international issues the may otherwise feel far-away for a young American.

This year’s project is no different. For the past 9 months SAID has been working to send rural and impoverished girls in Tamil Nadu to high school and college. All proceeds from the Gala will go directly to The Aakkam Fund, a revolving scholarship fund for girl's education, implemented through the Shanti Ashram. For the equivalent of approximately $160 USD, these women from extremely vulnerable families will be granted the opportunity to attend school for a minimum of one year (that’s less than one credit hour at MSU!). As you can see, a small contribution can go very far to provide education for these women and offer a life free of poverty and true independence.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Also, please consider attending 4th Annual SAID gala for Women's Education in India.
This year’s event will be both educational and entertaining. There will be a traditional Indian buffet, beautiful handmade items directly from India as part of our silent auction, a live musical performance, and much more. For the very first time, we will also be airing interviews with some of the Indian girls who have previously benefited from the Aakkam Fund, as well as a message from the President of the Shanti Ashram.

Please come enjoy yourself at the event if at all possible! It’s a great way to spend a relaxing Friday evening, learning more about OUR world, and all while giving back.

To purchase tickets directly please visit http://msusaidgalaevent.eventbrite.com

Namasté.
story_txt:
Michigan State University Students Advancing International Development (SAID) is a student-driven organization focused on community development issues in the greater Coimbatore, India. SAID was formed after students traveled to India on an “International Development and Markets” study abroad. To keep the partnership strong between MSU and many of the organizations there, SAID continues to choose projects relevant to the communities visited on the trip. With the help of our international partner, the Shanti Ashram a community center in southern India, projects with the highest need are chosen.

I became a SAID member after participating in the “International Development and Markets in India” study abroad program after my freshman year at MSU (2009). During the trip we worked with a wide variety of women’s nonprofits as well as a local community center, the Shanti Ashram of Coimbatore, India. SAID was formed with aims to continue the international partnerships formed during the trip, advocate for many of the important issues studied while we there and fundraise to help advance the goals of the Shanti Ashram. Past projects MSU SAID has sponsored include child immunizations, food security centers and sanitation infastructure. Through my continued work with SAID and the Ashram I have learned a great deal about many international issues the may otherwise feel far-away for a young American. This year’s project is no different. For the past 9 months SAID has been working to send rural and impoverished girls in Tamil Nadu to high school and college. All proceeds from the Gala will go directly to The Aakkam Fund, a revolving scholarship fund for girl's education, implemented through the Shanti Ashram. For the equivalent of approximately $160 USD, these women from extremely vulnerable families will be granted the opportunity to attend school for a minimum of one year (that’s less than one credit hour at MSU!). As you can see, a small contribution can go very far to provide education for these women and offer a life free of poverty and true independence.

 


Other Ways You Can Help
Also, please consider attending 4th Annual SAID gala for Women's Education in India. This year’s event will be both educational and entertaining. There will be a traditional Indian buffet, beautiful handmade items directly from India as part of our silent auction, a live musical performance, and much more. For the very first time, we will also be airing interviews with some of the Indian girls who have previously benefited from the Aakkam Fund, as well as a message from the President of the Shanti Ashram.
Please come enjoy yourself at the event if at all possible! It’s a great way to spend a relaxing Friday evening, learning more about OUR world, and all while giving back. To purchase tickets directly please visit http://msusaidgalaevent.eventbrite.com Namasté.

story:
Opening Statement

Empowered Sparks, Inc. is a mentoring program for girls ages 8-18 in Greensboro, NC. Now in our 4th year, Empowered Sparks is fulfilling its mission “ to empower girls ages eight through eighteen to understand core values, to provide educational opportunities that promote positive self awareness, increase self-esteem, build confidence, develop leadership skills and enhance spiritual growth.” Empowered Sparks offers affordable quality programs and social enrichment activities that promote the character values of caring, honesty, respect and responsibility.

“Since its inception in 2010 Empowered Sparks, Inc. has served over 75 girls in Southeast Greensboro, NC through bi-monthly meetings held from September to May.  An educational travel experience in June and  a summer  leadership camp in July make up our summer curriculum.  

Our goal of $35,000 will help to expose our participants to the experiences that will foster their potential in education, leadership, and developing the tools necessary to become confident, productive members of a global community. 

Video Explained

This video is from our 3rd annual leadership camp in Brown Summit, NC. 

The summer camp program provides girls with overnight and day camp adventures that give them an opportunity to connect with nature, to participate in human powered activities and to benefit from personal and primary relationships. Campers come from diverse socio-economic backgrounds throughout the greater Greensboro area and make lifelong friendships, while enjoying an environment where social barriers cease to exist.

During the week long summer camp program all participants gain:

·  Increased environmental awareness and responsibility

·  Knowledge on serving others and teamwork

·  Tools to develop self-reliance, emotional strength, and pride

The Sparks are inspired and want to learn; we are expanding every year as we begin our 4th season. 

Your donation is the "Match to light our Spark!"


Where Your Money Goes

The purpose of the funding is to enable Empowered Sparks, Inc. the opportunity to continue providing quality summer programs, events, and activities for girls in the community throughout the acedemic year (September-April).

Scholarship Perks

Empowered Sparks graduating from high school and continuing on to college are given the opportunity to earn financial assistance in the form of scholarships.  This process is earned and award through academic and character achievement.
Matching

Over the years several sponsors have matched our local fundraising efforts enabling and sustaining our vision on a local level.

Your donation will be the "MATCH" needed to continue lighting our Sparks' future path!

The Empowered Sparks is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization. The funds that are collected for this organization will go directly to help in fulfilling our mission which is to empower girls ages eight through eighteen to understand core values, to provide educational opportunities that promote positive self awareness, increase self esteem, confidence, leadership skills and spiritual growth.
