story:
Texte en français plus bas 


OBJECTIVE

The Biblios ZEO project (Zone d'Education Ouverte, i.e. Open Zone of Education) is an educational project for children, designed to offer bookcases and computers in schools in Haiti. The objective is to help them learn and open themselves to the world while providing them tools to rebuild after the earthquake 4 years ago.

CONCEPT

To provide children from 2 to 12 years old with multi-media space (books in a bookcase and computers with educational software) in their school.

IMPLEMENTATION

• Mamalu Kindergarten et Ecole fondamentale Mixte

Discover the school and the children: 

https://www.facebook.com/mamalukids?fref=ts

• more than 250 students

• Development of an educational project in partnership with Valérie Lamy, director of the school and her teaching staff.

• Project planned for September 2014.

" Knowledge is the ultimate renewable resource, which grows over its operations. And when this resource grows, the opportunities for its owners is growing. ''  Bernard Vergnes


WHY SUPPORTING Biblios ZEO ?

• A participatory project

⁃ Involvement of the local community who will benefit from the project : bookcases will be decorated by children, discovery workshops with children and cultural exchange.

⁃ promote the local economy : bookcases built with materials purchased locally and by the people on-site.

• A sustainable project

⁃ The structure of Rotary International provides on-site support to ensure the autonomy and continuity of the project.

⁃ Training planned for the school’s team in case of any technical problems with the computers.

• Your money well spent

⁃ Total budget: $9,000

⁃ 10 computers with software on Linux

⁃ Book donations : need 600 books



HOW TO CONTRIBUTE ?

• In-kind donations (books, tickets, Air Miles, transport tickets, ... ).

• Financial support.

• Follow the île de Montreal Rotaract Club on Facebook and help us promote the project Biblios ZEO .


For more information, please contact at info@rotaract-idm.com.

www.rotaract-idm.com 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Texte en français 

OBJECTIF

Les Biblios ZEO (Zone d'Education Ouverte) est un projet éducatif conçu pour offrir aux enfants d'une école en Haïti les moyens d'apprendre et de s'ouvrir sur le monde.

CONCEPT

Mettre à disposition des enfants de 2 à 12 ans des livres (contes et histoires) dans une bibliothèque ainsi que des ordinateurs munis de logiciels éducatifs.

REALISATION

• Mamalu Kindergarten et Ecole fondamentale Mixte

Découvrez l'école et les enfants qui bénéficieront de l'espace éducatif: 

https://www.facebook.com/mamalukids?fref=ts

• pour plus de 250 élèves

• Développement du projet éducatif en partenariat avec Valérie Lamy, directrice de l'école et de son école pédagogique

• Projet planifié pour septembre 2014.

" Le savoir est la ressource renouvelable ultime, celle qui croît au fil de son exploitation. Et lorsque cette ressource s’étoffe, les opportunités de ses détenteurs se multiplient. ''  Bernard Vergnes


POURQUOI SUPPORTER LE PROJET BIBLIOS ZEO? 

• Un projet participatif

⁃ Implication de la communauté locale qui en bénéficiera dans la réalisation du projet: décoration des bibliothèques par les enfants, ateliers de découverte avec les enfants et échange culturel.

⁃ Favoriser l'économie locale: construction avec les matériaux achetés sur place et par les personnes sur place. 

• Un projet durable

⁃ La structure du Rotary International assurera un support sur place pour garantir l'autonomie et la continuité du projet.

⁃ Formation des personnes sur place en cas de problèmes techniques.

• Votre argent bien investi

⁃ Budget Total: 9,000$

⁃ 10 ordinateurs équipés de logiciels éducatifs

⁃ Dons de livres: besoin de 600 livres


Qui sommes-nous?

Le Club Rotaract de l’île de Montréal est une association à but non lucratif établie à Montréal, qui regroupe une douzaine de jeunes gens motivés à consacrer leur énergie et leur temps à la communauté locale et internationale.

Le Club Rotaract de l’île de Montréal a été créé en 2011 au sein du district 7040 du réseau Rotary et est parrainé par le Club Rotary Montréal Ville-Marie.  Notre Club est issu de la synergie entre deux groupes de jeunes francophones: ceux désireux d’étendre leur réseau international, et ceux qui souhaitent continuer leur implication philanthropique après leurs études. Notre Club est constitué d’individus aux parcours divers et variés, et a pour ambition de s’appuyer sur cette diversité pour mettre en œuvre un programme d’aide et d’orientation pour les jeunes.

Notre mission : l’éducation des jeunes par les jeunes.

Pour toute question, contactez-nous à tout moment à l'adresse suivante: info@rotaract-idm.com.

www.rotaract-idm.com

story:
We are Portland Earth Art and Agriculture Project.

As a community organization, we teach gardening in schools, facilitate after school nature programs, run Earth Based camps, and cultivate opportunities with local chefs, artists and other sustainability focused professionals.

We are excited about branching out to do even more.

Currently we bring our outdoor learning programs to neighborhood schools in the Portland Public School district. We are looking to provide other metro area schools with our Place Based, ecological, earth science education. In 2009 our seeds began to sprout when we started offering Garden Education in one school in Southeast Portland. Soon after we developed a Summer curriculum to bridge the school year. The school day expanded to after school learning through our SEASONS program. In 2012 we added our Garden Education school year programing to two additional metro area schools.  This year a fourth school was added. This growing program seeks yet more schools and students to share this vital experiential curriculum. We are currently creating specific packages to offer to schools. This refinement in our programming will make it easy for schools to see how we can fit into their preexisting curriculum, schedules, and budgets.

Over the last several years we have collaborated with local chefs through education programs and Garden To Table events in the schools where our programs run. As we continue this collaboration, we look to increase educational opportunities. In 2013 we partnered with a Garden Chef who manages gardens for local restaurants. The Garden Chef Partnership nurtures environment and local economy while also providing a community connection that "feeds" all parties involved. This close-knit connection not only sets the stage for quality of produce but fosters creativity particularly for the chefs as seasonal menus flourish within this system. This exemplifies the values that are at the core of Portland Earth Art and Agriculture Project.

Some of the ways we are looking to Branch Out include working with Local Farms, delivering educational resources to the public, creating Whole Family outdoor retreats, continuing to provide educational resources in local schools, and grow our thriving Summer Program.

Help us share our passion...

We currently run on a shoe string budget and are active in many communities. Although we have been extremely resourceful, this work does come with a great price, and we need funding to support our extensive efforts. Every expansion requires an investment. At this moment we are a State non-profit, based in Portland, Oregon. We are in the process of becoming a 501(c)(3) federal non-profit. Your greatly appreciated donations will not be tax deductible, but will reach children and garden educators in the Portland Area.

Your vital contributions will help us become a federal non-profit, allowing us to branch out and reach even more communities. You'll make our dream a reality.

Thank You~

Please check out our blog to learn more.

earthartag.blogspot.com

story:
Introduction

Being a woman in leadership is not easy. Although women are often very skilled and highly educated, many talented women step down or choose different directions when the female qualities are not appreciated by the organisation they are operating in.

Why would society require women to be like men? 

This is a story of women supporting women to bring certain values to the table of power.

We kindly ask for you contribution in order to be able:

-  to bring inspiring women from around the world to Belgium and share their experiences and visions.
-  to support talented women from developing countries to attend the conference.
-  to help us out financially to make the first edition of this wonderful conference a success.


The Conference

The conference is a three-day event, held on 3-4-5 June 2014, that focuses on providing tools, knowledge and skills to female leaders, both current and future. The conference will bring together 150 women from around the globe to share experiences, create connections and learn valuable information that will allow them to improve and develop there leadership skills.

Women who are in, or aspire to be in, leadership roles face very particular challenges and opportunies. This conference shall confront these challenges, provide pioneering solutions and place participants in the mindset to create positive change and fully realize their potential. Through accelerated learning methods, workshops, keynote addresses and networking opportunities the conference shall inspire, empower and educate.

We are at an age in human history where innovative and inspirational management and leadership are essential on a global scale. An important part of this is to utilizing all of human capability and this means the inclusion and promotion of women who will create a better tomorrow.

For more information visit: www.globalfemaleleadership.com

 

The Story

Our story begins on Facebook.

As the founder of D-Creation Study Tours, my team and I encourage dreaming, discovering and creating a new destiny or reality. We bring delegations from
all over the world to the heart of Europe to be inspired and believe in
the possibilities which are all around.

It was last September while attending a workshop in New York, USA, when I
started dreaming about organizing an international Female Leadership Conference
in Belgium. I was lucky to be in the conference center where the Women &
Power Conference of Omega’s Women’s Leadership center was held. These ladies
gave me an enormous ‘wow’-feeling. It was just beautiful to feel the oneness
amongst them. To watch their style and dedication and to learn about their
visions and insights.

Only a few weeks after this experience a truly inspiring facebook post
caught my eyes. It turned out to be posted by How to be a Business Woman, a
Dutch organization, which had started recently and was managed by 2 young high
potential women.

After the first meeting we discovered the similarities between ourselves were
shocking and we immediately felt a co-operation would bring a beautiful synergy
between ourselves and our organizations.

After this encounter more and more inspiring ladies came on the scene. But it was in South Africa, where the event started to fly. Mrs Philisiwe Twala-Tau, CEO of Gauteng Entreprise Propellor, and Mrs Dudu Maseko, Executive Director Community Development at Johannesburg City, liked the idea of an inspirational Female Leadership Conference and became partner in the project.

All partners aim encouraging women to believe in their potential, assisting them in
their personal development and supporting them in leadership positions.

We would like to ask for your support in organizing a unique conference
where European business women, international female leaders and political
decision makers from around the world unite and take the lead in creating
a positive change.

 

The Team

D-Creation, Lien de Zutter (founder)

We are an international team of young professionals with extensive experience in public-private partnerships and alliances. We offer complete services to individuals and delegations who are open to international experiences.

Our mission is to provide assistance in creating respectful sustainable development in all layers of society, to link people and organisations in order to create the synergy required for excellence.

 


How to be a Business Woman, Mabel Duchossoy & Crystal Kwee 

www.howtobeabusinesswoman.nl

We believe every women has the right to discover her full potential.

We are committed to offering women the inspiration and empowerment to help them achieve their goals. By making personal development accessible and life changing we encourage ambitious women to develop their strenght and confidence so that they are able to contribute their most to the world.

 

 

          

Gauteng Enterprise Propellor, Philisiwe Twala-Tau (CEO)

 


          

City of Johannesburg, Dudu Maseko (Executive Director Community Development)

 

George Seitisho, Patron South Africa

 

Annelies Cretel, Brazil Relations Manager

 

Leen Verschraegen, Honorary Consul of the Kingdom of the Netherlands

story:
FR:

Que voulons-nous faire ?

Touché par l’investissement de notre ambassadeur, Cyril Depres, Evilard Watch
souhaite contribuer aux projets de la Fondation Fabrizio Meoni et Cyril
Despres. Notre but est de récolter un maximum d'argent pour permettre à la
Fondation de continuer ses projets d'écoles dans les pays défavorisés. 

EN:

What do we want?

Touched by the personal commitment of our ambassador, Cyril Despres, Evilard Watch wishes to contribute to the Fabrizio Meoni & Cyril Despres' Foundation. Our objective is to raise money to enable the foundation  to continue its projects for schools in underdeveloped countries.

FR:

Qu’est-ce que la fondation a déjà accompli ?

Les mots de Cyril Despres :

Mon coéquipier Fabrizio Meoni est décédé quelques jours avant la fin du Dakar 2005... Il ne parlait pas beaucoup mais nous savions qu’il finançait une école dans la banlieue de Dakar. Le lendemain de l’arrivée, avec ses amis italiens, nous sommes allés visiter l’école qui portait son nom. Les 200 enfants présents ce jour-là étaient profondément émus par la disparition de leur parrain. Il ne nous a pas fallu longtemps pour décider de continuer le travail de Fabrizio, à la fois dans le but d’honorer sa mémoire et d’aider les habitants d’un pays qui nous a accueillis à bras ouverts.

À l’arrivée du Dakar 2006, nous avons visité d’autres projets dans la périphérie de Dakar avec certains responsables de la fondation Fabrizio Meoni. Le choix s’est porté sur la rénovation et l’agrandissement d’une deuxième école à Yeumbeul Bene Baraque. Quelques mois plus tard, les travaux de "’École Fabrizio et Cyril" débutaient. Le Dakar ne sillonne peut-être plus l’Afrique, mais l’école a désormais des murs, un toit, de bons professeurs et surtout de nombreux enfants qui préparent leur avenir.


Lors de ma dernière visite en février 2012, il y avait 1 directeur, 13 professeurs et 321 élèves âgés de 3 à 17 ans. Mais 500 enfants des environs ne sont pas encore scolarisés.
Notre ambition : en accueillir le plus grand nombre.
Our ambition; to open our doors to more children.

 

EN:

What the foundation has already accomplished?

Cyril Despres’ words:

My team-mate Fabrizio Meoni died a few days before the end of the 2005 Dakar...He didn’t talk much about it, but we knew he financed a school in the suburbs of Dakar. The day after the finish, with his Italian friends, we went to visit the school that carried his name. The two hundred children there that day were deeply moved by the death of their patron. It didn’t take us long to decide to continue Fabrizio’s work, both to pay homage to his memory and to help the people of a country who had always welcomed us with open arms.

At the finish of the 2006 Dakar, along with some of the people from the Fabrizio Meoni Foundation, we visited other projects on the outskirts of Dakar. Finally we decided to renovate and enlarge a second school at Yeumbeul Bene Baraque. A few months later work started on "the Fabrizio and Cyril School".

The Dakar maybe doesn’t run through Africa any more, but the school now has walls, a roof, good teachers and above all many children who prepare their future.

On my last visit, in February 2012, there was a director, 13 teachers and 321 children aged between 3 and 17. But 500 children living in the area still don’t have a place in school.


FR:

Quels sont les prochains projets?

Grâce aux dons récoltés avec Indiegogo, nous aimerions donner accès à l’école à de plus en plus d’enfants défavorisés.

EN:

What are the future projects ? 

Thanks to your donations on Indiegogo, we will be able to give more and more kids the opportunity to attend school.

 

FR:

Plus d'info

Découvrez notre site internet et notre page Facebook.
Merci pour votre générosité et Bonne Chance!
N'hésitez pas à partager cette campagne.

EN:

More info

Have a look at our website and our Facebook page.
Thank you for your generosity and Good Luck!
Do not hesitate to share this campaign.

FR:Que voulons-nous faire ?Touché par l’investissement de notre ambassadeur, Cyril Depres, Evilard Watchsouhaite contribuer aux projets de la Fondation Fabrizio Meoni et CyrilDespres. Notre but est de récolter un maximum d'argent pour permettre à laFondation de continuer ses projets d'écoles dans les pays défavorisés. EN:What do we want?Touched by the personal commitment of our
ambassador, Cyril Despres, Evilard Watch wishes to contribute to the Fabrizio
Meoni & Cyril Despres' Foundation. Our objective is to raise money to enable the
foundation  to continue its projects for schools
in underdeveloped countries.FR:Qu’est-ce que la fondation a déjà accompli ?Les mots de Cyril Despres :Mon coéquipier Fabrizio Meoni est décédé quelques jours avant la fin du Dakar 2005... Il ne parlait pas beaucoup mais nous savions qu’il finançait une école dans la banlieue de Dakar. Le lendemain de l’arrivée, avec ses amis italiens, nous sommes allés visiter l’école qui portait son nom. Les 200 enfants présents ce jour-là étaient profondément émus par la disparition de leur parrain. Il ne nous a pas fallu longtemps pour décider de continuer le travail de Fabrizio, à la fois dans le but d’honorer sa mémoire et d’aider les habitants d’un pays qui nous a accueillis à bras ouverts. À l’arrivée du Dakar 2006, nous avons visité d’autres projets dans la périphérie de Dakar avec certains responsables de la fondation Fabrizio Meoni. Le choix s’est porté sur la rénovation et l’agrandissement d’une deuxième école à Yeumbeul Bene Baraque. Quelques mois plus tard, les travaux de "’École Fabrizio et Cyril" débutaient. Le Dakar ne sillonne peut-être plus l’Afrique, mais l’école a désormais des murs, un toit, de bons professeurs et surtout de nombreux enfants qui préparent leur avenir.Lors de ma dernière visite en février 2012, il y avait 1 directeur, 13 professeurs et 321 élèves âgés de 3 à 17 ans. Mais 500 enfants des environs ne sont pas encore scolarisés. Notre ambition : en accueillir le plus grand nombre.Our ambition; to open our doors to more children. EN:What the foundation has already accomplished?Cyril Despres’ words:My team-mate Fabrizio Meoni died a few days before the end of the 2005 Dakar...He didn’t talk much about it, but we knew he financed a school in the suburbs of Dakar. The day after the finish, with his Italian friends, we went to visit the school that carried his name. The two hundred children there that day were deeply moved by the death of their patron. It didn’t take us long to decide to continue Fabrizio’s work, both to pay homage to his memory and to help the people of a country who had always welcomed us with open arms. At the finish of the 2006 Dakar, along with some of the people from the Fabrizio Meoni Foundation, we visited other projects on the outskirts of Dakar. Finally we decided to renovate and enlarge a second school at Yeumbeul Bene Baraque. A few months later work started on "the Fabrizio and Cyril School". The Dakar maybe doesn’t run through Africa any more, but the school now has walls, a roof, good teachers and above all many children who prepare their future. On my last visit, in February 2012, there was a director, 13 teachers and 321 children aged between 3 and 17. But 500 children living in the area still don’t have a place in school.FR:Quels sont les prochains projets?Grâce aux dons récoltés avec Indiegogo, nous aimerions donner accès à l’école à de plus en plus d’enfants défavorisés.EN:What are the future projects ?  Thanks to your donations on Indiegogo, we will be able to give more and more kids the opportunity
to attend school. FR:Plus d'infoDécouvrez notre site internet et notre page Facebook.Merci pour votre générosité et Bonne Chance!N'hésitez pas à partager cette campagne.EN:More infoHave a look at our website and our Facebook page.Thank you for your generosity and Good Luck!Do not hesitate to share this campaign.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Grayson and I am 14 years old. I attend the Lab School of Washington which is a unique and fantastic school for kids with learning disabilities (in my case, dyslexia). My school understands that kids like me learn differently and one of the ways they teach is through experiential learning. In the last few years, Lab has offered a travel program to kids who are interviewed and then approved to go on these trips. This year, the trip is to South Africa. It will be my first trip outside the United States. 

I feel that this is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity. It is an educational tour of the country and I will learn a lot. Some of the things we will learn about and visit while we are there are: 

  1. Soweto (Homes of the Mandelas and Bishop Tutu, Apartheid Museum, and more)
  2. Kruger National Park (local school, traditional village, full-day game drive, and more)
  3. Johannesburg (bush walk, Pilgrim's Rest, and more)
  4. Cape Town (Table Mountain, Robben Island, South Africa Museum, and more)

I am asking friends and relatives to help me reach my goal of funding my trip. I will learn more about this part of the world than I ever could by reading about it in a book. By going to the actual location, I will understand how it feels to be a part of the history, it will be more real to me and I will see with my own eyes the magnitude of the events that took place there. I will also get perspective on the life that I lead here by seeing how people live there.

If you're unable to contribute, perhaps you know someone who might.  Please forward this link to them because every little bit helps.

story:
Hello Friends, Family, & World

The experiences we encounter in life shape who we are.

Over the last few years, arts education in New York City schools has declined due to government produced budget cuts. What was once a requirement to enhance the development of our children is near extinction.

“Between 2006 and 2013, spending on arts supplies and equipment dropped by 84 percent,” as stated in a report released by Scott M. Stringer, NYC’s comptroller.

The report found 28 percent of schools lack a full-time certified arts teacher, 20 percent have no arts teacher at all, and 10 percent of NYC schools do not have a classroom devoted to art.

With a 47 percent decline in arts programming funding, there is an opportunity for you to step outside yourself and play an active role in the lives of our youth. Without creativity the world’s greatest innovations would cease to exist. 

My name is Tuso Z. Boothe and I will be hosting an arts education fundraiser this August 2014. The goal is to raise at least $2,000 by August 2, 2014.

Proceeds from the event will be donated to Rush Philanthropic Art Foundation. 

The future of creativity is in our hands. We stifle the voices of our youth by cutting the arts education budget in our schools. It is with pure humility I call you to action to support this movement. 

Perk

The highest three donors will receive an original piece of artwork created by me, Tuso Z. Boothe. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    You can also support our efforts by attending The Power Of Four arts education fundraiser being held early August 2014. More details to come. 

    "Without art, the crudeness of reality would make the world unbearable," George Bernard Shaw

story:
Help Us End Child Pornography and the Sexual Exploitation of Children

SUMURI was founded in 2010 to provide training, services, software and hardware relating to computer forensics and digital evidence worldwide.

My name is Steve Whalen and I am the founder and CEO of SUMURI.  I am also a retired State Trooper from the United States.  As a Trooper, I spent up to 50% of my time investigating cases related to Child Pornography and the Sexual Exploitation of Children.  During this time I saw millions of horrific images and videos of Child Pornography and children being victimized sexually.  As a law enforcement officer I was frustrated and saddened to know that our resources and finances were limited to even begin to attack a problem of this magnitude.  

Now, retired from law enforcement, I never forget that for every picture and video I viewed there was a child victimized... millions of children!

I realize and know that law enforcement alone will never be able to even scratch the surface of this epidemic.

However, we at SUMURI have a simple solution to help stop child pornography, child pornographers and child victimization:

Stop the demand for Child Pornography and you stop the 

Sexual Exploitation of a Child.


The Solution - MISSION: NO MORE VICTIMS

MISSION: NO MORE VICTIMS is actually two solutions in one.  We have developed software that will be accessible from our website that will allow anyone in the world to scan a computer for signatures of Child Pornography.  The signatures used in our software represent files that have been previously identified as known or suspected Child Pornography. 



If a file or files are found which match this signature or "digital fingerprint" the user will be given the option of generating a PDF or email report of the findings. The illicit files will not be transferred to the report; just the identifying information.


The user then has the option of submitting the report to the appropriate agency or agencies.


Additionally, to help with the discovery and investigation of the Sexual Exploitation of Children we have developed the PALADIN Forensic Suite.  


PALADIN has already helped thousands of agencies worldwide in the analysis and proper preservation of digital evidence which leads to successful prosecutions of Child Pornographers and Predators.  PALADIN is currently available on our website for free.


What We Need

We've done the hard part in developing the tools and solutions.  We now need your help in spreading the word about our software to help identify those responsible for the Sexual Exploitation of  Children.

Additionally, we need your financial support to help fund MISSION: NO MORE VICTIMS.

Your financial donation will go to paying for the cost of continued development and enhancements of this software.  Additionally, funds are needed to pay for the cost of the servers that host and make this software available to the world for free!

Our goal of $30,000 will allow us maintain and keep MISSION: NO MORE VICTIMS updated and free for all so we can help end the Sexual Exploitation of Children worldwide.


The Impact

Your financial support and use of MISSION: NO MORE VICTIMS software will help end the Sexual Exploitation and Victimization of Children worldwide by:

  • Acting as a deterrent to those involved in viewing or paying for Child Pornography
  • Identifying those who are victimizing children by viewing Child Pornography and assist in bringing them to justice
  • Reducing the Sexual Exploitation and Victimization of Children worldwide by lessening the demand for Child Pornography

Remember, even if one child is saved, MISSION: NO MORE VICTIMS will be a success.  Let's pray that we save many more and help end the Sexual Exploitation of Children worldwide.


From myself, Steve Whalen, and all of us here at SUMURI, a sincere thank you!

story:
My name is Pearla Keren.

I never thought I’d be standing in front of a virtual crowd and beg for help, no matter how rough life was. But I have no choice.

My daughter was diagnosed with Bipolar Disorder type II. Her illness increased in the past few years. She tried to live a normal life – having a job, relationships, and friends. But her mind betrayed her.

Her manic episodes started to be become more severe, and her depression episode brought her to try and take her own life 3 times in the past 2 years. She has been hospitalized and medicated for the most part of the past years. Her life stopped completely.

We don’t have much. Our family business went bankrupt, leaving us with barely enough to exist. Me and my husband both work 2 jobs and do everything we possibly can to help our daughter. But bills are high, so high we can’t keep her hospitalized and give her the care she needs.

Her friends disappeared, she can’t keep even a part-time job and her boyfriend is long gone.

I’m scared for the life of my girl. She’s almost 30years old with no future ahead. I’m scared every time I open the front door in fear I’d find her laying there lifeless.

I’m begging you. Please help me save my daughter. Please allow me to give her the proper care she needs. Please bring a ray of sunshine into our lives. Please, please, please. I’m begging, please help us to help her.

Thank you for taking the time to read this.

My gratitude and appreciation for all of your that can get us a little closer to helping her.

story:
What is The Rust Belt School?

The Rust Belt School is a Marxist institution centered around research and education located in Yellow Springs, Ohio. We provide online and real-world collaborative forums and space for workers, organizers, artists, and intellectuals. We have a growing library of books, out of print pamphlets, and other media that include rare and unique items.  Students and researchers are invited to visit our space and review and discuss these materials firsthand. With funding for a cataloguing system, we hope to circulate much of our collection as a lending library. The Rust Belt School serves as a gathering place for speaking events, reading groups, and public forums, and monthly screenings of documentaries. We are publishing a quarterly journal featuring political and economic theory as well as re-publishing collections of relevant texts with Erythros Press and Media, LLC.

Currently we prepare and post transcriptions of rare and out-of-print documents for Marxists Internet Archive (http://www.marxists.org). In the very near future, we will expand our web presence well beyond our current Facebook page by creating a dedicated website and blog. We will also post videos of lectures and other events via YouTube and share news and promote events via social media outlets.

What do we need the money for?

First and foremost, we need funds for rent. Next, we need internet and phone service, because, after all we are a brick and mortar organization. Third, to build our library we need catalog materials, shelves and cabinets to store our growing collection of media. Fourth, we need a desktop computer for cataloguing our lending library.

Can I be involved if I do not donate?

Of course! The endeavors and events listed above—our lending library, public film screenings, discussion forums, online courses—will be developed and offered on an ongoing basis made available to as many interested parties as possible. And for the next few weeks, the easiest and most helpful thing you can do is directly share our Indiegogo link via social media outlets.

story:
Short Summary

Monterey Bay Charter School is a public K-8 school educating 338 students using  a Waldorf-inspired curriculum integrated with the Common Core Standards. We have a small garden with six raised beds. The rickety fence is no longer keeping out the deer. The garden is too small to hold both third grade classes. We want to expand the garden to encompass the entire front of the school and erect a fence that will protect students (the garden is adjacent to the drop off circle) and keep out the deer.

  • A garden is a living classroom and an integral part of the curriculum for all students, especially third grade students who plant, harvest, cook, and eat the garden bounty throughout the school year.
  • The garden will intimately connect students to the cycles of life and deepen their relationship to the environment inspiring reverence and respect.
  • It will be more aesthetically pleasing for the entire community (the front is currently a mix of dead grass, weeds and dirt due to our drought).


What We Need & What You Get

Our existing garden is too small to accommodate 48 third grade students and their seventh grade buddies. We need to expand the garden to encompass the front of the school in an aesthetically pleasing environment for all students to enjoy.

  • We need $4,700 dollars to build the fence (wood/hardware/cement)  to protect the garden from neighborhood deer and keep students safe near the drop off circle. $2,000 to construct redwood garden boxes, and $1,300 for soil and mulch. 
  • The garden area will be expanded to 8,000 square feet with plenty of room for picnic tables so lots of students can enjoy eating outside (we have NO cafeteria!)
  • We are removing the lawn in front of the school to save water during this critical California drought and replacing it with an edible garden for the whole school!
  • If we don't raise all the funds, we will still strive to build the fence and seek grant funds for the garden beds and donations of soil and mulch - we will make this happen even if we don't get all the funds.

The Impact

This expanded garden will allow for multiple classes to work and learn in the garden simultaneously. It will also give us the opportunity to greatly diversify the fruits and vegetables that the students grow year-round. We are saving precious resources (water and money) while enhancing students' learning opportunities.

  • We have received grants for computers, wind and string instruments, sextants and maps as well a science and technology. These programs are all self-sustaining years after they were implemented and have inspired students to pursue new passions. We expect the garden to not only directly impact both third grade classes this year, but every class that works in the garden for years to come, as well as expand learning opportunities for other grades due to its increased size.

Risks & Challenges

 The biggest risk is not raising any money to support this project. We are already seeking donations from local businesses to kick-start this project.

  • We are used to doing more with less as public school funding is dismal in the State of California and we are seeking re-purposed wood for the fence if we don't raise all the funds.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone can contribute financially to a project like this, but even $5.00 dollars will make a difference. We would also love for you to spread the word about this garden project to your friends, family and businesses to help us raise the this much needed cash!!

  • Please take advantage of the Indiegogo tools to help spread the word

Thank you for taking an interset in changing children's lives one garden at a ttime!

Please take advantage of the Indiegogo tools to help spread the word Thank you for taking an interset in changing children's lives one garden at a ttime!

story:
IMPORTANT UPDATE:

Even though this campaign has concluded, donations can still be made by going to www.booksthroughbars.org and clicking the DONATE NOW button on the right sidebar.  Just specify "Dictionary Drive" in the Designation section on the donation page.

 

Books Through Bars

Over two decades ago, Books Through Bars was established to address the paucity of educational resources and programming made available to prisoners hoping to use the time of their imprisonment to effect positive change in their lives. By distributing free educational materials to prisoners, Books Through Bars facilitates prisoner education, thereby promoting successful community re-integration. Because successful community reintegration requires transformation within and outside of prison walls, Books Through Bars utilizes our book distribution service as the foundation on which we build innovative programs designed to engage a broad cross-section of the general public in thinking critically about issues of imprisonment.


The Dictionary Fund

The dictionary is not only the most fundamental tool for self-education and self-empowerment, but it is also the single most requested book by incarcerated folks throughout the country. 

However, people rarely donate their dictionaries and, as a result, we rarely have dictionaries to send to the people who need them most.

The Dictionary Fund is a campaign dedicated to raising funds for the purchase of much-needed dictionaries for incarcerated people.

Our goal is to raise enough money in the next 3 months to purchase 1,000 dictionaries.

$3 from you gets someone a dictionary, complete with more than 40,000 definitions - a vital tool which they'll likely use for their entire lives.

Our Mission Statement

We believe a society of social and economic inequality leads to a cycle of crime and incarceration. We work to reverse the dehumanizing effects excessive punishment inflicts upon individuals, families and communities. Books Through Bars sends quality reading material to prisoners and encourages creative dialogue on the criminal justice system, thereby educating those living inside and outside of prison walls.

 

For more information,
go to: www.booksthroughbars.org
or email us: info@booksthroughbars.org

story:
HELP GET JASE TO SOUTH AFRICA.

In January I am beginning a crazy adventure, an adventure I would love to invite you to take part in. I'm excited to share that I will be moving to Cape Town, South Africa along side a dozen or so other missionary friends of mine. Our hope is to embrace the beauty of the gospel and create a faith community in the margins of Cape Town that resonates love. The start of this adventure begins the end of October when I will accompany our community plant leader on a scouting trip to the Cape.

This initial trip is two fold.

FIRST - it serves as an opportunity to scope out the landscape, build relationships, and lay roots into a lot of the logistics for moving to South Africa long-term.

SECONDLY - we will be teaching and serving in a week long YWAM Humanities School in South Africa.

I can't make this trip alone, so I invite you to partner with me as I head to South Africa. All the proceeds of this campaign will go directly to purchasing my plane ticket to Cape Town and back!

LOVE YOU ALL!

story:
My core intention for journeying is holding and opening space for the collective healing potential to arise - as field-weaver, soul-guide and host - offering my presence, practice, skills and experience.


Part of this is to be in the presence of the Bee Nation ... with Bee Host & guide, Debra Roberts.

"I am continuing to imagine sitting with you in the Bee Yard very soon Debra, witnessing this most gracious, industrious poetry in motion :-) Holding space and intention that this may be so. xx" ... This, as well as tending and strengthening our Simorghian wings, in service of the Soul-centered Journey of Life


I trust that if the soul of these different places and work-fields, and the Soul of the World wishes me be present, in place, I will attract the funds I need.

And, time is short, as travel to Orlando is 15th August! ... hence this being a 7-day 'pop-up' crowd-funding campaign :-)

Two ways to participate and contribute:

If you're called to directly support my being present and co-hosting this Collective Healing gathering - and be part of the other work too - then please CLICK on one of the Perks and contribute here. Collective Healing WEBSITE.

If you're called to explore my new work offerings too: including 1 on 1 Soul guiding Sessions, Flow Games, Flow Retreats, Books, World Work, etc (which will financially contribute another way) - then visit my NEW website: Waves of Conscious Evolution.


So please CLICK on the Crowd-funding Perk that best works for you, and GO TO my new Waves website, and see how you want to dive into your own soul journey now.

Finally, please share with your Friends and colleagues ~ Campaign finishes 5th August! Many thanks!

Best wishes,

Sarah

story:
Short Summary

The very destructive earthquake that hit Nepal in April 2015 has caused a large human casualties. Survivors are left homeless. Many geographically difficult locations devastated by the quake  are still isolated. Sindhupalchowk district was hit most. Local reporters from very hard-hit places have reported that the situation is very bad and getting worse. In Nepal, rainy season starts from mid-June. We have to have all the affected people helped by that time (at least with their basic needs like a place to stay and something to eat). Otherwise the situation will become worse.  I have started this campaign to help at least one  of the devastated villages to help villagers to set up their temporary home before it starts monsoon. People in Nepal are very hard-working.  The fund that will be raised by this campaign will be used to provide materials (simple materials) for the villagers to set up their temporary home. 

Thank you so much for your love to Nepal and Nepalese people. 

For more information, please contact:

Niranjan Aryal

Email: naryal101@gmail.com

Phone number : +13072236239

story:
Version française >>>                                 Versión en español >>>

Why a crowdfunding campaign?

The QuakeShare network is a new warning system for earthquakes. This system is intended to operate worldwide and alert people through their smartphones from the first seconds of the earthquake, that is to say before the telecommunications networks are disrupted or damaged.

Today only the most developed areas (California, Japan) have targeted warning systems. With new digital technologies (networks and phones) available anywhere in the world, we want to make this solution available to the greatest number. Lives can be saved!

          

The QuakeShare App, installed on smartphones, will trigger an alert when an earthquake hits, understandable regardless of the language of the user. It will provide him his location in relation to the event.

Smartphones close to the epicenter serve as sentinels for the network. Others, more distant, will be alerted before the arrival of the earthquake. They will save precious seconds to get to safety and reduce risk.

The QuakeShare network will alert emergency teams from the first seconds of the earthquake. It will provide them with real-time mapping of the victims. Emergency teams will save valuable time to react in a situation where previously they would have had no information.

QuakeShare App users can reassure their loved ones and know their status. They can contribute effectively to aid by informing on damage, on victims and on the evolution of the situation on the ground.

Before the earthquake, they can prepare themselves in a fun and realistic way.


                                          

We wish to fund the development of the QuakeShare Network through crowdfunding.

By building it together, we preserve our independence and we guarantee its global availability.

We conducted preliminary studies in geophysics, level and sensitivity of sensors embedded in smartphones. We need to finalize the research on smartphones and build and optimize all the technical elements of the solution. Your donations will help to accomplish the core elements essential to the operation of the network.

The QuakeShare Application will be
downloadable from GooglePlay

                                                        

To Whom is QuakeShare for?

QuakeShare is intended, first, to people living, working or traveling in a seismic zone, for work or personal travel, leisure and tourism; and, secondly, to people wanting to support the most exposed populations to earthquakes.


                                   

What is the role of the donor?

The donor is the founder of the alert network. The solidarity he demonstrates by sponsoring the first areas of deployment of the network, is a tremendous help for the more vulnerable in front of earthquakes.

He has the privilege of living the adventure of creating the network, following from the inside the progress and achievements:

• He can discover the Application before everyone as a beta-tester

• His comments will be considered in a special way, and he can help us make a more efficient and user-friendly solution.

• He will be regularly informed of the evolution of the network; he will be able to contribute to strengthen its development.

• He can interact with all the other members of the network, to share his experiences of the earthquake and learn best practices.

Starting with the campaign of crowdfunding, he will be invited to play an active role as an ambassador of the network to make it known.

The donor is the QuakeShare's partner. He provides financial and moral support, guarantee of our success. It will therefore actually save lives.

               

Who develops QuakeShare?

QuakeShare is developed by CynSIS SAS, based in France.

                                 

CynSIS designs reliable and innovative devices to structure and share critical data in the event of environmental catastrophes.

These devices allow:

• to save lives by providing real-time critical information on geolocation and status of victims or witnesses.

• to mobilize faster and better act collectively in real time for all actors involved in crisis management

• and before that to prepare well

We are supported by the French Public Investment Bank, the European Space Agency (ESA), INRIA, PACA-Est Incubator, the Urban Community of Sophia Antipolis (06), EURECOM, the BA06 Event, and other private partners.

Pierre-Marie Sarant is the founder Chairman of the company. He worked for more than 30 years in more than 50 countries during humanitarian crises and natural disasters, including 14 earthquakes. His experience led him to two conclusions: firstly, the lack of scientific knowledge and sharing of critical information; secondly, the under-utilization of digital technologies.

That is why he has favored the new technologies and is surrounded by a multidisciplinary team of experts: geophysics, telecommunications and networks, new technologies, geographical information system, geography, risk education, emergency medicine, occupational health...

Why is the QuakeShare Network necessary?

We designed QuakeShare, the global solidarity-based earthquake alert network taking into account lessons learned in individual and collective behavior, either during seismic events, during crisis management or on longer-term in affected areas.

Feedbacks have also been gathered from other alert systems, their use and population needs.

The QuakeShare network aims to cover the gaps and to meet the needs identified.

• Earthquakes prevention still has limitations. Nobody knows where exactly the next major earthquake will strike. But we know that each year there are more than 150 potentially destructive earthquakes.

• Early warning systems are insufficient. Their equipments are very expensive. The alert struggles to reach all people concerned. Seismic zones fully supervised are rare.

• The seismic risk is complex and the level of preparedness of the population is still very low. Affected populations have rarely benefited from the lessons learned in previous earthquakes.

• The mobilization of emergency teams is still too slow given the difficulties in reaching the victims.

• Today 530 million people live in known earthquake zones.

   

More information about QuakeShare

The new possibilities offered by digital technologies, the increasing coverage of the majority of seismic zones by mobile telecommunication networks, the accelerated acceptance of smartphones globally offers unique opportunities to reduce the impact of earthquakes.

In 2013, 1 billion smartphones were sold worldwide, causing a rapid increase in penetration rate. 

Android market share is 78.6% or 794 million smartphones sold. (Source: IDC)

What are the funding needs to activate the QuakeShare Network?

With your donations we will gradually develop the QuakeShare App version 1 can be delivered in January 2015.  The more donations we receive, the more quickly the versions will enrich.

How and when will be distributed the rewards

The QuakeShare App will be available before end January 2015, and donors will be individually informed. They will receive the installation and activation approach for their Apps, based on the number associated with their contribution.

For the distribution of the applications in seismic areas, Cynsis will be supported by recognized organizations working with forgotten people to prepare for major natural risks and who have the means to conduct simulation exercises and training of the population. It will be a support to a program previously organized.

The thanks-you on the App QuakeShare will appear from the publication of the first version.

The thanks-you Thanks on Facebook and the logos of donor organizations will be published on Cynsis website from the formalization of the donation.

The training days will be scheduled after the campaign. 

How to follow project development updates

CynSIS is very happy to launch QuakeShare App with your help!

We will keep you regularly informed of the project advances. If you want more information or have any questions do not hesitate to contact us at contact@cynsis.com or post a message on our Facebook page!

Learn more about us: www.cynsis.com or www.quakeshare.com

Follow us on Twitter, on Facebook and on LinkedIn.

Help us to make our crowdfunding campaign known! 

We ask you to be our ambassadors to your friends, loved ones, colleagues, actors of the seismic risk and share the campaign with them!

The bigger the number of participants in the campaign, the greater will be the developments that we will achieve for the Quakeshare network!


Contribute now >>>

                        English Version >>>                Versión en español >>>


QuakeShare,
le réseau d'alerte aux séismes, mondial et solidaire


Pourquoi une campagne de crowdfunding (financement participatif) ?

Le réseau QuakeShare est un nouveau système d’alerte pour les séismes. Ce système a vocation à fonctionner partout dans le monde et à alerter les populations à travers leurs smartphones, dès les premières secondes du séisme, c’est-à-dire avant que les réseaux de télécommunications ne soient perturbés ou endommagés.

Aujourd’hui seules les zones les plus développées (Californie, Japon) disposent de systèmes ciblés d'alerte. Grâce aux nouvelles technologies numériques (réseaux et téléphones) disponibles partout dans le monde, nous voulons mettre cette solution à disposition du plus grand nombre. Des vies peuvent être épargnées !                                                 

                 

L'App QuakeShare, installée sur les smartphones, permettra de déclencher une alerte face aux séismes, compréhensible quelle que soit la langue de l'utilisateur. Elle lui permettra de se localiser par rapport à l’évènement.              

Les smartphones les plus proches de l'épicentre serviront de sentinelles pour le réseau. Les autres, plus éloignés, seront alertés avant même l'arrivée du séisme. Ils permettront de gagner de précieuses secondes pour se mettre en sécurité et réduire leur risques.                    

Le réseau QuakeShare alertera les secours dès les premières secondes du séisme. Il leur fournira une cartographie en temps réel des sinistrés. Les secours gagneront un temps précieux pour porter assistance dans une situation où antérieurement ils n'auraient disposé d'aucune information.   

Les utilisateurs de l'App QuakeShare pourront rassurer leurs proches et connaître leur situation. Ils pourront contribuer efficacement aux secours en informant sur les dégâts, sur les victimes et sur l'évolution de la situation sur le terrain.

Avant le séisme, ils pourront se préparer de manière ludique et réaliste.               

                                                                                

Nous souhaitons financer le développement du réseau QuakeShare grâce au crowdfunding.

En le bâtissant ensemble nous préservons notre indépendance et nous garantissons son fonctionnement mondial.

Nous avons réalisé les études préliminaires au niveau géophysique et sur la sensibilité des capteurs embarqués dans les smartphones. Nous devons finaliser les recherches sur les smartphones et construire, puis optimiser l’ensemble des éléments techniques de la solution. Vos dons permettront ainsi de réaliser les éléments centraux, indispensables au fonctionnement du réseau.

L’application QuakeShare sera
téléchargeable sur GooglePlay

A qui s'adresse QuakeShare ?

QuakeShare s'adresse, d'une part, à toute personne vivant, travaillant ou se déplaçant en zone sismique, dans le cadre professionnel ou personnel, pour les loisirs ou le tourisme ; et, d'autre part, à toute personne voulant aider les populations les plus exposées face aux séismes.

                                   

Quel est le rôle du donateur ?

Le donateur est fondateur du réseau d’alerte. La solidarité qu'il témoigne en sponsorisant les premières zones de déploiement du réseau est une aide extraordinaire pour les plus démunis face aux séismes.

Il a le privilège de vivre l'aventure de la création du réseau, de suivre de l'intérieur les avancées et les réussites :

  • Il pourra découvrir l'Application avant tout le monde, en tant que beta-testeur
  • Ses commentaires seront pris en compte de manière privilégiée, et nous aidera à rendre la solution plus efficace et plus conviviale.
  • Il sera informé régulièrement de l'évolution du réseau, pourra contribuer à renforcer son développement.
  • Il pourra échanger avec tous les autres membres du réseau : partager son expérience du tremblement de terre ou apprendre les bonnes pratiques.

Dès l'opération de crowdfunding, il est invité à jouer un rôle actif d'ambassadeur du réseau en le faisant connaître.

Le donateur est le partenaire de QuakeShare. Il fournit un support financier et moral, gage de notre réussite. Il aidera donc concrètement à sauver des vies. 

                       

Qui développe QuakeShare ?

QuakeShare est développé par la société CynSIS, basée en France.    

                              

CynSIS conçoit des dispositifs fiables et innovants pour structurer et partager des données vitales en cas de catastrophe environnementale.

Ces dispositifs permettent : 

  • De sauver des vies en fournissant en temps réel des informations cruciales sur la géolocalisation et l'état des personnes victimes ou témoins.
  • À l'ensemble des acteurs impliqués dans la gestion d'une crise, de se mobiliser plus rapidement et de mieux agir collectivement en temps réel.
  • Et avant cela de bien se préparer.

Nous sommes soutenus par la Banque Publique française d’Investissement, l’Agence Spatiale Européenne (ESA), l'INRIA, l’Incubateur PACA-Est, la Communauté d’Agglomération de Sophia Antipolis (06), EURECOM, le BA06 Event, et d'autres partenaires privés.

Pierre-Marie Sarant est le Président fondateur de la société. Il est intervenu depuis plus de 30 ans dans plus de 50 pays à l'occasion de crises humanitaires et de catastrophes naturelles, dont 14 séismes. Son expérience l'a amené à un double constat : d'une part, le manque de partage de connaissances scientifiques et d'informations critiques ; d'autre part la sous-utilisation des technologies numériques.

C'est pourquoi il a privilégié les nouvelles technologies et s'est entouré d'une équipe d'experts pluridisciplinaire : géophysique, télécommunications et réseaux, nouvelles technologies, système d'informations géographiques, géographie, éducation aux risques, médecine d'urgence, santé au travail...

Pourquoi le Réseau QuakeShare est nécessaire ?

Nous avons conçu le Réseau QuakeShare d'alerte sismique mondial et solidaire en tenant compte des retours d’expérience sur les comportements individuels et collectifs, que ce soit pendant les secousses sismiques, dans la gestion de la crise ou à plus long terme dans les zones concernées.

Des leçons ont été tirées des autres systèmes d’alerte, de leur usage et des besoins des populations.

Le réseau QuakeShare a pour objectif de couvrir ces manques et répondre aux besoins identifiés.

  • La prévention des séismes a encore des limites. Personne ne peut savoir où se produira précisément le prochain séisme majeur. Mais on sait que chaque année il y a plus de 150 séismes potentiellement destructeurs.
  • Les systèmes d’alerte sont insuffisants. Leurs équipements sont très onéreux. L'alerte peine à atteindre toutes les personnes concernées. Les zones sismiques totalement surveillées sont rares.
  • Le risque sismique est complexe et le niveau de préparation des populations est encore très faible. Les populations sinistrées ont rarement bénéficié des enseignements tirés de séismes précédents.
  • La mobilisation des secours est encore trop lente face aux difficultés à atteindre les victimes.

  • Aujourd’hui 530 millions de personnes vivent dans des zones sismiques connues.

          

Plus d'information à propos de QuakeShare

Les nouvelles possibilités offertes par les technologies numériques, la couverture de plus en plus forte par les réseaux de télécommunications mobiles de la majorité des zones sismiques, l'acceptation accélérée des smartphones par la population mondiale offrent des possibilités uniques pour réduire l'impact des séismes.

En 2013, 1 milliard de smartphones ont été vendus dans le monde, amenant une progression rapide des taux de pénétration. La part de marché d'Android est de 78,6% soit 794 Millions de smartphones vendus.(source IDC)

Quels sont les besoins de financement pour activer le réseau QuakeShare ?

Avec vos dons nous réaliserons progressivement l'App QuakeShare. La version 1 pourra être livrée en janvier 2015. Plus nous recevrons de dons, et plus les versions s'enrichiront vite :    

Quelles sont les contreparties pour les donateurs ?

10$ – BASIQUE

Chaque donateur recevra pour lui-même 1 App QuakeShare avec l’abonnement à vie au service d’alerte, avant fin janvier 2015
+ Remerciement sur Facebook
+ Mention sur une page spéciale du site internet de QuakeShare

30$ –  TRIPLE

BASIQUE
+ 2 App QuakeShare pour les proches du donateur ou sinon à distribuer dans une zone sismique au choix de l'équipe QuakeShare

50$ –  FAMILLE

BASIQUE
+ 4 App QuakeShare pour les proches du donateur ou sinon à distribuer dans une zone sismique au choix de l'équipe QuakeShare

100$ –  EQUIPE

BASIQUE
+ 9 App QuakeShare pour les proches du donateur ou sinon à distribuer dans une zone sismique au choix de l'équipe QuakeShare

200$ –  GROUPE

BASIQUE
+ 20 App QuakeShare
+ Le donateur a la possibilité de choisir la zone sismique de sa donation, un pays, une région à l'intérieur d'un pays ou un groupe de personnes dans un même pays

500$ –  PETITE COMMUNAUTE

BASIQUE
+ 50 App QuakeShare
+ Le donateur a la possibilité de choisir la zone sismique de sa donation, un pays, une région à l'intérieur d'un pays ou un groupe de personnes dans un même pays

1 000$ – GRANDE COMMUNAUTE

BASIQUE
+ 100 App QuakeShare
+ Le donateur a la possibilité de choisir la zone sismique de sa donation, un pays, une région à l'intérieur d'un pays ou un groupe de personnes dans un même pays
+ Le donateur pourra participer à une web-conférence avec le fondateur du Programme
+ Le nom du donateur figurera dans les Remerciements sur l’App dans la rubrique Bronze.

2 000$ –  PETIT VILLAGE

BASIQUE
+ 200 App QuakeShare
+ Le nom du donateur figurera dans les Remerciements sur l’App dans la rubrique Silver
+ Une journée de formation à la préparation au séisme pour une personne sur le site de la société (coût du voyage, hébergement et de repas non inclus).

5 000$ –  VILLAGE

BASIQUE
+ 500 App QuakeShare
+ Le nom du donateur figurera dans les Remerciements sur l’App dans la rubrique Gold
+ Une journée de formation à la préparation au séisme pour 2 personnes sur le site de la société (coût du voyage, hébergement et de repas non inclus)
+ Pour les compagnies ou organisations, leur logo dans la catégorie sponsors du web pendant 1 an.

10 000$ –  PETITE VILLE

BASIQUE
+ 1 000 App QuakeShare
+ Le nom du donateur figurera dans les Remerciements sur l’App dans la rubrique Platine
+ Une journée de formation à la préparation au séisme pour 4 personnes sur le site de la société (coût du voyage, hébergement et de repas non inclus)
+ Pour les compagnies ou organisations, leur logo dans la catégorie sponsors du web pendant 2 ans
+ Le donateur a la possibilité de choisir la zone sismique de sa donation, le pays, la région à l'intérieur d'un pays, une petite ville ou plusieurs villages ou communautés dans un même pays et la traduction dans la langue locale de l'Application QuakeShare.

20 000$ –  VILLE AVEC LANGUE LOCALE

BASIQUE
+ 2 000 App QuakeShare
+ Le nom du donateur figurera dans les Remerciements sur l’App dans la rubrique Platine
+ Une journée de formation à la préparation au séisme pour 8 personnes sur le site de la société (coût du voyage, hébergement et de repas non inclus)
+ Pour les compagnies ou organisations, leur logo apparaitra dans la catégorie sponsors du web pendant 2 ans
+ Le donateur a la possibilité de choisir la zone sismique de sa donation, le pays, la région à l'intérieur d'un pays, une ville ou plusieurs villages ou communautés dans un même pays et la traduction dans la langue locale de l'Application QuakeShare.

Pour donner, choisissez votre contrepartie en haut à droite de cette page.

Quand et comment les contreparties seront distribuées

L’App Quakeshare sera prête avant fin Janvier 2015 et les donateurs seront individuellement avertis. Ils seront informés de la procédure d’installation et d’activation des App en fonction du nombre  prévu pour leur don.

Pour la distribution des applications dans les zones sismiques, Cynsis s'appuiera sur des organisations reconnues qui oeuvrent auprès de populations oubliés pour la préparation aux risques naturels majeurs et qui ont les moyens d'organiser des exercices de simulation et de formation des populations. Il s'agira d'un appui à un programme préalablement prévu.

Les remerciements sur l’App QuakeShare figureront dès la publication de la première version. 

Les remerciements sur Facebook et le logo des organisations donatrices seront publiés sur le site web de Cynsis dès la formalisation du don. 

Les journées de formation seront programmées après la campagne. 

Comment suivre les mises à jour du développement du projet

CynSIS est très heureux de lancer avec votre aide le réseau QuakeShare d'alerte sismique, mondial et solidaire!

Nous vous informerons régulièrement des avancements du projet par newsletter. Si vous voulez plus d’informations ou vous avez des questions n'hésitez pas à nous contacter à contact@cynsis.com ou poster un message sur notre page Facebook!

En savoir plus sur  www.cynsis.com et www.quakeshare.com.

Suivez-nous sur Twitter, sur Facebook et sur LinkedIn.

Nous vous demandons d’être nos ambassadeurs auprès de vos amis, de vos proches, de vos collègues, des acteurs du risque sismique et de partager la campagne avec eux !

Plus le nombre de participants dans la campagne sera grand, plus nombreux seront les développements que nous pourrons réaliser sur le réseau Quakeshare !

QuakeShare,

la red solidaria y global de alerta de terremotos 




¿Porque una campaña de crowdfunding?

La red QuakeShare es un nuevo sistema de alerta de terremotos. Este sistema está diseñado para operar en todo el mundo y alertar a la población a través de sus teléfonos móviles, desde los primeros segundos del terremoto, es decir, antes de que las redes de telecomunicaciones se rompan o se dañan.

Hoy en día sólo las zonas más desarrolladas (California, Japón) disponen de sistemas de alerta específicos. Gracias a las nuevas tecnologías digitales (redes y móviles) disponibles en cualquier lugar del mundo, queremos poner esta solución disponible para el mayor número de personas. Se pueden salvar vidas!                    

La App QuakeShare instalado en los teléfonos móviles, permitirá dispar una alerta de terremoto, comprensible, independientemente del idioma del usuario. Esta app le permitirá localizar su posición en relación al terremoto.

Los smartphones más cercanos al epicentro servirán como centinelas para la red. Los otros, más lejanos, será alertados incluso antes de la llegada del terremoto. Permitirán ganar unos segundos preciosos para ponerse a salvo y reducir su riesgo.

La red QuakeShare alertará a los equipos de emergencias desde los primeros segundos del terremoto. Les proporcionará mapas en tiempo real de las víctimas. Los equipos de emergencia ganarán un valioso tiempo para ayudar en una situación en la que anteriormente no hubieran tenido ninguna información.

Los usuarios de la aplicación QuakeShare podrán tranquilizar a sus seres queridos y conocer su estado. Podrán también contribuir eficazmente a ayudar a los equipos de emergencia informando  de los daños, las víctimas y la evolución de la situación sobre el terreno.

Antes del terremoto, se podrán preparar de forma lúdica y realista.

                                      

                                               

Nos gustaría financiar el desarrollo de la red QuakeShare a través de crowdfunding.

Construyéndola juntos preservamos nuestra independencia y garantizamos su funcionamiento global.

Hemos llevado a cabo estudios preliminares a nivel geofísico y sobre la sensibilidad de los sensores incorporados en los smartphones. Tenemos que concluir la investigación sobre los smartphones y optimizar el conjunto de los elementos técnicos de la solución.

Vuestras donaciones permitirán finalizar los elementos centrales, indispensables para el funcionamiento de la red.

La Aplicación QuakeShare se podrá descargar en GooglePlay

                                                   

¿A quien se dirige QuakeShare?

QuakeShare se dirige, por un lado, a cualquier persona que vive, trabaja o desplaza a una zona sísmica, por motivos de trabajo o personal, por ocio o turismo; y, por otro lado, a cualquier persona que quiera ayudar a hacer frente a los terremotos a las poblaciones más vulnerables y expuestas.

                                   

¿Cuál es el papel del donante?

El donante es el fundador de una red de alerta. La solidaridad que demuestra patrocinando las primeras zonas de despliegue de la red es una gran ayuda para los más vulnerables frente a los terremotos.

Tiene el privilegio de vivir la aventura de la creación de la red,  de seguir desde dentro los progresos y logros:

  • Podrá descubrir la App antes que todo,s como beta-tester
  • Sus comentarios serán tomados en cuenta de forma privilegiada, y nos ayudará a hacer la solución más eficiente y fácil de usar.
  • Será informado periódicamente de la evolución de la red, podrá contribuir a fortalecer su desarrollo.
  • Podrá interactuar con todos los otros miembros de la red, compartir sus experiencias del terremoto y aprender las mejores prácticas.

Tras la operación de crowdfunding, será invitado a jugar un papel activo como embajador de la red haciéndola conocer.

El donante es ‘miembro’ de QuakeShare. Proporciona apoyo financiero y moral, garantía de nuestro éxito. Ayudará, por tanto, en realidad salvar vidas.

¿Quien desarrolla QuakeShare?

QuakeShare es desarrollado por la empresa CynSIS, con sede en Francia. 

                                     

CynSIS diseña dispositivos fiables e innovadores para estructurar y compartir datos vitales en caso de una catástrofe medioambiental.

Estos dispositivos permiten:

• Salvar vidas proporcionando en tiempo real información crucial sobre la geolocalización y el estado de las víctimas o los testigos.

• Para todos los actores involucrados en la gestión de una crisis, movilizarse más rápido y actuar mejor colectivamente en tiempo real

• Y antes, prepararse bien.

Nos apoyan el Banco de Inversión Pública francés, la Agencia Espacial Europea (ESA), INRIA, la Incubadora PACA-Est, la Comunidad de Sophia Antipolis (06), EURECOM, el BA06 Event, y otros socios privados.

Pierre-Marie Sarant es el presidente fundador de la empresa. Intervino durante más de 30 años en más de 50 países durante crisis humanitarias y desastres naturales, incluidos 14 terremotos. Su experiencia lo llevó a dos conclusiones: en primer lugar, la falta de intercambio de conocimiento científico y de información crítica; Por otra parte, la subutilización de las tecnologías digitales.

Por eso ha privilegiado las nuevas tecnologías y se ha rodeado por un equipo multidisciplinario de expertos: geofísica, telecomunicaciones y redes, nuevas tecnologías, sistemas de información geográfica, geografía, educación sobre riesgos, medicina de emergencia, salud laboral...

¿Porque es necesaria la red QuakeShare?

Hemos diseñado la red QuakeShare de alerta sísmica global y solidaria teniendo en cuenta la información recibida sobre comportamiento individual y colectivo, ya sea durante los terremotos, en situaciones de crisis y, a más largo plazo, en las áreas afectadas.

Se han aprendido lecciones de otros sistemas de alerta, su uso y de las necesidades de la población.

La red QuakeShare tiene como objetivo cubrir estas carencias  y responder a las necesidades identificadas.

·  La prevención de los terremotos aún tiene limitaciones. Nadie  puede saber dónde se producirá exactamente el próximo gran terremoto. Pero sabemos que cada año hay más de 150 terremotos potencialmente destructivos.

·  Sistemas de alerta son insuficientes. Su equipo es muy caro. La alerta lucha para llegar a todos los afectados. Las zonas sísmicas están totalmente supervisadas ​​son raras.

·  El riesgo sísmico es complejo y el nivel de preparación de la población es aún muy baja. Las poblaciones afectadas rara vez se han beneficiado de las lecciones aprendidas de los terremotos anteriores.

·  La movilización de los equipos de emergencia sigue siendo demasiado lento frente a las dificultades para llegar a las víctimas.

·  En la actualidad 530 millones de personas viven en zonas sismicas conocidos.     

Más información acerca de QuakeShare

Las nuevas posibilidades que ofrecen las tecnologías digitales, la cobertura cada vez más fuerte por las redes de telecomunicaciones de la mayoría de zonas sísmicas, la rápida aceptación de los smartphones por la población mundial, ofrecen oportunidades únicas para reducir el impacto de los terremotos.

En 2013, se vendieron en todo el mundo 1000 millones de smartphones, causando un rápido aumento de la tasa de penetración. La tasa de mercado de Android es del 78,6% o 794 millones de smartphones vendidos (Fuente: IDC).

¿Cuáles son las necesidades de financiación para activar la red QuakeShare ?

Con vuestras donaciones desarrollaremos de forma progresiva la App QuakeShare. La versión 1 se podrá entregar en enero de 2015. Cuantas más donaciones recibamos más rápido las versiones serán más completas.

¿Cuales son las recompensas para los donantes?

10$ – BASICA

Cada donante recibirá para sí mismo la app QuakeShare con suscripción de por vida al servicio de alerta,  antes de finales de enero 2015
+ Agradecimiento en facebook
+ Mención en una página especial de la web QuakeShare

30$ –  TRIPLE


BASICA
+ 2 apps QuakeShare para los familiares del donante o a distribuir en una zona sísmica a elección  del equipo QuakeShare

BASICA
+ 4 apps QuakeShare para los familiares del donante o a distribuir en una zona sísmica a elección del equipo QuakeShare

BASICA
+ 9 apps QuakeShare para los familiares del donante o a distribuir en una zona sísmica a elección del equipo QuakeShare

200$ –  GRUPO

BASICA

+ El donante puede seleccionar la zona sísmica de su donación, un país, una región dentro de un país o un grupo de personas en un mismo país

500$ –  PEQUEÑA COMUNIDAD

BASICA

+ el donante puede seleccionar la zona sísmica de su donación, un país, una región dentro de un país o un grupo de personas en un mismo país

1.000$ –  GRAN COMUNIDAD

BASICA
+ 100 apps QuakeShare
+ El donante puede seleccionar la zona sísmica de su donación, un país, una región dentro de un país o un grupo de personas en un mismo país
+ El donante podrá participar en una conferencia web con el fundador del proyecto
+ El nombre del donante aparecerá en los agradecimientos en la App en la categoría bronce

2.000$ –  PEQUEÑO PUEBLO

BASICA

+ El nombre del donante aparecerá en los agradecimientos en la App en la categoría plata
+ Un día de formación en preparación para terremotos para una persona en la sede de la empresa (gastos de viaje, alojamiento y comidas no incluidos)

5.000$ –  PUEBLO

BASICA

+ El nombre del donante aparecerá en los agradecimientos en la App en la categoría oro

+ Para las empresas u organizaciones, su logotipo en la categoría de patrocinadores de nuestra web durante 1 año.

+ El nombre del donante aparecerá en los agradecimientos en la App en la categoría platino
+ Un día de formación en preparación para erremotos para 4 personas en la sede de la empresa (gastos de viaje, alojamiento y comidas no incluidos)
+ Para las empresas u organizaciones, su logotipo en la categoría de patrocinadores de nuestra web durante 2 años
+ El donante puede elegir la zona sísmica de su donación, país, región dentro de un país, ciudad o varios pequeños pueblos o comunidades dentro de un mismo país y la traducción de la App QuakeShare a la lengua local 

20.000$ –  CIUDAD CON LENGUA LOCAL

BASICA

+ El nombre del donante aparecerá en los agradecimientos en la App en la categoría platino
+ Un día de formación en preparación para terremotos para 8 personas en la sede de la empresa (gastos de viaje, alojamiento y comidas no incluidos)
+ Para las empresas u organizaciones, su logotipo en la categoría de patrocinadores de nuestra web durante 2 años
+ El donante puede elegir la zona sísmica de su donación, país, región dentro de un país, ciudad o varios pequeños pueblos o comunidades dentro de un mismo país y la traducción de la App QuakeShare a la lengua local

¿Cómo y cuándo se distribuirán las recompensas?

Para la distribución de las aplicaciones en zonas sísmicas, Cynsis se apoyará en organizaciones reconocidas, que trabajan con poblaciones olvidadas para la preparación sobre riesgos naturales y que tienen los medios para organizar ejercicios de simulación y formación para la población. Será un apoyo a un programa previamente previsto.
