Why a crowdfunding campaign?
The QuakeShare
network is a new warning system for earthquakes. This system is intended to
operate worldwide and alert people through their smartphones from the first
seconds of the earthquake, that is to say before the telecommunications
networks are disrupted or damaged.
Today only the
most developed areas (California, Japan) have targeted warning systems. With
new digital technologies (networks and phones) available anywhere in the world,
we want to make this solution available to the greatest number. Lives can be
saved!          The QuakeShare
App, installed on smartphones, will trigger an alert when an earthquake hits,
understandable regardless of the language of the user. It will provide him his
location in relation to the event. 
Smartphones
close to the epicenter serve as sentinels for the network. Others, more
distant, will be alerted before the arrival of the earthquake. They will save
precious seconds to get to safety and reduce risk.
The QuakeShare network will alert emergency
teams from the first seconds of the earthquake. It will provide them with
real-time mapping of the victims. Emergency teams will save valuable time to
react in a situation where previously they would have had no information. 
QuakeShare App
users can reassure their loved ones and know their status. They can contribute
effectively to aid by informing on damage, on victims and on the evolution of
the situation on the ground. 
Before the
earthquake, they can prepare themselves in a fun and realistic way.                                          We wish to fund
the development of the QuakeShare Network through crowdfunding.
By building it
together, we preserve our independence and we guarantee its global
availability. 
We conducted
preliminary studies in geophysics, level and sensitivity of sensors embedded in
smartphones. We need to finalize the research on smartphones and build and
optimize all the technical elements of the solution. Your donations will help
to accomplish the core elements essential to the operation of the network.
The QuakeShare Application will be downloadable from GooglePlay
                                                        
To Whom is QuakeShare for?QuakeShare is
intended, first, to people living, working or traveling in a seismic zone, for
work or personal travel, leisure and tourism; and, secondly, to people wanting
to support the most exposed populations to earthquakes.                                   
What is the role of the donor?The donor is the
founder of the alert network. The solidarity he demonstrates by sponsoring the
first areas of deployment of the network, is a tremendous help for the more
vulnerable in front of earthquakes.
He has the
privilege of living the adventure of creating the network, following from the
inside the progress and achievements:
• He can
discover the Application before everyone as a beta-tester
• His comments
will be considered in a special way, and he can help us make a more efficient
and user-friendly solution.
• He will be
regularly informed of the evolution of the network; he will be able to
contribute to strengthen its development.
• He can
interact with all the other members of the network, to share his experiences of
the earthquake and learn best practices.
Starting with
the campaign of crowdfunding, he will be invited to play an active role as an
ambassador of the network to make it known.
The donor is the
QuakeShare's partner. He provides financial and moral support, guarantee of our
success. It will therefore actually save lives.               
Who develops QuakeShare?QuakeShare
is developed by CynSIS SAS, based in France.                                  CynSIS
designs reliable and innovative devices to structure and share critical data in
the event of environmental catastrophes.
These
devices allow:
• to
save lives by providing real-time critical information on geolocation and
status of victims or witnesses.
• to
mobilize faster and better act collectively in real time for all actors
involved in crisis management
•
and before that to prepare well
We
are supported by the French Public Investment Bank, the European Space Agency
(ESA), INRIA, PACA-Est Incubator, the Urban Community of Sophia Antipolis (06),
EURECOM, the BA06 Event, and other private partners.
Pierre-Marie
Sarant is the founder Chairman of the company. He worked for more than 30 years
in more than 50 countries during humanitarian crises and natural disasters,
including 14 earthquakes. His experience led him to two conclusions: firstly,
the lack of scientific knowledge and sharing of critical information; secondly,
the under-utilization of digital technologies.
That
is why he has favored the new technologies and is surrounded by a
multidisciplinary team of experts: geophysics, telecommunications and networks,
new technologies, geographical information system, geography, risk education,
emergency medicine, occupational health...
Why is the QuakeShare Network necessary?We designed QuakeShare, the global
solidarity-based earthquake alert network taking into account lessons learned
in individual and collective behavior, either during seismic events, during
crisis management or on longer-term in affected areas. 
Feedbacks have also been gathered from other
alert systems, their use and population needs. 
The QuakeShare network aims to cover the
gaps and to meet the needs identified.

• Earthquakes prevention still has limitations.
Nobody knows where exactly the next major earthquake will strike. But we know
that each year there are more than 150 potentially destructive earthquakes. 
• Early warning systems are
insufficient. Their
equipments are very expensive. The alert struggles to reach all people
concerned. Seismic zones fully supervised are rare.
• The seismic risk is complex and the
level of preparedness of the population is still very low. Affected populations have rarely
benefited from the lessons learned in previous earthquakes.
• The mobilization of emergency teams is
still too slow given the difficulties in reaching the victims.

• Today 530 million people live in
known earthquake zones.   

More information about QuakeShare
The new possibilities offered by digital
technologies, the increasing coverage of the majority of seismic zones by
mobile telecommunication networks, the accelerated acceptance of smartphones
globally offers unique opportunities to reduce the impact of earthquakes. 
In 2013, 1 billion smartphones were sold
worldwide, causing a rapid increase in penetration rate.  
Android market share is 78.6% or 794 million
smartphones sold. (Source: IDC)
What are the funding needs to activate the QuakeShare Network?With your donations we will gradually develop the QuakeShare App version 1 can be delivered in January 2015.  The more donations we receive, the more quickly the versions will enrich.

How and when will be distributed the rewardsThe QuakeShare App will be available before end January 2015, and donors will be individually informed. They will receive the installation and activation approach for their Apps, based on the number associated with their contribution.For the distribution of the
applications in seismic areas, Cynsis will be supported by recognized
organizations working with forgotten people to prepare for major natural risks
and who have the means to conduct simulation exercises and training of the
population. It will be a support to a program previously organized.The thanks-you on the App
QuakeShare will appear from the publication of the first version.The thanks-you Thanks on
Facebook and the logos of donor organizations will be published on Cynsis
website from the formalization of the donation.
The training days will be
scheduled after the campaign. 
How to follow project development updatesCynSIS
is very happy to launch QuakeShare App with your help! We
will keep you regularly informed of the project advances. If you want more
information or have any questions do not hesitate to contact us at
contact@cynsis.com or post a message on our Facebook page!Learn more about us: www.cynsis.com or www.quakeshare.com
Follow us on Twitter, on Facebook and on LinkedIn.
Help us to make our crowdfunding campaign known! We ask you to be our ambassadors to
your friends, loved ones, colleagues, actors of the seismic risk and share the
campaign with them! The bigger the number of
participants in the campaign, the greater will be the developments that we will
achieve for the Quakeshare network!

QuakeShare, le réseau d'alerte aux séismes, mondial et solidaire

Pourquoi une campagne de crowdfunding (financement participatif) ?
Le réseau QuakeShare est un nouveau système d’alerte pour les séismes. Ce
système a vocation à fonctionner partout dans le monde et à alerter les
populations à travers leurs smartphones, dès les premières secondes du séisme,
c’est-à-dire avant que les réseaux de télécommunications ne soient perturbés ou
endommagés.
Aujourd’hui seules les zones les plus
développées (Californie, Japon) disposent de systèmes ciblés d'alerte. Grâce
aux nouvelles technologies numériques (réseaux et téléphones) disponibles
partout dans le monde, nous voulons mettre cette solution à disposition du plus
grand nombre. Des vies peuvent être épargnées !                                                                   

L'App QuakeShare, installée sur les
smartphones, permettra de déclencher une alerte face aux séismes, compréhensible quelle que soit la
langue de l'utilisateur. Elle lui permettra de se localiser par rapport à
l’évènement.              Les smartphones les plus proches de
l'épicentre serviront de sentinelles pour le réseau. Les autres, plus éloignés,
seront alertés avant même l'arrivée du séisme. Ils permettront de gagner de
précieuses secondes pour se mettre en sécurité et réduire leur risques.                    Le réseau QuakeShare alertera les secours dès les premières secondes du séisme. Il leur fournira une cartographie en temps réel des sinistrés. Les secours gagneront un temps précieux pour porter assistance dans une situation où antérieurement ils n'auraient disposé d'aucune information.   Les utilisateurs de l'App QuakeShare
pourront rassurer leurs proches et connaître leur situation. Ils
pourront contribuer
efficacement aux secours en informant sur les dégâts, sur les victimes et sur
l'évolution de la situation sur le terrain.
Avant le séisme, ils pourront se
préparer de manière ludique et réaliste.                                                                                               Nous souhaitons financer le
développement du réseau QuakeShare grâce au crowdfunding. 
En le bâtissant ensemble nous préservons
notre indépendance et nous garantissons son fonctionnement mondial.Nous avons réalisé les études
préliminaires au niveau géophysique et sur la sensibilité des capteurs
embarqués dans les smartphones. Nous devons finaliser les recherches sur les
smartphones et construire, puis optimiser l’ensemble des éléments techniques de
la solution. Vos dons permettront ainsi de réaliser les éléments centraux,
indispensables au fonctionnement du réseau.



L’application QuakeShare sera téléchargeable sur GooglePlay

A qui s'adresse QuakeShare ?QuakeShare s'adresse, d'une part, à
toute personne vivant, travaillant ou se déplaçant en zone sismique, dans le
cadre professionnel ou personnel, pour les loisirs ou le tourisme ; et, d'autre part, à toute personne
voulant aider les populations les plus exposées face aux séismes.                                   

Quel est le rôle du donateur ?Le donateur est fondateur du réseau
d’alerte. La solidarité qu'il témoigne en sponsorisant les premières zones de
déploiement du réseau est une aide extraordinaire pour les plus démunis face
aux séismes.
Il a le privilège de vivre l'aventure de
la création du réseau, de suivre de l'intérieur les avancées et les
réussites :

Il pourra découvrir l'Application avant tout le monde, en tant
     que beta-testeur
Ses commentaires seront pris en compte de manière privilégiée,
     et nous aidera à rendre la solution plus efficace et plus conviviale.
Il sera informé régulièrement de l'évolution du réseau, pourra
     contribuer à renforcer son développement.
Il pourra échanger avec tous les autres membres du
     réseau : partager son expérience du tremblement de terre ou apprendre
     les bonnes pratiques.
Dès l'opération de crowdfunding, il est
invité à jouer un rôle actif d'ambassadeur du réseau en le faisant connaître.

Le donateur est le partenaire de QuakeShare.
Il fournit un support financier et moral, gage de notre réussite. Il aidera
donc concrètement à sauver des vies.                        
Qui développe QuakeShare ?QuakeShare est développé par la société CynSIS, basée en France.                                   
CynSIS conçoit des
dispositifs fiables et innovants pour structurer et partager des données
vitales en cas de catastrophe environnementale.Ces dispositifs permettent : 
De
     sauver des vies en fournissant en temps réel des informations cruciales
     sur la géolocalisation et l'état des personnes victimes ou témoins.
À l'ensemble des acteurs impliqués
     dans la gestion d'une crise, de se mobiliser plus rapidement et de mieux
     agir collectivement en temps réel.
Et avant cela de bien se préparer.

Nous sommes soutenus par la
Banque Publique française d’Investissement, l’Agence Spatiale Européenne (ESA),
l'INRIA, l’Incubateur PACA-Est, la Communauté d’Agglomération de Sophia
Antipolis (06), EURECOM, le BA06 Event, et d'autres partenaires privés.
Pierre-Marie Sarant est le
Président fondateur de la société. Il est intervenu depuis plus de 30 ans dans
plus de 50 pays à l'occasion de crises humanitaires et de catastrophes
naturelles, dont 14 séismes. Son expérience l'a amené à un double constat :
d'une part, le manque de partage de connaissances scientifiques et
d'informations critiques ; d'autre part la sous-utilisation des technologies
numériques.
C'est pourquoi il a
privilégié les nouvelles technologies et s'est entouré d'une équipe d'experts
pluridisciplinaire : géophysique, télécommunications et réseaux, nouvelles
technologies, système d'informations géographiques, géographie, éducation aux
risques, médecine d'urgence, santé au travail...


Pourquoi le Réseau QuakeShare est nécessaire ?
Nous avons conçu le Réseau QuakeShare d'alerte sismique mondial et
solidaire en tenant compte des retours d’expérience sur les comportements
individuels et collectifs, que ce soit pendant les secousses sismiques, dans la
gestion de la crise ou à plus long terme dans les zones concernées.Des leçons ont été tirées des autres systèmes d’alerte, de leur
usage et des besoins des populations.
Le réseau QuakeShare a pour objectif de couvrir ces
manques et répondre aux besoins identifiés.

La prévention des séismes a encore des limites. Personne ne peut savoir où se produira
     précisément le prochain séisme majeur. Mais on sait que chaque année il y
     a plus de 150 séismes potentiellement destructeurs.



Les systèmes d’alerte
     sont insuffisants. Leurs équipements sont très onéreux. L'alerte peine
     à atteindre toutes les personnes concernées. Les zones sismiques
     totalement surveillées sont rares.



Le risque sismique est
     complexe et le niveau de préparation des populations est encore très
     faible. Les
     populations sinistrées ont rarement bénéficié des enseignements tirés de
     séismes précédents. 


La mobilisation des secours est encore trop lente face aux
     difficultés à atteindre les victimes. 

Aujourd’hui 530 millions de personnes vivent dans des zones
     sismiques connues.           
Plus d'information à propos de QuakeShareLes nouvelles possibilités offertes par les technologies numériques, la couverture de plus en plus forte par les réseaux de télécommunications mobiles de la majorité des zones sismiques, l'acceptation accélérée des smartphones par la population mondiale offrent des possibilités uniques pour réduire l'impact des séismes.En 2013, 1 milliard de smartphones ont été vendus dans le monde, amenant une progression rapide des taux de pénétration. La part de marché d'Android est de 78,6% soit 794 Millions de smartphones vendus.(source IDC)

Quels sont les besoins de financement pour activer le réseau QuakeShare ?Avec vos dons nous réaliserons progressivement l'App QuakeShare. La version 1 pourra être livrée en janvier 2015. Plus nous recevrons de dons, et plus les versions s'enrichiront vite :    



Quelles
sont les contreparties pour les donateurs ?
10$ – BASIQUE
Chaque donateur recevra
pour lui-même 1 App QuakeShare avec l’abonnement à vie au service d’alerte,
avant fin janvier 2015+ Remerciement sur
Facebook+ Mention sur une page
spéciale du site internet de QuakeShare

les proches du donateur ou sinon à distribuer dans une zone sismique au choix
de l'équipe QuakeShare

sismique au choix de l'équipe QuakeShare

App QuakeShare pour les proches du donateur ou sinon à distribuer dans une zone
sismique au choix de l'équipe QuakeShare

BASIQUE+ 20
App QuakeShare+ Le donateur a la
possibilité de choisir la zone sismique de sa donation, un pays, une région à
l'intérieur d'un pays ou un groupe de personnes dans un même pays

QuakeShare+ Le donateur a la
possibilité de choisir la zone sismique de sa donation, un pays, une région à
l'intérieur d'un pays ou un groupe de personnes dans un même pays

BASIQUE+ 100 App QuakeShare+ Le donateur a la
possibilité de choisir la zone sismique de sa donation, un pays, une région à
l'intérieur d'un pays ou un groupe de personnes dans un même pays+ Le donateur pourra
participer à une web-conférence avec le fondateur du Programme+ Le nom du donateur
figurera dans les Remerciements sur l’App dans la rubrique Bronze.

figurera dans les Remerciements sur l’App dans la rubrique Silver+ Une journée de formation
à la préparation au séisme pour une personne sur le site de la société (coût du voyage,

QuakeShare.

l'Application QuakeShare.Pour donner, choisissez votre contrepartie en haut à droite de cette page.

Quand et comment les contreparties seront distribuéesL’App Quakeshare sera prête avant fin Janvier 2015 et les donateurs seront individuellement avertis. Ils seront informés de la procédure d’installation et d’activation des App en fonction du nombre  prévu pour leur don.
Pour la distribution des applications
dans les zones sismiques, Cynsis s'appuiera sur des organisations reconnues qui
oeuvrent auprès de populations oubliés pour la préparation aux risques naturels
majeurs et qui ont les moyens d'organiser des exercices de simulation et de
formation des populations. Il s'agira d'un appui à un programme
préalablement prévu.
Les remerciements sur l’App QuakeShare
figureront dès la publication de la première version.  
Les remerciements sur Facebook et le
logo des organisations donatrices seront publiés sur le site web de Cynsis dès
la formalisation du don. Les journées de formation seront programmées après la campagne. 
Comment suivre les mises à jour du développement du projet

lancer avec votre aide le réseau QuakeShare d'alerte sismique, mondial et
solidaire!
Nous vous informerons régulièrement des avancements du
projet par newsletter. Si vous voulez plus d’informations ou vous avez des

sur  www.cynsis.com et www.quakeshare.com.

ambassadeurs auprès de vos amis, de vos proches, de vos collègues, des acteurs
du risque sismique et de partager la campagne avec eux ! 
Plus le nombre de participants
dans la campagne sera grand, plus nombreux seront les développements que nous
pourrons réaliser sur le réseau Quakeshare !

QuakeShare, la red solidaria y global de alerta de terremotos 
¿Porque una campaña de crowdfunding?La red QuakeShare es un nuevo sistema de alerta
de terremotos. Este sistema está diseñado para operar en todo el mundo y alertar
a la población a través de sus teléfonos móviles, desde los primeros segundos
del terremoto, es decir, antes de que las redes de telecomunicaciones se rompan
o se dañan.
Hoy en día sólo las
zonas más desarrolladas (California, Japón) disponen de sistemas de alerta
específicos. Gracias a las nuevas tecnologías digitales (redes y móviles)
disponibles en cualquier lugar del mundo, queremos poner esta solución
disponible para el mayor número de personas. Se pueden salvar vidas!                    La App QuakeShare instalado en los teléfonos
móviles, permitirá dispar una alerta de terremoto, comprensible,
independientemente del idioma del usuario. Esta app le permitirá localizar su
posición en relación al terremoto. 
Los smartphones más
cercanos al epicentro servirán como centinelas para la red. Los otros, más
lejanos, será alertados incluso antes de la llegada del terremoto. Permitirán
ganar unos segundos preciosos para ponerse a salvo y reducir su riesgo.
La red QuakeShare alertará a los equipos de
emergencias desde los primeros segundos del terremoto. Les proporcionará mapas
en tiempo real de las víctimas. Los equipos de emergencia ganarán un valioso
tiempo para ayudar en una situación en la que anteriormente no hubieran tenido
ninguna información. 
Los usuarios de la
aplicación QuakeShare podrán tranquilizar a sus seres queridos y conocer su
estado. Podrán también contribuir eficazmente a ayudar a los equipos de
emergencia informando  de los daños, las
víctimas y la evolución de la situación sobre el terreno. 
Antes del
terremoto, se podrán preparar de forma lúdica y realista.                                                                                     Nos gustaría
financiar el desarrollo de la red QuakeShare a través de crowdfunding. 
Construyéndola
juntos preservamos nuestra independencia y garantizamos su funcionamiento
global.

Hemos llevado a cabo
estudios preliminares a nivel geofísico y sobre la sensibilidad de los sensores
incorporados en los smartphones. Tenemos que concluir la investigación sobre
los smartphones y optimizar el conjunto de los elementos técnicos de la
solución. 
Vuestras donaciones
permitirán finalizar los elementos centrales, indispensables para el
funcionamiento de la red.
La Aplicación QuakeShare se podrá descargar en GooglePlay
                                                   
¿A quien se dirige QuakeShare?QuakeShare se
dirige, por un lado, a cualquier persona que vive, trabaja o desplaza a una
zona sísmica, por motivos de trabajo o personal, por ocio o turismo; y, por
otro lado, a cualquier persona que quiera ayudar a hacer frente a los
terremotos a las poblaciones más vulnerables y expuestas.                                   
¿Cuál es el papel del donante?El donante es el
fundador de una red de alerta. La solidaridad que demuestra patrocinando las
primeras zonas de despliegue de la red es una gran ayuda para los más
vulnerables frente a los terremotos.
Tiene el privilegio
de vivir la aventura de la creación de la red,  de seguir desde dentro los progresos y logros:

Podrá descubrir la App antes que todo,s como beta-tester 
Sus comentarios serán tomados en cuenta de forma privilegiada, y nos
     ayudará a hacer la solución más eficiente y fácil de usar. 
Será informado periódicamente de la evolución de la red, podrá
     contribuir a fortalecer su desarrollo. 
Podrá interactuar con todos los otros miembros de la red, compartir
     sus experiencias del terremoto y aprender las mejores prácticas.
Tras la operación
de crowdfunding, será invitado a jugar un papel activo como embajador de la red
haciéndola conocer.
El donante es
‘miembro’ de QuakeShare. Proporciona apoyo financiero y moral, garantía de
nuestro éxito. Ayudará, por tanto, en realidad salvar vidas.
¿Quien desarrolla QuakeShare?QuakeShare
es desarrollado por la empresa CynSIS, con sede en Francia.                                      CynSIS
diseña dispositivos fiables e innovadores para estructurar y compartir datos
vitales en caso de una catástrofe medioambiental. 
Estos
dispositivos permiten: 
• Salvar
vidas proporcionando en tiempo real información crucial sobre la
geolocalización y el estado de las víctimas o los testigos.
• Para
todos los actores involucrados en la gestión de una crisis, movilizarse más
rápido y actuar mejor colectivamente en tiempo real 
• Y
antes, prepararse bien.
Nos
apoyan el Banco de Inversión Pública francés, la Agencia Espacial Europea
(ESA), INRIA, la Incubadora PACA-Est, la Comunidad de Sophia Antipolis (06), EURECOM,
el BA06 Event, y otros socios privados.
Pierre-Marie
Sarant es el presidente fundador de la empresa. Intervino durante más de 30
años en más de 50 países durante crisis humanitarias y desastres naturales,
incluidos 14 terremotos. Su experiencia lo llevó a dos conclusiones: en primer
lugar, la falta de intercambio de conocimiento científico y de información
crítica; Por otra parte, la subutilización de las tecnologías digitales. 
Por eso
ha privilegiado las nuevas tecnologías y se ha rodeado por un equipo
multidisciplinario de expertos: geofísica, telecomunicaciones y redes, nuevas
tecnologías, sistemas de información geográfica, geografía, educación sobre
riesgos, medicina de emergencia, salud laboral...
¿Porque es necesaria la red QuakeShare?Hemos diseñado la red QuakeShare de alerta
sísmica global y solidaria teniendo en cuenta la información recibida sobre
comportamiento individual y colectivo, ya sea durante los terremotos, en
situaciones de crisis y, a más largo plazo, en las áreas afectadas. 
Se han aprendido lecciones de otros sistemas
de alerta, su uso y de las necesidades de la población. 
La red QuakeShare tiene como objetivo cubrir
estas carencias  y responder a las
necesidades identificadas.· 
La
prevención de los terremotos aún tiene limitaciones. Nadie  puede saber dónde se producirá exactamente el
próximo gran terremoto. Pero sabemos que cada año hay más de 150 terremotos
potencialmente destructivos.
· 
Sistemas de alerta son insuficientes. Su equipo es muy caro. La alerta lucha para
llegar a todos los afectados. Las zonas sísmicas están totalmente supervisadas
​​son raras.
· 
El riesgo sísmico es complejo y el nivel de
preparación de la población es aún muy baja. Las poblaciones afectadas rara vez se han beneficiado de las lecciones
aprendidas de los terremotos anteriores. 
· 
La movilización de los equipos de emergencia sigue
siendo demasiado lento frente a las dificultades para llegar a las víctimas. 
· 
En la actualidad 530 millones de personas viven en
zonas sismicas conocidos.     

Más información acerca de QuakeShare
Las nuevas posibilidades que ofrecen las tecnologías
digitales, la cobertura cada vez más fuerte por las redes de telecomunicaciones
de la mayoría de zonas sísmicas, la rápida aceptación de los smartphones por la
población mundial, ofrecen oportunidades únicas para reducir el impacto de los
terremotos.

En 2013, se vendieron en todo el mundo 1000 millones de
smartphones, causando un rápido aumento de la tasa de penetración. La tasa de
mercado de Android es del 78,6% o 794 millones de smartphones vendidos (Fuente:
IDC).
¿Cuáles son las necesidades
de financiación para activar la red QuakeShare ?Con vuestras donaciones
desarrollaremos de forma progresiva la App QuakeShare. La versión 1 se podrá
entregar en enero de 2015. Cuantas más donaciones recibamos más rápido las versiones
serán más completas.
¿Cuales son las recompensas para los donantes?10$ – BASICACada
donante recibirá para sí mismo la app QuakeShare con suscripción de por vida al
servicio de alerta,  antes de finales de
enero 2015+ Agradecimiento en facebook+ Mención en una página especial de la web QuakeShare
30$ –  TRIPLEBASICA + 2
apps QuakeShare para los familiares del donante o a distribuir en una zona
sísmica a elección  del equipo QuakeShare50$ –  FAMILIABASICA + 4 apps QuakeShare para los familiares del donante o a distribuir
en una zona sísmica a elección del equipo QuakeShare100$ –  EQUIPOBASICA+ 9 apps QuakeShare para los familiares del donante o a
distribuir en una zona sísmica a elección del equipo QuakeShare200$ –  GRUPOBASICA+ 20 apps QuakeShare+ El
donante puede seleccionar la zona sísmica de su donación, un país, una región
dentro de un país o un grupo de personas en un mismo país500$ –  PEQUEÑA COMUNIDADBASICA+ 50 app QuakeShare+ el
donante puede seleccionar la zona sísmica de su donación, un país, una región
dentro de un país o un grupo de personas en un mismo país1.000$ –  GRAN COMUNIDADBASICA+ 100 apps QuakeShare+ El donante
puede seleccionar la zona sísmica de su donación, un país, una región dentro de
un país o un grupo de personas en un mismo país+ El donante
podrá participar en una conferencia web con el fundador del proyecto+ El nombre del donante aparecerá en los agradecimientos en la App en la categoría bronce2.000$ –  PEQUEÑO PUEBLOBASICA+ 200 apps QuakeShare+ El
nombre del donante aparecerá en los agradecimientos en la App en la categoría plata+ Un
día de formación en preparación para terremotos para una persona en la sede de
la empresa (gastos de viaje, alojamiento y comidas no incluidos)5.000$ –  PUEBLOBASICA+ 500 apps QuakeShare+ El
nombre del donante aparecerá en los agradecimientos en la App en la categoría
oro+ Un
día de formación en preparación para terremotos para 2 personas en la sede de
la empresa (gastos de viaje, alojamiento y comidas no incluidos)+ Para las empresas u organizaciones, su logotipo en la categoría de patrocinadores
de nuestra web durante 1 año.10.000$ –  PEQUEÑA CIUDADBASICA+ 1.000 apps QuakeShare+ El
nombre del donante aparecerá en los agradecimientos en la App en la categoría
platino+ Un
día de formación en preparación para erremotos para 4 personas en la sede de
la empresa (gastos de viaje, alojamiento y comidas no incluidos)+ Para las empresas u organizaciones, su logotipo en la categoría de patrocinadores
de nuestra web durante 2 años+ El
donante puede elegir la zona sísmica de su donación, país, región dentro de un
país, ciudad o varios pequeños pueblos o comunidades dentro de un mismo país y la
traducción de la App QuakeShare a la lengua local 20.000$ –  CIUDAD CON LENGUA LOCALBASICA + 2.000 apps QuakeShare+ El
nombre del donante aparecerá en los agradecimientos en la App en la categoría
platino+ Un
día de formación en preparación para terremotos para 8 personas en la sede de
la empresa (gastos de viaje, alojamiento y comidas no incluidos)+ Para las empresas u organizaciones, su logotipo en la categoría de
patrocinadores de nuestra web durante 2 años+ El
donante puede elegir la zona sísmica de su donación, país, región dentro de un
país, ciudad o varios pequeños pueblos o comunidades dentro de un mismo país y
la traducción de la App QuakeShare a la lengua local 
Contribuir ahora >>>
¿Cómo y cuándo se distribuirán las recompensas?El QuakeShare App estará disponible antes de finales de enero de 2015, y los donantes será informado individualmente. Recibirán el codigo de instalación y activación de sus aplicaciones, en función del número asociado con su donación.Para la distribución de las
aplicaciones en zonas sísmicas, Cynsis se apoyará en organizaciones reconocidas,
que trabajan con poblaciones olvidadas para la preparación sobre riesgos
naturales y que tienen los medios para organizar ejercicios de simulación y
formación para la población. Será un apoyo a un programa previamente previsto.Los agradecimientos en la App
QuakeShare aparecen desde la publicación de la primera versión.Los agradecimientos en Facebook y el logotipo
de las organizaciones donantes se publicarán en el sitio web de Cynsis desde la
formalización de la donación.Los días de formación serán programadas después de
la campaña.
Como seguir la actualidad
sobre el desarrollo del proyectoEn CynSIS estamos muy contentos de
poder lanzar QuakeShare App con vuestra ayuda! Os mantendremos informados regularmente
de los avances del proyecto. Si deseas más información o tienes alguna pregunta
no dudes en ponerte en contacto con nosotros en contact@cynsis.com o enviar un
mensaje en nuestra página de Facebook!Para saber más  www.cynsis.com y www.quakeshare.com
Síguenos en Twitter, en Facebook  y LinkedIn
Ayúdanos a dar a conocer
nuestra campaña de crowdfunding !Os pedimos que seáis nuestros embajadores antes
vuestros  amigos, familiares, compañeros
de trabajo, personas relacionadas con los riesgos sísmicos y que compartáis la
campaña con ellos! 
A medida que el número de participantes en la
campaña sea mayor, mas desarrollos y novedades podremos realizar en la red
Quakeshare!
Contribuir ahora >>>

story:
Background

Hello, My name is Josh Choi. I live in Geneva, Switzerland and work at ITU (International Telecommunication Union). This year I am launching an education project in a small town called Manastirea in Romania.

Manastirea is a small village with population of around 4,000 people, located in the province of Calarasi, 70km away from Bucharest, capital of Romania. 25% of population are gypsy people who have settled down at this town since around 1910's. Children aged from 3 to 12 are estimated around 600 and are living in a very poor education environment because of, firstly, lack of skilled teachers and secondly, premature marriage inherited from traditional gypsy culture, and finally lack of parents' interest in education for their children.

Especially the premature marriage is a big barrier to the education. Many teenagers drop their study and got married and have many children when they are 14 to 15 years. As a result, when they become parents, as they were not educated well and very young and inexperienced, they don’t know what to do, even don't care of education for their children. This lack of interest obviously doesn't motivate the children to learn. And then a vicious circle starts again.

There is a small Christianity –based center in the town, which I have supported summer school program every year since 2010 on a voluntary basis. One of the goals of this center is to cut this vicious circle in this town by helping children from age of 3 access to proper education. Principal of the public school (including preschool) in the town asked the center to care for especially less motivated children through an after-school program which we are now developing. One part of the program will be to educate pre-school kids of basic math skill through self-study tools such as Onebillion app.


What We Need 

For this, I am now raising funds to purchase 10tablets (both iPad and Android tablet, new and second-handed) which children can play as their self-study tools at the center (not to be distributed to each child). 
Future 
I am not a genius guy like Silicon Valley entrepreneurs and inventors. However, I am sure normal people like me can also change the world by utilizing what they have - their skills, resources and networks. We don't need to be so smart as to invent something. There are already millions of apps, websites and other materials all around the world. What we need are passion, commitment and ability of curating those sources to be able to adapt to an area where our passion is dedicated. 
I believe 'big thinking' cannot change the world without 'small start'. This initiative is a small start for a big vision that all disadvantaged children have a proper access to the essential education in Romania and beyond. I wish you join this adventure and show yourself as an example of normal but change-making people!              

  


Risks & Challenges

As I mentioned, parents in this village are not highly motivated to education for their children. Therefore, it is crucially important to convince the parents first. I would face skepticism and distrust of the parents at the beginning but will not give up and keep going to make changes.     


What we give you : 

  • Signage on the Center
  • Regular report on the activities of the Center and on learners' progress
  • Communication with the Center - teachers, volunteers and learners 
  • An opportunity for in-depth case studies


Other Ways You Can Help

  • You can also provide an in-kind contribution : donation of your old tablets. 
  • I would really appreciate if you can spread out this campaign among your friends.
  • Any advice or comments will also be highly welcomed! - if you have any relative experience, know an expert in this kind of field, or have any good ideas,

story:
We made our goal, but please keep donating!!

We set the goal at a reasonable number that we thought that we could get, and the support has been even more than expected.  But we need more!  If we qualify for the Championship competition in St. Louis, travel costs will run near $20,000.

About us

IMPI Robotics is a FIRST team of 40 students at Ferndale High School. We build a robot in 6 weeks to compete with other high school teams in First Robotics Competitions. We're the only after school STEM activity at the high school. This year we won the Standish Competition and were 2nd place at the Waterford Competition.
So why crowdfunding? We're currently ranked 8th out of 350 Michigan teams so we will be going to the State Championship and are contenders for the (world) Championship Event in St Louis!

story:
Social Entrepreneur and Ashoka Fellow Gregory John Smith is the recipient of the 2014 World of Children Humanitarian Award.

This year’s award received almost 1.000 nominations from 108 countries, making it a much sought after recognition and one that is often referred to as the Nobel Prize for Child Advocacy.

The Award Ceremony will take place in New York on 06 November where Gregory will be present to receive not only his award, but also a grant of no less than $75,000 from the World of Children Award, which he aims to use as the basis for Roney & Claudiney’s Endowment Scholarship Fund (read Roney & Claudiney’s story here) to provide life-changing scholarships for underprivileged, young people attended through his Children At Risk Foundation.

Gregory gave up his comfortable lifestyle in Norway and moved to Brazil in 1993, where he invested all his time and funds, working to rescue and defend the rights of street and community children in and around São Paulo.

About the award, he says:

“I feel extremely honoured to receive this important recognition from the World of Children Award Committee for my work with children and for my organization’s efforts to keep children and youth off the streets in Brazil for more than two decades.

This award will certainly bring renewed hope and inspiration to me and all those wonderful people who have shared my vision, supported and helped my organisation to fulfil the dream that I envisioned more than 20 years ago; that if we together could contribute just some of our privileged capacities to save the life of one underprivileged child from the streets, exposed to drugs and violence, then our mission would not be in vain. Today, I know we have saved many and this award only reinforces the fact that we are not alone in our efforts to make this world a better and safer place for our children.”

After 21 years of running his many projects and programs for at-risk children in Brazil, Gregory recognizes the value of every small contribution in helping to realize the dreams of the children his organization serves. Therefore, he is appealing to you through this crowd funding campaign, to help him to double the grant money he will be receiving from the World of Children Award within the next 30 days, thus creating an even more solid basis for his Scholarship Fund.

It may not be possible for you to share your life with such a noble cause, but it is possible for you to contribute something towards Roney & Claudiney’s Endowment Scholarship Fund. Roney and Claudiney were not so lucky and their time ran out before they could get an education (again, please read their story here), but your support could help many other children assisted by Gregory’s organization to get a better education.

So please, contribute with any amount and share our campaign with your friends and family to help double the impact and also the Scholarship Fund!

Give them a hope, give them an Education!

story:
Camrose Public Library Book Bike Project: “Literacy on wheels”

Camrose, Alberta is a vibrant prairie community in Central Alberta. We love to be active, we love to be social, and we love to be outdoors!

Camrose Public Library enjoys being a social gathering place for the community in the hub of downtown. In 2014, over 100,000 people visited us and almost 20,000 people took part in library programs.

At times, in a community that covers 42.5 square km, patrons cannot come to us and we want to venture out where the stories are! Since we haven’t worked out how to move our building, we want to invest in a Library Book Bike in order to bring words, stories, music, and more to those who aren’t able to come to us.

The Camrose Book Bike Project would like to bring books to seniors and shut-ins. We also would like to be an iconic mobile unit to bring stories and the Summer Reading Program to community parks. We’d like to visit schools, farmers markets, and even to participate in the BVJ parade. We want to be where you are!

The Camrose Book Bike will have a regular route around Camrose where books can be signed out, swapped and enjoyed. We dream of story times in playgrounds and providing a mobile wireless hotspot from the bike, but first…we need a bike!

The Book Bike we are raising money for is a three wheeler cargo bike with the cargo area built to hold books and programming supplies. We will purchase our Book Bike at Green Gear in Camrose, but if you’d like to see something similar, check out: http://www.haleytrikes.com/bookbike.html

Cost:

The Book Bike, including assembly and shipping costs approximately $3,000 so we’ve launched this Indiegogo campaign to raise the money to purchase this.

We will issue a tax receipt for any donations over $25.

Other ways you can help:

  • Visit us in person at the library.
  • Like our Facebook Page to keep in the loop of all things Book Bike and all things Library.
  • Share our Indiegogo page with friends.
  • Spread the word.

story:
Short Summary

The 4th and 5th grade gifted education classes in St. Clair R-XIII School District participate in a creative problem solving competition called Destination Imagination. 

This year, two Edgar Murray Elementary teams qualified for Destination Imagination Global Finals at the Missouri Creative Adventures Destination Imagination competition held in Joplin on April 12, 2014.  

Laughing Lollypops

The "Laughing Lollypops" team is a group of four creative girls.  Their central challenge is the Fine Arts Challenge called "Laugh ART Loud," and they are required to  theatrically present a comic strip based on a work of art created by an artist of their choice.  Their performance incorporates the work of Joan Miro'.  Their comic strip tale begins in a dentist's office where the patients are put to sleep and wake up in a candy land based on "The Village," painting by Joan Miro'.  The highlight of their performance is is when they sing their parodies of the "Oompa Loompa'" song. These girls will really have you LAUGH ART LOUD!

Super Six

You will definitely BEE impressed by the "Super Six!"  Their solution to the scientific challenge will have you buzzing!  Their Scientific Challenge, "Going to Extremes," requires team members to explore an extreme environment and create extreme gear to live in that environment.  When Douglas shrinks himself with his science fair experiment, his whole world changes.  He is forced to find a way to adapt to the sticky situation.  How would you adapt to living in a bee hive?

What We Need

In order to attend Global Finals, we need to raise $7,535.  The cost covers lodging, meals, and events for ten team members and one team manager. 

10 students X $685 = $6,850

1 team manager @ $685

Total:  $7,535


What You Get

For every donation of $25 or more, the “Laughing Lollypops” and “Super Six” will mail you a hand written thank-you card and a 5X7 autographed photo of the team members at Destination Imagination Global Finals. 

For every donation of $50 or more, the Laughing Lollypops and Super Six will mail you a hand-written thank-you card, a 5X7 autographed picture of the team members at Destination Imagination Global Finals, and a team created trading pin. 

For every donation of $100 or more, the Laughing Lollypops and Super Six will mail you a hand-written thank-you card, an 8X10 autographed picture of the team members at Destination Imagination Global Finals, a photo CD,  and a team created trading pin.


The Impact

Global Finals is the world's largest celebration of creativity. Over 1,300 teams from 45 states, 7 Canadian provinces, and 13 countries gather to showcase their Challenge solutions.

At Global Finals, students will share solutions to challenges they've been preparing for for months!   They will meet creative kids from around the world, and they will participate in many educational opportunities while at the University of Tennessee. This is an experience of a life-time! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to make a monetary donation, you can still help us out by making some noise about your campaign.  Please share this with others!

The Laughing Lollypops and Super Six thank you for your generosity!

story:
PLEASE HELP US TRANSLATE THIS FILM INTO SPANISH SO THAT WE CAN REACH SPANISH SPEAKING FAMILIES AROUND THE STATE.

THE FUNDS RAISED HERE WILL PAY FOR TRANSLATION AND PROMOTION.

POR FAVOR AYUDANOS A TRADUCIR ESTA PELICULA AL ESPANOL PARA QUE PODAMOS LLEGAR A LAS FAMILIAS DE HABLA HISPANA EN EL ESTADO.

LA TRADUCCION SE PAGARA CON EL DINERO QUE GANEMOS ATREVES DE LA CAMPANIA INDIEGOGO.

Arts is the Root: Why Arts in Schools Matter. Produced by Arts Ed Matters, this twelve-minute film explores the stories of artists, educators, parents, administrators, politicians and young people whose lives have been transformed by their participation in visual and performing arts education. The film addresses current research on the transformative power of the arts, their vital role as an educational resource, and how community members can become empowered to work for increased access to arts education in their local schools. Visit www.artsedmatters.org 

for more information.

story:
Teddy Bear Tea is, simply put, magic. 

The hotel in which the Teddy Bear Tea is held is breathtaking. The lobby is draped in shining, sparkling lights, dangling crystals, and dozens of elaborately decorated trees. The tea ballroom looks like a scene from Santa's Workshop. Santa, Mrs. Claus, Rudolph, and other characters move throughout the tables as tea-goers in fancy dresses enjoy bottomless glasses of hot chocolate and delicious pastries. As full and happy little girls file out of the ballroom, they are handed a teddy bear as a memento. Something they can look at to help them remember this wonderful day. 

Your donation would be giving our girls an experience they'll never forget. 

If you have it in your hearts to donate, our girls and I would greatly appreciate it.

story:
The Chance of a Life Time for Learning and Healing

I am a Master’s student in Drama Therapy at Concordia University Montreal, QUEBEC. Drama therapy and all the creative Arts therapies are at the essence of us all. We are creative beings improving our unique paths through life. The Creative Arts allow us a unique tool with which to explore our inner selves and transform our lives. As method used by therapists in many settings for many years Drama therapy and Theatre have been used by many to work in a new and empowering way to help heal wounds, and transform conflicts and trauma within families, across cultures and between nations.

 

This June 2011, I will venture forward on a new project and one of my deepest passions.  I will join drama therapists and fellow students in urban and village settings in Kenya and Uganda, where we will exchange knowledge and techniques with African theatre practitioners, counselors, social workers, and other group leaders who help heal and transform their communities.

 


THE PROJECT

Using applied theatre and drama therapy methods, our work with community leaders will focus on several outcomes:

 

   In Nairobi, Kenya, working with the Amani People's Theatre (http://www.aptkenya.org/whoweare.html) we will focus on street children in remand homes

 

   In Budondo village, Uganda, working with the Atua Theatre Troupe, Budondo Intercultural Center (http://budondo.wordpress.com), we will focus on women’s reproductive health.

 

   In the Great Rift Valley in northern Kenya, and villages near the coast of the Indian Ocean, we will focus on preventing election-related violence

 

   In Northern Uganda, we will focus on rehabilitating and healing trauma in child soldiers after 20 years of war.

 

   Another group we will be working with is the Rifiki Participatatory/Forum Theatre Troupe (http://www.rafiki-theatre.org).

 

PREPARATION

 Before our departure to Kenya and Uganda, I will receive intensive training from the leadership for this service adventure. The work will focus on theatre, movement and somatic practices. Using a combination of practices and skills of all. During our work in East Africa we will hold debriefing and reflection sessions after each phase.

 

The mission of those who I will be joining is to find the bridges between personal exploration and service to humanity. The leaders will use their expertise in Theatre of the Oppressed, Developmental Transformations, Playback Theatre, Psychodrama/ Sociodrama, Contact Improvisation and Authentic Movement.

Since 2007 they have been collaborating with African theatre practitioners in a cultural exchange. Together we will be cultivating an approach that combines African and American perspectives on personal and societal healing through the theatre arts.


THE TEAM

I will undertake this service with drama therapists with significant experience in Kenya and Uganda, as well as significant experience in Theatre of the Oppressed, Playback Theatre, Applied Theatre and Developmental Transformations. Leading the trip will be the following: 

   Mecca Burns, MA, RDT-BCT,  a founding member of Presence, is a Registered Drama Therapist and Board-Certified Trainer. She has served as Project Director for the Charlottesville Living History Initiative for the past four years.  She contributed two chapters to the textbook: Interactive and Improvisational Drama: Varieties of Applied Theatre and Performance [Adam Blatner, 2007]. Her chapters are called “Theatre of the Oppressed” and “Cultivating a Presence in a Community Through Applied Theatre”.  She was a research associate for Transforming Leadership: A New Pursuit of Happiness [James MacGregor Burns, 2005]. Mecca has previously worked with Amani People's Theatre and Atua Theatre Troupe. www.contactpresence.org

   Brad Stoller, MFA is an award winning playwright and performer.  Brad is accomplished in various forms of  movement practices which he has studied over the past 25 years including Contact Improvisation, Aikido, Yoga, and the Alexander Technique.  He is a member of two improvisational theatre companies and is presently the president of the McGuffey Artists Association in Charlottesville, VA.  He is the Set and Lighting designer for Hampton Sydney College and also teaches playwriting and theatre history. Brad also has previously worked with Amani People's Theatre and Atua Theatre Troupe. www.contactpresence.org

   Fred Landers, MA, RDT-BCT, CAT, is a Registered Drama Therapist and Board Certified Trainer, with significant training in Developmental transformations (DvT). He practices drama therapy in New York City, working with post-traumatic stress disorder, violence and sexually abused children. Fred has taught drama therapy in China, Vietnam and other countries. www.codaptiveplay.com

  

   Armani People's Theatre http://www.aptkenya.org/

 

   Atua Theatre Troupe and Budondo Intercultural Centre http://budondo.wordpress.com

PERSONAL BACKGROUND


I am currently studying drama therapy at Canada’s only Creative Arts Therapies Master’s Program at Concordia University in Montreal, Canada. In my first year of study working as an intern therapist at Expression LaSalle (http://www.expressionlasalletherapies.ca/), a community mental health clinic, I worked with both groups and individuals exploring themes of self-esteem, grieving, trust and friendship. Next year I will have the privilege to work at the Jewish Hospital’s Child psychiatry Day center under the supervision of Dr. Jaswant Guzder. I will also be working on my research project into the meaning of home at “La rue des Femmes” a homeless shelter and day centre for women (http://www.laruedesfemmes.org/en).

I have spent many years in the film industry and have spent the last two years re-orienting myself back to my roots- to the social work and theatre where I first began:

NONPROFIT SECTOR EXPERIENCE

 

L’atelier d’artisanat centre-ville/Boutique Notre-Place: Store staff in a

boutique set up to re-integrate psychiatric patients into the work force through the

creation and selling of arts and crafts. Worked with the students to encourage and support

their work with customers and the day-to-day running of the boutique.

 Planned Parenthood, Ottawa: developed and taught theatre and voice workshops to

youth in the context of youth-issue awareness training. (School tour throughout Ottawa area).

 Youth Services Bureau, Ottawa Ontario  youth care worker- intervention and

counselling, youth parents and school.

TEACHING/WORKSHOP CREDITS

5 years teaching voice, theatre, movement- freelance with Studio 101, Children’s Creations

AQTIS (Association quebecoise des techniciens de l’image et son)

Liaison between various film productions, union technicians and union

counsellors. Responding to union members enquiries and assisting in the handling of

employee relation issues on health and safety standards are.

 

 

•   You can check out my filmography at:

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0287718/


•   But more importantly get involved with my present project- it drives me, it inspires me and it will happen!



What I Need & What You Get

In order to start on this journey, I need to raise money to cover the cost of travel and expenses I’ll incur (approximately $2,000 for airfare, plus travel expenses between Kenya and Uganda, $20/day living, visas, vaccines and on it goes). Any donations you can provide are deeply appreciated.

 

You can also help me by spreading the word to others through Facebook, Twitter, email and in your daily interactions. Spread the world and help me realize this project!

 

I will be filming as much of this project as allowable and will present the results of our work later this fall. Stay tuned on Facebook!

Other Ways You Can Help

I also invite you to donate material goods or contacts you have in order that this project may continue next year and help provide physical as well as emotional benefits to the villages we are visiting.

If you have connections with companies with solar panels, computer equipment etcetera. PLEASE CONTACT ME ASAP
story_txt:
The Chance of a Life Time for Learning and
Healing 
I am a Master’s student in Drama Therapy at Concordia
University Montreal, QUEBEC. Drama therapy and all the creative Arts therapies
are at the essence of us all. We are creative beings improving our unique paths
through life. The Creative Arts allow us a unique tool with which to explore
our inner selves and transform our lives. As method used by therapists in many
settings for many years Drama therapy and Theatre have been used by many to
work in a new and empowering way to help heal wounds, and transform conflicts
and trauma within families, across cultures and between nations.
 
This June 2011, I will venture forward on a new
project and one of my deepest passions. 
I will join drama therapists and fellow students in urban and village
settings in Kenya and Uganda, where we will exchange knowledge and techniques
with African theatre practitioners, counselors, social workers, and other group
leaders who help heal and transform their communities.
 


THE PROJECT


Using applied theatre and drama therapy methods, our
work with community leaders will focus on several outcomes:
 
   In
Nairobi, Kenya, working with the Amani People's Theatre (http://www.aptkenya.org/whoweare.html) we will focus on street
children in remand homes
 
 
   In
Budondo village, Uganda, working with the Atua Theatre Troupe, Budondo Intercultural Center (http://budondo.wordpress.com), we will focus on women’s
reproductive health.
 
   In the
Great Rift Valley in northern Kenya, and villages near the coast of the Indian
Ocean, we will focus on preventing election-related violence
 
   In
Northern Uganda, we will focus on rehabilitating and healing trauma in
child soldiers after 20 years of war.
 
   Another group we will be
working with is the Rifiki Participatatory/Forum Theatre Troupe (http://www.rafiki-theatre.org).
 
PREPARATION
 Before our departure to Kenya and Uganda, I will
receive intensive training from the leadership for this service adventure. The
work will focus on theatre, movement and somatic practices. Using a combination
of practices and skills of all. During our work in East Africa we will hold
debriefing and reflection sessions after each phase. 
 
The mission of those who I will be joining is to find
the bridges between personal exploration and service to humanity. The leaders
will use their expertise in Theatre of the Oppressed, Developmental Transformations,
Playback Theatre, Psychodrama/ Sociodrama, Contact Improvisation and Authentic
Movement.
Since 2007 they have been collaborating with
African theatre practitioners in a cultural exchange. Together we will
be cultivating an approach that combines African and American perspectives on
personal and societal healing through the theatre arts.



THE TEAM
I will undertake this service with drama therapists
with significant experience in Kenya and Uganda, as well as significant
experience in Theatre of the Oppressed, Playback Theatre, Applied Theatre and
Developmental Transformations. Leading the trip will be the following: 

   Mecca
Burns, MA, RDT-BCT,  a founding member of Presence, is
a Registered Drama Therapist and Board-Certified Trainer. She has served as
Project Director for the Charlottesville Living History Initiative for the past
four years.  She contributed two chapters to the textbook: Interactive
and Improvisational Drama: Varieties of Applied Theatre and Performance [Adam
Blatner, 2007]. Her chapters are called “Theatre of the Oppressed” and
“Cultivating a Presence in a Community Through Applied Theatre”.  She was
a research associate for Transforming Leadership: A New Pursuit of Happiness
[James MacGregor Burns, 2005]. Mecca has previously worked with Amani
People's Theatre and Atua Theatre Troupe. www.contactpresence.org


   Brad
Stoller, MFA is an award winning playwright and
performer.  Brad is accomplished in various forms of  movement
practices which he has studied over the past 25 years including Contact
Improvisation, Aikido, Yoga, and the Alexander Technique.  He is a member
of two improvisational theatre companies and is presently the president of the
McGuffey Artists Association in Charlottesville, VA.  He is the Set and
Lighting designer for Hampton Sydney College and also teaches playwriting and
theatre history. Brad also has previously worked with Amani People's Theatre
and Atua Theatre Troupe. www.contactpresence.org


   Fred
Landers, MA, RDT-BCT, CAT, is a Registered Drama Therapist
and Board Certified Trainer, with significant training in Developmental
transformations (DvT). He practices drama therapy in New York City, working
with post-traumatic stress disorder, violence and sexually abused
children. Fred has taught drama therapy in China, Vietnam and other
countries. www.codaptiveplay.com

  

   Armani
People's Theatre http://www.aptkenya.org/

 


   Atua
Theatre Troupe and Budondo Intercultural Centre http://budondo.wordpress.com



PERSONAL BACKGROUNDI am currently studying drama therapy at Canada’s only
Creative Arts Therapies Master’s Program at Concordia University in Montreal,
Canada. In my first year of study working as an intern therapist at Expression
LaSalle (http://www.expressionlasalletherapies.ca/),
a community mental health clinic, I worked with both groups and individuals exploring
themes of self-esteem, grieving, trust and friendship. Next year I will have
the privilege to work at the Jewish Hospital’s Child psychiatry Day center
under the supervision of Dr. Jaswant Guzder. I will also be working on my
research project into the meaning of home at “La rue des Femmes” a homeless
shelter and day centre for women (http://www.laruedesfemmes.org/en).
I have spent many years in the film industry and have
spent the last two years re-orienting myself back to my roots- to the social
work and theatre where I first began:

SECTOR EXPERIENCE
 
L’atelier

staff in a
boutique set up to re-integrate psychiatric
patients into the work force through the
creation and selling of arts and crafts. Worked
with the students to encourage and support
their work with customers and the day-to-day
running of the boutique.

youth in the context of youth-issue awareness
training. (School tour throughout Ottawa area).

enquiries and assisting in the handling of

heres the thing, if these boys are gonna make it all the way through the night, were gonna need supplies.  

Also, this is a no joke fundraiser,  we need to seriously allocate some precious funds for the much needed upkeep of everyones much lov-ed Adult Contemporary future billiards gym-nasium. 
do you want to come to a party with a zip line? DONATE.
do you want to come over and climb a rope just like you used to do in gym class? DONATE!
do you want an elevated sense of participation and self appreciation?  DONATE!

this is truly the age of the donation nation, we have a direction we want to take our venue/love space and it can't be accomplished without the selfless (yet not truly, as the rewards will be vast and immediate) giving from AC patriots like yourself, and as a great man by the name of Mark Twain once said "patriotism is the last refuge for scoundrels."  so, come be scoundrels with us, we have a basketball hoop.

oh, and the entire event will be on a live stream broadcast from USTREAM.TV so you can see your contributions put directly to work along with other donations from the elites gourmands also enlightened by true art and love.
Just go to USTREAM.TV and search for the "latke lock-in" channel! see you there!

story:
Summary

Hello, and thank you for looking at the Winning Play$ financial literacy program campaign!

 First, I’ll give you some background as to how the project came about.  I’ve been a financial journalist for over 20 years.  That’s given me a unique vantage point to see the ways in which people struggle with money.

Few things work as simply as money right?  Don’t spend more than you have.  Don’t borrow more than you can pay back.  Don’t invest more than you can afford to lose. 

 In fact, when we have problems with money, we go straight to the numbers:  Earn more, save more, spend more, but there is clearly more to financial behavior than dollars and cents.

 Money is one of the leading causes of depression.  A leading cause of divorce, and one of the major reasons people behave in ways that don’t reflect their true character.

 Frustrated by the fact that I could see from my own experiences and work that people could not create healthy financial lives, in 2002, I embarked on what became a six-year study to find out what’s really at work in our financial behavior.

 The problems became clear, our financial choices have very little to do with numbers.  I found that social messages from advertisers and the media, stereotypes about race and gender, as well as early role modeling, are among the primary drivers. 

 In 2008, I wrote a book based on my research, “The True Cost of Happiness:  The Real Story Behind Managing Your Money,” (publisher: John Wiley & Sons), which got a great deal of media attention.

It caught the eye of the White House and I was asked and created a financial education program for Historically Black Colleges and Universities on behalf of the Oval office.  That’s when my light bulb went off:  I found my passion to educate and expand the conversation about money to include more than numbers.

 In 2010, with the support of Dr James Prochaska - named one of the five most influential authors in Psychology by the Institute for Scientific Information and the American Psychological Society - and NFL Hall of Famer Ronnie Lott and his All Stars Helping Kids foundation, I used my research to create the Winning Play$ Financial Education Curriculum for high school and college students.  Over 500 participants in New York, Connecticut, Texas, and California have gone through the program.  We were recently awarded a grant from the State of Connecticut to implement Winning Play$ at a high school in Hartford, CT

 Winning Play$ is also a recipient of the United States Department of Education’s Excellence in Economic Education award and the National Association of Black Journalist’s Community Service award.

About Winning Play$

Winning Play$ is built to meet the Common Core math standards and the Jumpstart Coalition’s financial education standards. http://www.jumpstart.org/     

It is run as a full semester course or a workshop for high school and college students in schools and community based organizations like the YWCA and Girl Scouts.

Winning Play$ is a four-part program:

  1. We remind students of the skills they use every day that can be applied to smart decisions about money:  They problem-solve, they make choices, they perform under pressure. 
  2. Goals: We help them paint a picture of who they want to be and the life they want to live.  They see how money can support that journey.
  3. We examine how things like media messages, gender and racial stereotypes, as well as uninformed role-modeling can lead to bad financial decisions. 
  4. Personal finance 101: Lessons on debt, saving, investing,  etc., all in the context that being financially literate can help students be who they want to be.  Understanding money is relevant.

 The program is unique in that we measure its impact on behavior using Dr. Prochaska’s Transtheoretical Behavior Change model.  http://www.prochange.com/.  We also provide teacher training, all instructional materials, and tests.

What We Need and What You Get

Your contribution will help us make an abbreviated 7 hour version of Winning Play$ for elementary, middle, and high school students.  This will allow us to expand our current offering beyond the full semester course or workshop for just high school and college students.

In addition, currently, our evaluation is done on paper and mailed to our partners at Pro-Change to process.  Your contribution will also help us create an online evaluation tool that will make the process much more efficient and much less expensive!

Cost Breakdown

The costs for this project fall into two categories:

  1. Curriculum Development
  2. Evaluation System Development

1.  Curriculum Development: The Winning Play$ team will work our curriculum specialists to create: 

  •    7 hours of curriculum for High School.
  •    7 hours of curriculum for Middle School.
  •    7 hours of curriculum for Elementary School. 

Create Two 90 minute parent/student workshops based on the program

We estimate our combined costs for this part of the process to be $30,000.

2.  Evaluation System Development:  Pro-Change Behavior Systems will work with our production partner to:

  •  Develop Online Behavior Change assessment 
  • Develop Reporting Feature (will allow data analysis to be automated)
  • Focus Groups with new age groups:  Cognitive testing and interviews with children ages 6 - 12                                                                                         
  • Data Analysis                                       
  • Reporting                         

We estimate the costs for this part of the process to be $35,000.

If we fall short of our goal, we will use the funds we raise for curriculum development.  Any excess with go towards funding the evaluation tool.

Impact

According to the nation’s leading financial literacy research organization, The Jumpstart Coaltion, American high school students got less than half of the answers correct on a basic personal finance test.  Your support can help us start a cycle of change in the lives of many that will not only affect those around them, but give future generations the tools to make lasting change to their financial behavior.

Risks & Challenges

One of the biggest challenges in developing a program like this is to find the right partnerships and to keep the funding and manpower stream going.  One of the inspirations for this project was demand:  Some of the school boards and community based organizations that are currently using Winning Play$ have requested this abbreviated version. In addition, we are forming new partnerships with groups that plan to use this format in existing after school programs.  The beauty of our online delivery is that very little manpower is needed with the exception of initial orientation and program coordination.  We will continue to use our team as well as our relationship with All Stars Helping Kids to insure successful delivery of this abbreviated version. 

Praise from Gloria Steinem!

Icon Gloria Steinem was kind enough to write a list of the “Top 10 reasons” she wishes she had gone through Winning Play$!

MY TEN TOP REASONS FOR CELEBRATING STACEY TISDALE’S PROGRAM!

 -Gloria Steinem

 10. 85% of all women will be solely responsible for their livelihood at some time in their lives.

 9.  Divorced women are entitled to a spouse’s share of Social Security only if they were married ten years or longer. The average length of marriage in the U.S. is 9.6 years.

 8. Women use health care more than men do because of childbearing. The rate of uninsured women is growing three times faster than the rate of uninsured men.

 7.  Advertisers target women‘s insecurity about appearance. They do their photo-shopped best to keep us insecure.

 6.  Cultural messages still tell women that concern with money is a) unfeminine b) bourgeois, c) immoral, d) too hard. This is called internalized oppression.

 5.  Chances of being poor when you’re old in the U.S. are 70% greater if you’re a woman; especially a woman of color.

4. Old or not, women and children are 76% of the poor in this country; disproportionately women and children of color.

3. Even in families of inherited wealth, sons are more likely to control the business or inheritance than daughters. Indeed, sons-in-law are more likely than daughters.

2. Women are targeted for unequal pay, high interest loans, credit cards, installment buying and unaffordable mortgages largely because we don’t ask for what we’re worth, or learn about interest rates and mortgages.

1. If Stacey Tisdale had been at my college, I wouldn’t have taken a lifetime to learn what Nina Simone sang to us all, “God bless the child that has her own.”

Stacey Tisdale Bio

On air financial journalist Stacey Tisdale has reported on business and financial issues for more than 20 years. Ms. Tisdale authored a book which was released in September 2007, titled The True Cost of Happiness: The Real Story Behind Managing Your Money. (Publisher: John Wiley & Sons).  A financial expert, Stacey has created a financial literacy curriculum called Winning Play$ for high school students in conjunction with NFL Hall of Famer Ronnie Lott’s All Stars Helping Kids Foundation. Winning Play$ was awarded the U.S. Department of Education’s Excellence in Economic Education award for 2010 and in 2011, The National Association of Black Journalists awarded Stacey its 2011 Community Service Award for the program.

  Stacey was Business Correspondent for Al Jazeera America from May 2013 to May 2014.  Before joining Al Jazeera America, she reported for PBS national newsmagazine show Need to Know, and she currently does reporting for PBS Newshour Weekend.  In addition, she is a financial expert on NBC’s Today Show and the financial contributor for Arise TV. She is also a blogger on the Huffington Post – Black Voices platform. From 2002 to 2004, Stacey filed business and consumer reports for all of the CNN networks, including, CNN, CNNI and Headline News.  Ms. Tisdale also reported for “Inside Africa,” a weekly news magazine show on CNN International. Stacey has also contributed reports to “Money Talks,” the nationally syndicated program created by BusinessWeek. Ms. Tisdale has appeared on “The Oprah Winfrey Show” as a financial expert and in O magazine.  She also writes columns for Essence Magazine.

  Her experience also includes hosting a show on “Tech Live,” TechTV’s daily news program.  During the 1990’s Ms. Tisdale was a business correspondent for CBS News, CBS MarketWatch, The Early Show, CBS Evening News, and CBS Radio. 

Please spread the word about Winning Play$!  Thank you for your consideration!

3. Even in families of inherited
wealth, sons are more likely to control the business or inheritance than
daughters. Indeed, sons-in-law are more likely than daughters. 
2. Women are targeted for unequal
pay, high interest loans, credit cards, installment buying and unaffordable
mortgages largely because we don’t ask for what we’re worth, or learn about
interest rates and mortgages.
1. If Stacey Tisdale had been at my
college, I wouldn’t have taken a lifetime to learn what Nina Simone sang to us
all, “God bless the child that has her own.”
Stacey Tisdale Bio
On air financial journalist Stacey
Tisdale has reported on business and financial issues for more than 20 years.
Ms. Tisdale authored a book which was released in September 2007, titled The
True Cost of Happiness: The Real Story Behind Managing Your Money.
(Publisher: John Wiley & Sons).  A financial expert, Stacey has
created a financial literacy curriculum called Winning Play$ for high school
students in conjunction with NFL Hall of Famer Ronnie Lott’s All Stars Helping
Kids Foundation. Winning Play$ was awarded the U.S. Department of Education’s
Excellence in Economic Education award for 2010 and in 2011, The National
Association of Black Journalists awarded Stacey its 2011 Community Service
Award for the program.
  Stacey was Business
Correspondent for Al Jazeera America from May 2013 to May 2014.  Before
joining Al Jazeera America, she reported for PBS national newsmagazine show Need
to Know, and she currently does reporting for PBS Newshour Weekend. 
In addition, she is a financial expert on NBC’s Today Show and the financial
contributor for Arise TV. She is also a blogger on the Huffington Post – Black
Voices platform. From 2002 to 2004, Stacey filed business and consumer reports
for all of the CNN networks, including, CNN, CNNI and Headline News.  Ms.
Tisdale also reported for “Inside Africa,” a weekly news magazine show on CNN
International. Stacey has also contributed reports to “Money Talks,” the
nationally syndicated program created by BusinessWeek. Ms. Tisdale has appeared
on “The Oprah Winfrey Show” as a financial expert and in O magazine.  She
also writes columns for Essence Magazine.
  Her experience also includes
hosting a show on “Tech Live,” TechTV’s daily news program.  During the
1990’s Ms. Tisdale was a business correspondent for CBS News, CBS MarketWatch,
The Early Show, CBS Evening News, and CBS Radio.  
Please spread the word about Winning Play$!  Thank you for your consideration!

story:
We need your help to Put Equality On the Map!

Jemi works as a guard, watching over a generator deep in the sugarcane fields a mile from his home. Like most of his community, Jemi grew up in poverty.  He left school at the age of thirteen to begin earning money to help support his family, eventually marrying and having a daughter. At the age of five, Jemi’s daughter died from a disease Jemi and his wife did not understand; a disease that may have been preventable if the proper resources were available.

Jemi is one of the 900 Million people around the world living in abject poverty. 

The UN has designated 49 countries as “Least Developed Countries”: 34 countries in Africa; 14 countries in Asia and the Pacific; and one country in Latin America and the Caribbean.

Jemi is one of the 900 million people living where one in seven children will die before the age of 5.

Jemi is one of the 900 million people living where the average income is less then a dollar a day.

Jemi is one of the 900 million people living with low secondary school enrollment and low adult literacy rates.

Jemi is also one of the 900 million people living on the horizon of change.  He is one of 900 million people who can have a bright future.

Change of this magnitude has been done before. With your help, it can be done again, only on a much larger scale!  And, we now have the technology to make it happen!

 

The Plan

At the end of World War II, the United States established the Marshall Plan: an infrastructure program designed to jumpstart a war-torn Europe.  The program focused specifically on infrastructure and trade. We are proposing a global Marshall Plan called The Millennium Earth Project, which offers a similar solution with a significant twist.

The Millennium Earth Project (MEP) will create virtual infrastructure in each of the 49 least developed countries using Geographical Information Systems (GIS). MEP uses the UN Millennium Development Goals as the baseline for our developmental targets.  ICGC believes the answer to effective aid is a holistic perspective founded in virtual infrastructure, providing tangible solutions from the collaborative efforts of Geographic Information System (GIS) specialists, IT, researchers, engineering, architectural, urban design experts, government representatives, NGOs and educational institutions.

Click Below To See How Interactive Maps Can Be Used In Development!


View Larger Map

 

The goal is to make these countries self-sufficient and self-empowered with answers that apply to their unique situations.

We ask for your help in creating a conscious global change; 

Join us in a development revolution. 

The Millennium Earth Project is in the final stages of our prototype phase which highlights virtual infrastructure and GIS development in three countries: Haiti, Democratic Republic of Congo and Afghanistan.  With your help we can reach our goal of $250,000 and move this program from prototype to global impact, working to improve the lives of 900 Million People.
